content: The 'upgrade to premium' button is right in the middle of the page which is really annoying. It moves over the text field every time I add a task and my list of tasks on the main page. If I click plus to add a task to tomorrow, it auto adds a reminder for 9am. Why? If I uncheck the reminder, it auto moves my task to today. Why?! If i add to Upcoming, it auto moves it to tomorrow w/ 9 am reminder. Ugh Ive been using this app for 10m & I already dislike it. I'll only stick around a little longer.
replyContent: You can dismiss the premium option and keep using the app for free. If you add a task with our a due time it will add a default reminder. If you do not have a due date at all it will go under today. The goal is to get things done :)

content: I have used this app for several years, and it has worked great for me. Within the last week, I have received several pop up ads to upgrade. This was in the middle of trying to edit my list of tasks. Very distracting. They are timed so that you cannot stop them until they finish playing. There was no notification on this change of behavior. I would no longer recommend this app
replyContent: Please contact our team and we will help you regarding this under Settings-> Support.

content: I have the same recurring tasks to do every day. I need a to-do-list reminder to buzz me when it's time. The problem with this app, is that those reminder times somehow start drifting every day, giving me different times the next day! That is an annoying fail! Screw it, I'm going elsewhere. if I find a better app, I'll let you guys know. UPDATE : Suggestion did not work, and I found an app, that does not drift. I have moved on.
replyContent: Our team will be happy to look into it for you, should you submit a bug report via the app's Settings - Support. That said, if this is not the type of solution you are looking for, we respect your decision to move to a different app.

content: Instead of shopping around, I downloaded Any.do because of how widely used it is. Setting up one day's schedule should have taken me just a couple of minutes. But the app seemingly randomized which day of the week an entry was for. On two occasions, it picked a day over a year away. After twenty minutes of fighting the app, I finally had my schedule together. I spent another ten minutes trying to get any notifications to work, with no luck. Fortunately, uninstalling only took a few seconds.
replyContent: We are not aware of any issues with randomized times for entering tasks, so that sounds odd. As per the notifications, there may be an issue with your device allowing the app to send notifications properly. If you're still experiencing any issues, kindly let us know at- www.any.do/contact_form, so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: I was a big fan of this app, but the recent UI change made it extremely tedious to perform the basic function of setting a reminder for an event. Please bring back the 9am/3pm/6pm presets as before! It's annoying to have to click through so many buttons now just to do this. Edit: why won't it let me add a reminder for later in the day? It's 9:30am and I want to set a reminder for 1pm. I hit Custom, and now every time past noon is greyed out and it literally won't let me set a 1pm reminder. This is a bug, please fix.
replyContent: This is very strange behavior for your reminders! If this is happening, we highly recommend you submit a bug report in your app so we can get to the bottom of this issue for you.

content: This app is deceivingly terrible. There are some really nice design features like the home screen widget. All of this nice user experience is trashed by the "POP UNDER" that doesn't turn off. Every day, it's there waiting for you when you turn on your phone. I have all alerts in app turned off, my phone blocks app notifications, and I'm on Do Not Disturb and yet, there is this annoying feature that Any.do won't allow you to disable. EDIT: I DISABLED MOMENT NOTIFICATIONS A PRIOR TO DEV COMMENT
replyContent: Hi Ryan, it sounds like you are describing our Moment notification. You can disable it from the app under Settings - Any.do Moment - Disable. If you are still experiencing any issues you're welcome to submit a bug report via Settings - Support 😊

content: Wunderlist was everything I needed and I had no issues with the app. This "replacement" tried to keep a somewhat similar format, but replaced the things that I really enjoyed from the original app. I don't like having a list app connected to Google or the rest of my accounts. I just wanted something simple that I could easily share with my family. I'm really disappointed with this forced move to a new app. Can't Wunderlist be allowed to continue to function?!
replyContent: Any.do is a task management app, which has no relation to Wunderlist, but simply allows you to import your tasks from there. Any.do has an extensive Help Center detailing how to utilize our features -https://support.any.do/. You are also welcome to contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form with any questions.

content: I have been using this app to accomplish my goals and better live my life in line with my values for almost a decade, but I absolutely hate the latest update! Each task I add is arbitrarily assigned an alarm which is an extra step to delete, and there is no way to change the setting back. Also the new "My Day" feature is completely redundant and absolutely pointless. The latest update wastes too much of my time, and I am now looking for an alternative to-do list app to replace this one.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way, the automatic reminder for dragging tasks is being reviewed by our team and we have many benefits to the My day view. Like the My Day smart suggestions and update status feature and pining tasks.

content: I have had this app for almost a year. I was really enjoying it. I mostly used it for my grocery list and weekend to do list. However, I will be uninstalling it now because it deemed it appropriate to automatically add "Welch's brand Fruit Snacks!" to my grocery list without permission. I encounter ads in a lot of places, but I refuse to use an app that panders to corporations in such a way that it starts adding branded products to my damn grocery list.
replyContent: This could happen if a user pressed on an advertisement for a product. We will be more than happy to look into this for you and sort this out, should you send us a bug report. Please submit a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report)

content: Almost perfect but the developers choose to ignore one very important thing. There are several people posting the same request. Keep the popups but stop them from interrupting other apps, which can be crucial at times. The forum posts I saw requesting this were old so it's obviously not a problem you're willing or able to fix. Otherwise I might have bought the full version but I had to uninstall
replyContent: Popups have been proven to increase productivity and is a main feature for the app right now. While we are not removing it yet, there is a UserVoice for this suggestion that you can see here: https://bit.ly/2xyuuQX. Feel free to vote for this suggestion and our dev team will take this into account for future updates.

content: Very annoyed that I have to keep signing in and then it deleted all my lists. Ive been working on a master shopping list for several months. Im trying to track what my regular purchases so that I could have just opened an app such as this, gone down my list, and checked off what I needed. But when I logged back in AGAIN, my shopping lists were gone for the third time. When it works, its great. It just doesnt work enough and I dont have time for this.
replyContent: Hi, that's odd, please send us a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you :)

content: Love the interface, love the concept. But it lacks several key features on the Android side. The app both web, and the download version have sync issues, to keep your data inline you must keep the Web version up and the if you are using the downloaded app, you must keep it running to keep anything sync. Then you will lose any type of reoccurring tasks.   Love the sub task concept, really slick but if you cannot keep them in sync it does not work very well.   Another item that does not work, though I have requested it is that face that landscape mode is not coded for in all of the app, again in both the web and app version, makes it difficult to use on a tablet if you are switching to a keyboard for example.   So because of syncing issues, missing key landscape issues in several places in the app, lose of data due to syncing issues I had to uninstall the app. Lucky for me I am using 2 or 3 to do list so I have my primary one I am still using, so nothing lost except time. Though I was really hoping this one would pan out.   So though I am marking it as 1 start, I like the concept, and lots of it, but it is buggy,, and needs some serious testing to work out the syncing issues.
replyContent: We are sorry to hear that you experience async issues! You are welcome to reach out to our support so they can help you get Any.do's sync back on track (at Customers@any.do). We are planning on adding more support for landscape mode in the future.

content: Product images show the month view at the top of the screen with dots, each one represents an event on that particular day. For android, the month view up top just shows the days of the week (no event indicators). Just an empty calendar. At the bottom of the screen there's a chronological list of events. Essentially, what I'm looking at is no more useful than list on a word document. Sure, there's a ton of bells and whistles, but the Android version is almost entirely useless as a calendar.
replyContent: We appreciate the feedback. The images for iOS and Android are intentionally different. The Android ones specifically show the calendar as it appears in the app (with dots in the daily view). All other functionality, though, is exactly the same as in the iOS app and you can vote to have the dots added here: https://bit.ly/2YGoktL.

content: What an awful UI. When creating a new reminder, the entire screen is disabled except for the text-entering line. Then you have to go back into the reminder to set options. But some of those options can only be changed via drag and drop, so if you have a lot of reminders, you will be dragging for a long time.
replyContent: To set a reminder, you only need to tap an existing task and press the "add reminder" button. Then you can choose a pre-set time or "custom" and enter your time. You should not need to open the reminders screen multiple times to add one. Also, reminders are not only editable with drag/drop. Learn more about them here: support.any.do/reminders

content: This app used to be great when paired with Alexa. Every once in awhile the sync would break but disabling the app and relinking the account would fix the issue. This has not been the case for the past several months. Any.do it is no longer syncing with Alexa and based on the reviews of the Alexa app it is affecting a lot of people, has been ongoing for weeks, and there doesn't appear to be a fix coming. Going to give anylist a try to see if it works with Alexa.
replyContent: Sorry about that, our team is currently working on a fix for this. Please submit a bug report via your app Settings - Support, so we can assist you with any further questions.

content: I really do like this app, but I have horrible problems with it crashing constantly. The stability is AWFUL. Every time I try to check something off a list, it crashes. After every single item. While it's got great structure and is easy to use otherwise, it is the most unstable app I've ever used. Just uninstalled because even updating it didn't stop it from crashing. Fix the damn app; I've submitted enough feedback about it. Highly frustrating and not worth the time.

This app was great until the latest update and the grocery list changed. Now, it's just annoying to use. It takes more steps to get to what I want to do. The app forces a default list to display that I don't use, so I have to navigate back to the home screen to get to the grocery list. I preferred generic Shopping List where I would enter all items. I don't want a different list for each store. The predictive function stinks because you have to clear the field after you add the suggested text.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way, please note that you can disable the Grocery List from your setting (Setting > set Smart Grocery List too off). You are in no way obligated to use the Smart List :)

content: Great UI/UX but INCREDIBLY buggy, especially with repeating tasks. I'll set a reminder to occur every 2 weeks but when I set that task as complete it'll move the next reminder to 3 weeks from then, then after that 4 weeks from then, and so on. Having to go back and manually change the date each time renders the app useless. Also, $40 for basic features? No thanks. I'm sticking with the default Google calendar reminders.
replyContent: Hi, that's odd, please send us a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you :)

content: This was my favorite To Do app, so much so that I purchased the Premium subscription and then notifications stopped working on my phone and desktop.  I tried double checking all the notification settings on my phone, where I want it to work most and everything looks fine.  So I tried to cancel my Premium subscription and it seems impossible.  The instructions to "manage your subscription settings" doesn't exist, so I can't get out of the premium subscription.  Their FAQs don't provide accurate instructions.  The desktop app refers you to the manage the subscription setting on your phone which doesn't exist.    I was impressed with this app initially, so my so that I purchased the premium subscription but all the notifications stopped working and I forgot I even had the app at some point until they charged me $26 for the annual subscription, so now I want out but can't get out.

edit: changed to 1 star in hopes of getting the devs attention. the plan your day feature needs a mute button. cant use this at work because the sound effects are loud and embarrassing. please fix. other than that i love it. even paid for a year of premium. old review: Best task app I've found. Simple and its integrated with my desktop through an extension, I can even build tasks from emails I get.
replyContent: We are sorry for this! Please submit a bug report by going to Settings - Support or email customers@any.do so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: Smart Grocery List From Hell. While it might be handy to sort your list by catagory. Now everything is spread out all over the place. I wanted to turn the feature back off and it will not turn off. I like to sort things in the order I travel through the store. i know where everything I purchase is located. Well can't do that any.more. Having to change the category on each item i buy to Esential household item so that i can keep everything together. what a drag!
replyContent: Please note that you can turn off the smart list by going to Settings > Smart Grocery list > OFF. Accordingly, you don't have to use this feature. Please make sure to convert all smart lists (after turning the feature off) to regular lists by tapping the list menu > convert to a regular list.

content: No longer usable.Awful Have used this free app for years for grocery and To Do lists. Was simply laid out,easy to use. For years, I created lists I could easily check and uncheck as reminders of what I needed from each store. IDK what happened in the last 6 months, but app has become useless and an exhaustive waste of my time. It completely erases the items I typed in after I have checked and saved the lists, leaving me to waste time to retype things.Have uninstalled/reinstalled. Nothing works.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: Shows tasks assigned to others in widget. A major missing feature for any serious projects, is some way to know if a task you're currently adding to a long list, already exists. Some kind of an automatic search through the existing tasks - at least the tasks in the current list - while typing in a new task. Other than that, this is great. Good job! _Task search in the web app is an extra step and not intuitive._ Using a separate search feature to check every new task you're adding, is absurd.
replyContent: Please note that the display of the Android widget relies on the display of the native app. Therefore, as long at a task appears on your tasks view, it will be reflected in the widget as well. For further questions or assistance, please contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form, and we will be happy to help.

content: Why does every once in a while... out of the blue, the app asks to update acct emails or such and then everything on my task list has been lost??? This last time, my list went back to some list I had quite awhile back... must have been the list I lost at another time. This is quite frustrating. And if I have to spend the time to make a new list, I cld just as well spend that time finding another app to use. Especially since this seems to be reoccurring. So disappointing.
replyContent: Sorry to hear that! It sounds like you might have logged in to a different account. Please submit a bug report in your app (via Settings - Support) or contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form, and we will be sure to get to the bottom of this for you :)

content: Terrible Update! This app used to be perfect for planning out when certain tasks were to be completed. The interface was easy to understand and you could see and plan as many days into the future as you wanted, and everything was perfectly broken down by date. Now when you add tasks, regardless of when they need to be completed, the app just says to do it today. It has completely eliminated the only use for this app, which was to make out a planned future.
replyContent: Please note that the tasks in your tasks view are sorted by their reminder date, to move a task to Tomorrow/ Upcoming/ Someday, simply add the relevant reminder. That said, we are unaware of any issues with tasks being set to Today, so that's odd. Please send us a bug report via your app Settings - Support, so we can look into this for you.

content: This keeps crashing, freezing, not responding. If I choose to wait, it eventually moves forward, but takes so long that it is useless. I tried restarting the app, restarting my tablet, futzing with settings, sending a report... nothing has helped. I uninstalled and re-installed the app, and it is still freezing/not responding and asking me if I'd like to quit it.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: As a programmer, this is absolutely the most lazily put together trash that I've ever come across. The basic version of this app is only meant to accomplish the simplest of tasks, but it abhorrently fails to do so. As a user, I'm appalled. My task lists were constantly being manipulated without any input on my end; I'm talking added information, reordering of items in my list, and even complete deletion of subtasks. Do not trust this app with anything of even the slightest importance.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! We encourage users to reach out to us directly in order to better understand the issue, or feedback and get to the bottom of things so we can offer a full resolution. We work hard to resolve any issues! :). If this is not the type of solution you are looking for, we respect your decision to move to a different app.

content: Edited to 1 star. It is fine for personal lists but you cannot share them with others. When you look up 'how to' any.do claims you can do this with a free account and even shows you how... With a function that does not exist in either of our apps. The only option available is exporting it in a clunky text list- no in app shared lists. Uninstalling and re installing did not update. Gonna switch I think.
replyContent: As we’ve announced on our Blog and sent by email to users with shared lists, The list sharing will be phased out in favor of our new collaboration and sharing we recently launched. You can try it out right away with a 14-day free trial. You can learn all about it here: https://www.any.do/workspace

content: The app is having some major problems. recently it's been logging me out from my Google account. After logging me in, it resets all of my options including having the terrible Moment notification. Regarding this notification, it will literally take over my phone screen and freeze up my phone. I have a stock Pixel 2, FYI. Lastly, and this is more minor, the complete item bubbles are very finicky when selecting. Half the time I will fat finger it and it then goes into editing the item mode.
replyContent:
Hi, we apologize for the issues that you are having!
What you are describing sound very odd and we would like to get to the bottom of it so you can start enjoying Any.do. 
Please submit a bug report through Settings - Support so we can figure out exactly what is going on and assist you ASAP. You can also reach us at Customers@any.do.

content: The current notification sounds each of which lasts for a couple of seconds makes the app useless. How can the developer fail to realize that the very idea of a reminder is make sure that the user is reminded. There is an excellent app on this store which is perfect in this regard. I don't want to name it but the developer has to find it and learn how reminders should be. I. Have uninstalled this app after 10 minutes of trial.

I love this app, but I do have one major gripe - I want an option to buy premium once (even at a higher price) and not as a monthly or yearly subscription. Edit - very unhappy with developer response to pricing. I want to buy premium for this great product they made, but it's NOT a service. This isn't Netflix. You're going to turn potential buyers away with this pricing model
replyContent: We ensured that Any.do would be fairly priced, basing our cost on standard business models for the industry. If you don't want to upgrade, you can continue to use Any.do for free for as long as you like. That said, you are welcome to reach out to our customer support (https://www.any.do/contact_form) to hear more about all our special offers :)

content: Was great until a recent update and now it's unusable, I've been using this for YEARS with no problems. Any sub tasks I put in just vanish, same with notes. I just tried to create a new list and it wouldn't let me. I'll just find something else at this point. Edit: support just reached out asking me to contact them. I don't have time to debug your app for you. I've already found something else.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! We encourage users to reach out to us directly in order to better understand the issue, or feedback and get to the bottom of things so we can offer a full resolution. We work hard to resolve any issues! :). If this is not the type of solution you are looking for, we respect your decision to move to a different app.

content: Don't use this app!! Any.do charged by credit card $29.99 without my permission, for a premium plan, after I'd used the free plan for quite a while. When questioned, their support team said that it was an automatic feature. Then told me that the only way to turn off this "automatic" feature was to use an app downloaded to my desktop. I only use the app on my phone and never on a desktop. They did also say that deleting this app from my phone will not cancel the automatic payment!!! Unbelievable!
replyContent: A payment can only be made upon the user's authorization. Users can upgrade from the mobile app, desktop app and from promotional links and discount links. Once the subscription is created it will renew unless it has been canceled. All of this is according to our terms of service you agreed to once you upgraded.

content: There's an issue where the bottom pop up notifications do not display in Android 10. Which is my entire reason for using this app and why I paid for a year. I understand bugs happen but I'm losing the value I paid, for a reminder app that doesn't remind me... I reached out to support, they said a fix is coming in a few weeks. I asked to have my subscription extended for the loss of use, so far no resolution. I'll give 5 stars once my money doesn't feel wasted. Thanks
replyContent: Hi, we don't support beta versions for your OS, and we have a fix for the notifications issue already out to our beta users, which you can learn more about here: https://support.any.do/super-users/ , with the update rolling out to standard users in the next few days. Because you were using a beta version of Android Q, we can't refund you.

content: I used to love this app, but recently they did a big push for premium. At the same time, I started having a huge issue with my lists not opening. The screen shows, but it is grayed out and I can't click on anything. I tried the premium to see if that would help, but it hasn't. My lists are inaccessible to me. I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app to noavail.
replyContent: You should only see the upgrade ad when you first log into your accout or when you are trying to use premium features. You can always dismiss it, though! As for the lists issue - please contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form or via Settings → Support and we will get that sorted for you! 😊

content: Redoing my review after messaging with the app for a while. Basically everything I need to do is either not there or you have to pay a monthly subscription to do it. Not worth it to think you're getting somewhere with the app finally, only to have the "upgrade to premium" page keep popping up when you try to do the only useful things in the app. S'a shame. The widget looked nice.
replyContent: Any.do is a free app, 90% of the app is completely free, including all core functionality, and unlike similar apps, we allow our users to enjoy most of the features for as long and as much as they wish without any 3rd party ads or a requirement to upgrade.

content: I had a premium. Scam.The app is very pushy and annoying. I couldn't get into 80% of my incoming calls as it blocked the screen so the call doesn't appear on the screen. You only hear it and hopelessly looking for the call screen that you only get once the call is dropped. You have to call back then. Disturbing and annoying. I barely used this app as to maintain it takes a lot of time. I asked them to cancel they said they will not refund as more than 48h passed of yearly(!) subscription.

It looked good but it doesn't work. I scheduled simple tasks and it would change the timing. I re corrected to make it right several times. The navigation was difficult. Like I'd want to set a task but then I'd have to say the task was complete so wouldn't be sure it saved. Couldn't just back out to see the task was set correctly. Had to confirm the task was done then undo the task for later which might then change the time to something I never set. 😳
replyContent: Hi, that's odd, please send us a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you :)

content: Cant skip a task... So Tick Tick isn't going to let us deal with failure in a healthy manner? Which is to accept and acknowledge over tasking yourself, and try to do better next time? I use this app to put in thing like weekly chores. Sometimes I just don't have enough time to get around to all of the recurring tasks I set. It is unbelievably fricken annoying to not have a skip for those instances. Especially since half the time I delete every occurrence just trying to get my inbox neat.

Reduced rating. Any.do Moment was the killer feature, now it is hidden in settings. My Day could be interesting, but some aspects are confusing. Sadly there is no help in the app. Worse, went to their web help and it has not been updated!!! It has no My Day page, and it still says Moment is in the old location.

So many options I would like to try..but i am discouraged by the fact that I cant even change tne color theme for free. There is no explanation of the Focus mode in the app, and the last time I did a trial with google I was charged for the "free" trial. Every dollar counts especially now, and incurring another monrhly bill just for recurring tasks and to go from blue to mauve for a theme is just unnecrssary. My search continues, and i hope the devs are reading the 1 star reviews thoroughly.
replyContent: A payment can only be made upon the user's authorization via the app and Google Play. The color Themes are a part of our Premium features, however, the Recurring Reminders feature is free! We have an extensive Help Center detailing how to utilize the features- support.any.do, and the Focus Mode is explained here- support.any.do/focus-mode.

content: Absolutely worthless. This app runs a prohibitively clunky interface that effectively voids the promise of ease-of-life automation. Google Calendar will provide all other services promised by Any do for free with no annual subscription rate. Don't sign up for the free trial. It's not worth getting pinged for forty bucks when you decide you don't like it and forget to cancel it in time. Save your money!
replyContent: We're sorry you feel this way! 90% of the app is completely free and unlike similar apps, we allow our users to enjoy most of the features for as long and as much as they wish without any 3rd party ads or a requirement to upgrade. If a plan isn't cancelled in time, it will be charged per the TOS the user agreed to upon upgrading.

content: Works decently most of the time, but I've noticed that any of the reminders I have long time (things that are supposed to remind me every day indefinitely) eventually just stop reminding me, even though they still show up on my to do list. Very frustrating. The inconsistencies make this unreliable, which essentially makes the app useless to me as a tool to plan my day around
replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with the app! We will be more than happy to look into this for you and sort this out, should you send us a bug report. Please submit a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report) with the relevant details, so we can get to the bottom of this for you!

content: What happened?? I have this app installed on my phone and it works beautifully as a calendar. Bought a new phone and the Cal app is now a full planner and to-do list. Thanks for complicating my life with every useless feature I don't want and specifically loved the Cal app for *not* including. EDIT--"Minimalist" does not describe this app. Certainly not compared to what you used to offer.
replyContent: The Cal app was deprecated a while ago as Any.do is now offering a full solution for calendar and list management. While we have millions of satisfied users world wide, we are aware that some users has different preferences and encourage you to find the proper solution for your requirements:)

content: This app has an appealing interface but the only problem with it is IT DOESN'T ACTUALLY WORK. If you want to use it for anything other than a list of things to do. It doesn't sync. It loses your data. It basically wastes your time rather than saving you time. Customer service is a joke. It's useless too. Very nice, but utterly useless. The idea that you can have assistance and delegate tasks is basically a lie because it's not available in my area and I live in Los Angeles.
replyContent: Hi Valerie, our team has already confirmed your data as well as provided you with a complete report per your query. We're not aware of any issue with the app syncing though we would be happy to continue assisting you should you reply back :) The Assistant service is currently in beta and will open up to more users in the near future.

content: Wanted to use this with my Android phone and my Alexa show. "Zapier" sync Only available for a monthly fee. Really disappointing. Was hoping this would be the answer. my Alexa list shows up separately from my any do list, which would show up separately from my Google list. so it's kind of useless I want everything to sync into one list! as I would have then used it to sync to an iPhone so our family could connect and have one list kind of stupid if I have to search through a bunch of lists.
replyContent: Hi Stefanie, please note, we create new lists in order to help try and organize all of your tasks. Furthermore Any.do is a free app. We provide 95% of our features at no cost, including all core features. We never require our users to upgrade. You can use Any.do for free for as long as you like. However Zapier is a premium feature.

content: Ugh! After years of using this app, I am so very tired of the reminders not syncing across all my media! I get notifications for the same task on my chromebook, cellphone and tablet; I have to dismiss on all three! Now that Google Tasks has reminders (and syncs across all media devices), I can create lists, AND it's free, I will probably kiss Any.do goodbye. UPDATE: Contacted Team and they confirmed sync problem, and at this time don't have a solution 🙄
replyContent: From checking our records, the issue you've reported is not related to a sync issue, this is simply the intended functionality of the Reminders. Once a task has an active reminder, it will pop-up and alert on any platform on which your account is synced. You will need to dismiss the reminder from each device accordingly.

content: Started a free trial to premium without my permission, can't take it off. Im not going to pay for it so I don't want it there so that I don't use premium features on accident and get used to them. Tried to delete account to start over and do differently but every time I type in the password to delete the account I get an error message. Waste of time. Going to use a different app.
replyContent: Our 7 days trial allows free users to give Premium a try before committing. Any user can dismiss the trial offer or take the trial and cancel before the 7 days are over and use the app for free for as long as they please. Our team would be happy to look into your subscription issue, should you contact us at www.any.do/contact_form.

content: works okay for simple one time only tasks. But for recurring tasks, it is the WORST. Sometimes it marks them done, sometimes it marks them done then recreates them to do again immediately (same day), today I had a task scheduled for 11 PM pop up at 9 AM, then when I marked it complete anyway, it rescheduled it for 3 days from now instead of tomorrow. I have a weekly task every Wednesday at 3:30 pm and when I mark it completed, it recreates it for the next week at 5:30 pm every time. So I have to delete it and recreate it with the correct time every single time. Recurring tasks DO NOT WORK in this app.
replyContent: We are so sorry for this! Recurring tasks should be working properly. Please email support@anydo.zendesk.com with the details of these issues and we will work to fix them right away.

content: After a task is done a duplicate will appear for the same task causing me to have to remove one. Then even if I haven't done a task that day it will still have one of them marked done (the duplicate is always unmarked). I believe this is due to an error in the day tracking it. It seems to be unable to tell whether or not the day is ended. It's rather unfortunate considering it is very easy to personalize and even allows you to create a grocery list. Uninstalled and will not be reinstalling :/
replyContent: We would be happy to help you resolve all of the issues you have encountered should you send us a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report).

content: This app has consistent issues with syncing. My boyfriend and I used it a few years ago, but stopped using it due to frustrating with all the syncing problems. We tried using it again recently because the app is fantastic otherwise and we wanted to give it another shot. Still our shared lists refuse to sync often enough that the app is more hassel than help. The app is great if you don't need to share lists with another person though.

I downloaded the app, tried the free trial, and forgot to cancel in time. I didn't have a use for the app but left it installed because I was paying for it. Even after turning off notifications it would pop up to give me my to do list every day. It would also randomly alert me that items have been added to my shopping list. For not using the app ever, I have a very full shopping list of things I don't want or need. And I didn't click an ad to add it, since I don't even use the app.
replyContent: If you are referring the the "Plan my day" pop up, you can disable it under settings-> moment. Regarding the added items, please contact our team so they can look into this matter for you at https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: $$$ Im being charged a full year up front and not at end of year or monthly as advertised! Great app, and i was hoping to enjoy it. I have been busy so i didnt have time to appreciate the 7 day trial, and that is ok, so i was going to do that during first month in wich should cost me about +-$3.00. But instead i was charged $35.88 right at the end of first week. When i went tovunsubscribe, it said I'd have to keep full year subscription, so there is NO monthly... Messed me up, im NOT rich!
replyContent: A payment can only be made upon the user's authorization, and we allow you to switch up or cancel your subscription plan, in accordance with our TOS. That said, our team will be happy to assist with any subscription issues, should you contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form.

content: This app does not warn you when doing the trial that if you choose to cancel that you have to contact their support to do so. Theres a delete account option or a sign out one...they do the same thing and doesnt stop the payments. This doesnt stop them from charging you anyways and is a huge inconvenience. If it werent for this terrible service and unreasonable price I would have kept. Will not recommend.
replyContent: Since the trial was created through Google Play, it must also be canceled through Google Play under the subscriptions tab. To check if you are eligible for a refund, please contact us at Premium@any.do.

content: This app navigated itself to its Google play subscription function while my phone was locked and in my pocket and attempted to subscribe itself to the yearly premium option without my knowledge or permission. It failed as my account did not have enough to cover it. This program is malware, and I will be contacting Google Play to get it removed.
replyContent: In order for an Any.do subscription to be registered, it need to be verified by the user both on the app's end and via a native Google Play screen. Any.do is a trusted app by Google Play and promoted by it constantly. All payments via Google Play are done according to their policy and you're welcome to contact them directly to verify this.

content: I downloaded this because of the cross platform syncing. I only purchase apps after learning the free version. I see the potential but will delete because: 1) constant advertising the premium version - which is keeping me from being productive - which is counter productive 2) It seems on desktop version that I don't have a choice on calendar to see day, 3 days, week, month 3) and again the pop up for premium Anyway. On to the next planner app.
replyContent: The Premium ad only shows up when first opening the app, and when clicking on a Premium feature. You can opt out by clicking on 'No, Thanks' on the ad. The Calendar view on the desktop app, currently supports the Agenda view, though, we are currently working on adding further functionality to the desktop calendars, so keep an eye out for updates :)

content: Watch out if you get premium - you can only unsubscribe via the way you signed up. e.g. If you signed up on desktop you can't unsubscribe in the app. There isn't even a link to unsubscribe on the website. They don't send any renewal notifications so best thing to do is sign up and cancel premium straight away as you will still get to use it until the expiry date. That way if you end up removing the app you won't forget to unsubscribe. They could choose to be better, but don't

I have sent several bugs through the Any.do (both normal and priority) about a subscription issue that I have. According to the app, I am a Premium member. I have reached out to Support about discontinuing my subscription and hopefully getting a refund. When following Any.do's website directions to cancel my premium subscription, nothing showed up on the Play Store subscription managing page. Therefore, I cannot do anything, but hope that the Any.do team reaches out and helps resolve this issue.

January 2021: In short..I'm done, and moving on from any.do. What was one of my "go to" apps, solid 5 stars, is now unreliable, buggy, and all i hear from support is "well, our developers say thats 'intended behavior'..". Well, when new so-called intended behavior now makes the app more unreliable, to the point of unusable, its time to find a new app to replace any.do. And thats exactly what I'll be doing, and then pushing the "uninstall" button for any.do. November 2020: This was a 4-5 star app for me for years, but now since what appears to have happened during a major update in October, I can't give more than 3 stars. I'm posting this here in the hopes that maybe others are experiencing the same issue, and that will prompt more serious investigation by the any.do staff. The issue I am seeing occurs when setting a reminder for a future date. Go thru the usual process, app records the reminder date/time correctly, then sometimes minutes, or even seconds later, the reminder shows up as a current task under "today". Its happening intermittently, but at least 50% of the time. I've used any.do for several years, so I know its not a situation of not knowing how to use the app. Clearing data and cache and reinstalling has not helped. Any.do support is trying to help, wants a video, but I can't take a video of every time I set a reminder hoping to catch the issue. Its unrealistic. If anyone else using the app is experiencing this issue, please please please let Any.do support know. I won't discount its an issue specific to my device, but the fact that the app ran fine for years, until an update, has me thinking otherwise.
replyContent: We're are doing our best to fix any issues and fully test the app before releasing it to our users. We are sorry you are experiencing problems. That said, if this isn't the solution you are looking for, we will completely understand if you choose to switch to another service.

content: I used to love this app. I have used it for years. I even had (until yesterday) the paid version. I primarily use this app to sync up my alexa tasks. It started having issues, then got fixed. Now the company is saying that Amazon sync is no longer usable (unless you want to add a 3rd party to allow it access to your Amazon account).
replyContent:
Unfortunately, Amazon has rejected our fix and will not be reopening the Any.do Skill just yet.
At this point in time, our efforts seem to be blocked and we will not be able to offer with any estimate to when the integration will be reactivated :(

content: As like every other App. They want your money. Why, because they can! Because every other app charges. This one wants $3 per month or all you can do is 2 events per day. Don't fall for it keep searching. I might have considered paying if it was 3 dollars per year. If money doesn't bother you, then this app is fairly easy to use. Very intuitive and user friendly although I have used others under the Apple platform that were much better.
replyContent: 90% of the app is completely free, including all core functionality, and unlike similar apps, we allow our users to enjoy most of the features for as long and as much as they wish without any 3rd party ads or a requirement to upgrade :)

UNACCEPTABLE

content: Theres always something shifty to me about an app that shouldnt need a subscription for doing the absolute minimum. Google Play also send a notification of payment on the day of the charge so users can stay on top of their payments and contact us immediately if there's any issue.

content: All of the great features such as list sharing grocery list categorization, and easy to use UI are being "phased out." Please uninstall and reinstall the app's latest version from Google Play. content: App is getting worse instead of better. Latest version replaces homescreen widget that displayed five upcoming tasks with one that only displays three in the same space. All it gains in return is a useless "Calendar" button. WIdget colors that followed your main app theme replaced by ugly monochrome, too. I suspect they've put someone new in charge who decided they needed to "shake things up" with bad new ideas. Only bright spot is their tech support has been good.
replyContent: There are several Any.do widget options to choose from for Android, and most widgets are resizable! Be advised that the Tasks are displayed according to the order in the app, by list or by time. To learn more, go to our Help Center at- support.any.do/widgets. For any questions, please contact us at www.any.do/contact_form.

content: This is not a multi-protocol task manager as the description false implies. This is a front end to their service. I couldn't get past the first screen because it requires me to set up an account to sync. I use a private server capable of syncing things like tasks, Exchange. Most public clouds (Google, iCloud, Office365, email providers) have this capability, therefore why should I need to send my data elsewhere if it's already on a server. The fact that data is not something you can touch doesn't make it less valuable. Be mindful of it, it *is* our most valuable asset today, it may not be tangible but it sure can be quantified endlessly. Requiring signing up for any app is a huge red flag.
replyContent: Gustavo, it seems like it wasn't meant to be. Good luck!

content: This overpriced app just keeps getting worse. Now, you can no longer add items using Google. careful...they don't notify you before charging your card for another year. Not an email or anything. This was once a useful app. Now it's just a money grab. New additions...besides not working with Google, it now is buggy with slow loads and glitches. And although I have a "Premium" subscription, they want even more money to use all the features. I'm guessing the 5 star reviews are from when it worked.
replyContent: Google has recently announced that they no longer support the integration with third party apps, although you can use the standard voice input of your device! As for the renewals - per our TOS, they are automatic unless the user cancels the subscription prior to the renewal date (via Google Play). Go to any.do/contact_form for further assistance!

content: The option to sync with Google Assistant is completely useless - it doesn't work at all. I wish I could give this app zero stars, but one star is the lowest option available. Save yourself the trouble and avoid this app at all costs.
replyContent: We are not aware of any issues with the Google assistance integration and have tested this feature today and it works. If you're experiencing any issues, kindly submit a bug report via Settings - Support so our team can look into this for you.

content: I liked this app until recently. I discovered that items were being added to my shopping list without my input. I noticed a pop-up notification on my phone that an item was added. Viewing my list I saw several items that I did not add. I tried to work this out with the developer, but after informing me that they had a fix for the issue, they then followed up saying that they would not be releasing the fix. I assume they are receiving money for allowing products to hijack their paying customers.
replyContent: Sorry you feel this way Bob. As explained by our team, the items were added since you actively pressed an advertisement for the grocery list. Any.do does not add items independently. While we did look at an ad-less version, since many users find this feature helpful we’ve decided against it at this point in time.

content: EDITED. So the app works as expected. It does location reminders (pay version) but they are simple notifications. No vibration option which is the point of a location notification. replyContent: For any questions feel free to contact us at www.any.do/contact_form. We would be happy to get an updated review once you get to know the app better :)
