replyContent: Please note that in order to properly save your Subtasks and Notes, you need to scroll down the Task menu, after making any changes. To learn more about the Tasks go to https://support.any.do/en/articles/8635891-handling-personal-subtasks. If you're still experiencing any issues, please submit a bug via the app Settings → Support

content: Update June 24, 2024: Things have gotten worse. Now there are lots video ads that take up the whole screen and make the app non-functional until the ad is over. Searching for a replacement. The latest update now includes intrusive video popups to explain new features. I find these really annoying, I'm going to look for a different app.
replyContent: This is very strange behavior and we will look into it for you - so sorry for the inconvenience!

content: Used to be amazing. Now adds come up right when you need to jot down your task. By the time add is done playing I forgot the task. I tried looking for some other app, but there is nothing good enough available yet. Fingers crossed once something else gets released, I'll ditch this frustrating money grab. Edit: how do you mean "dismiss premium add"? It's a non skippable add.
replyContent: You can dismiss the premium ad if you wish.

content: I found this app difficult to organize in a way that was useful for me. I couldn't separate which items showed up on my phone widget by topic, so it showed all of them which was unnecessary. I also found the reminders to plan my day annoying. It would be better with an improved calendar and prioritizing options. Last, it is extremely frustrating to try and unsubscribe from yearly renewal. It is buried deep in the info and the actual faq for this has a broken link. Super sketchy and rude.
replyContent: Please note that for Android there are several Any.do widget options to choose from. You can disable the Daily Planner via the app's settings (support.any.do/any-do-moment). For assistance with the subscriptions and cancellations, see the instructions here- support.any.do/cancellations-refunds, or contact us at- www.any.do/contact_form.

content: This app was great for me for a while, then I didn't need it for a whole. When I came back it seemed lackluster, but overall fine. What made me dump it was that the app appears to have teamed up with target or some other retailer and they would add stuff to your "shopping list" without your permission and I would get these pop-ups on my phone telling you they added some random product to your list. I never had a list nor used the products pushed and no way I saw to stop it.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: There are certain things I love like the fact that it sorts my grocery list by aisle automatically. But overall this app stresses me out. I just want an app that allows me to share my grocery list. But the grocery list seems buried in an area that isn't intuitive. I don't need something to schedule every second of my life which seems to be more this apps aim.
replyContent: Any.do is primarily a productivity app, its main purpose is to help you handle all of your to-do's, using powerful tools and integrations. The Grocery List is one of the features we offer, which is found under the Task View. Although it's a powerful tool, it is not the main aspect of the app, as Any.do wasn't created to be simply a Grocery app :)

content: I like the app, it is a bit convoluted at times. Stupid expensive! $2.99...Per month! There's hundreds of other apps to choose from. What this app brings in functionality nowhere near justifies the price. I don't care for ads, and I'm happy to pay developers for their work. I pay for monthly subscriptions to a few apps, some higher than this. I just can't see it justifed here in any way.
replyContent: Any.do is a free app. We provide 95% of our features at no cost, including all core features. We never require our users to upgrade. We modeled all our pricing tiers off of similar services so we could stay competitive. We also occasionally offer promotions, you can inquire about them at premium@any.do!

content: I tried it years ago and never really got it going. Then I switched to Wunderlist and became an organized machine! Now Wunderlist is being retired, so I thought I'd try again, guessing it would be much better by now and that my ability to use it to my advantage would be vastly improved. Nope. No ability for folders or some other way to group lists together so I don't have to flip through all my lists to find the one I want. Not even a list view to make them easier to find.

Dec. 5, 2019 Update Moved from 5 stars to 2 for the reason below: I've had this app for about half a decade. The last couple years have been irritating. I add sub tasks. When I go back to the tasks, the sub tasks aren't there. I wish there was a save button as a cue and confirmion that the subtasks are saved. Not sure how long I could forgive the app until I just use another one altogether. Please address subtasks staying in the next update. Thanks! Was 5 stars for the longest time Awesome!
replyContent: Hi, please note that you will need press the return key to add your subtasks, and close the task menu, so your task can sync, after you have finished creating all your subtasks. If your subtasks still do not sync after doing so, please submit a bug report via Settings - Support so we can look into this for you!

content: Need to go up to premium to really make it useful. Premium is $30+. Otherwise it is a basic calendar that "might" be as good as the one the phone come with. It could be easier to use, but I'm not putting the time into figuring that out when I'm asked to upgrade. It comes up almost everytime I try to use 1 of the options. The simplest of free calendars allows me more options than the free part of this calendar. I just deleted it. Not worth going through error reports right in the beginning.
replyContent: 90% of the app is completely free. You should only receive a pop-up about Premium if you try to use a Premium exclusive feature, plus one time when you first log in. If you are seeing it more than this, please submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support so we can look into this for you.

content: Only rated 2 stars because of the ability to sync with the calendar apps on the phone and the ability to cross out any tasks once finished. However, the app is fairly simple with tasks laid out like a shopping or to do list with the inability to edit the timings of tasks. I had set an appointment for 1:30 but the app had automatically set it for 10:00 am and not allowing me to edit it. Also, it would have been nice for the tasks to be laid out in calendar format with color-coding options.
replyContent: Hi Maira, please note you are able to edit your tasks, and your reminder times, by simply tapping on your tasks, furthermore, using our Color Tags, you will be able to color code all your tasks, you can learn more here: https://support.any.do/color-tags/

content: Stupid popup reminding me to add reminders or do something covers my keypad and stays for a long time with no way to close it. I can't keep checked off items. It reminds me multiple times, every couple of seconds, to clear off the checked items, again blocking me. I can't move items between lists and if there is a way, it isn't easy enough for me to figure out. Cumbersome.
replyContent: These are strange issues! We highly recommend you submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can help you get to the bottom of this issue.

content: It's a mess. I add new tasks and tag them. But they will randomly disappear, reappear. And the tags will disappear. Editing and adding them back in doesn't help because once a tag disappears you can't add it back in again. Disappearing tasks is the worst because there's no warning. They're just gone. They're not listed as complete, they just disappear. Sometimes they'll come back but sometimes I have to re-enter them...assuming I remember. I pay for this app, so the fact that the basic functionality of keeping my list intact is random and spotty is unacceptable. It may have something to do with syncing... no idea. But either way, I'm going to use another app because I just don't trust it anymore. These errors seem to be recent, like in the last 3 months.
replyContent: This sounds very odd! We highly recommend you submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support so we can look into this issue for you.

content: At first I thought 'wow this can do everything! It's exactly what I need.' When I downloaded it and got to test it out, I noticed the features I needed the most were on premium. I'm fine with that, but only if premium was a one time payment. Not monthly payments for a membership. Monthly payments are for bills, taxes, video subscriptions, vpns, maybe even online storage subscriptions, but most definitely not calendars or to do lists. Those should stay as free or a small one time payment.
replyContent: Any.do is not only a product but also a service. We are continuously adding new features, keeping your information synced and safe 24/7, and providing Priority Support for any need you may have. Since Any.do is offering much more than a standard product, we have decided a subscription is the best pricing for it, like similar apps on the market :)

content: I love this app and I really would give it a 5 star review, however, every few months the app stops syncing with my Alexa lists. So, in the meantime, while waiting for an update, I end up having to jump between 2 different apps to see everything that's been added to lists. The only reason I ever started using this app is because it was supposed to sync with Alexa consistently. That was supposed to make my life a whole lot easier. Instead I just end up frustrated.
replyContent: We are sorry about this. Due to ongoing issues with Amazon, Any.do no longer offers a direct integration with Alexa. However, we do offer the option for Premium users to sync with Alexa via our Zapier integration. To learn more you can read all about it here: https://support.any.do/zapier/

content: The latest update is terrible. I always organized everything by date of the reminder, which is usually set on the day that it's due, but now I can't even see the due date of each task. I have to click on each task for the the date to appear. In addition, I usually organize each task by tags, the date, recurring if needed, and other details. There's no easy way to adjust all these details anymore. You have to click on each separate icon to fix these to what you want. I use the app begrudgingly.
replyContent: There are still indicators for each task in our latest view. If you can't see them, please send us a screenshot and your account details to customers@any.do so we can look into this for you.

content: I really love the app, but the lack of full calendar month view is a major hindrance for me. Also, it would be nice to sync Google tasks and anydo Tasks, it syncs the calendar why the tasks as well? I wish these 2 features were added. I would be set. By the way I love the major feature: (the bottom pop up for Tasks that are do. I love how it interrupts and lets me decide what I want to do.
replyContent: Thank you for the suggestion. You can also post your idea on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it!

content: I switched to Any.do when Wunderlist ended. I wanted a simple interface that let me share lists and tasks with my husband. Any.do did that, but in the least efficient way possible. Our initials are the same and tiles aren't customizable, so it was impossible to tell who a task was assigned to. The app always defaulted to tasks even if I had just been using a shopping list. It was a huge pain to navigate. Not what we needed at all.

Meh. A little too complicated and doesn't really do what I want it to. Shopping lists aren't easy to create. The app is really pushy about going premium and wants you to rate it within the first minute you've opened it. Let me get used to the thing before you bombard me! Also, all the buttons are really small and kind of hard to push
replyContent: Are you experiencing any issues on Android 6.0? If so, report a bug through the app and we will work to fix them ASAP!

content: Just started using it, creating my lists etc. Until I noticed the free version doesn't have such basic feature as adding a photo to a task (it lets you theoretically, but up to 1.5mb, which means that practically you can't take photos since they are bigger). You could add an option that auto shrinks the photos so they could be added in small resolution. This makes the free version impractical basically.
replyContent: With the premium version you can upload as many pictures as you want. We have a 7 day free trial and we also occasionally offer promotions, you can inquire about them at premium@any.do!

content: The app would work great; if it only reminded you when you wanted it too... What I mean is, it would certainly remind me of my scheduled tasks. That great! But, it would also randomly interrupt me to "plan my day". If I didn't add something to my schedule, then I dont need a reminder. So stop fracking interrupting my daily phone use at random times, and sending me false notifications.

Syncing with Alexa takes over 10-15 minutes which renders it unusable. Any.do, before you post your generic response: yes, I added the skill to my Alexa and, yes, I logged into my accounts. It syncs... kind of... so I can verify the two accounts are talking... just not well at all. When I use Wunderlist or Google Tasks or just Alexa by itself, the changes are instantly viewable across all platforms. The only reason I downloaded with app was to give me more control over my Alexa lists (which for some insane reason you cannot reorder). The extremely lag in syncing Any.do with Alexa renders this app useless. The UI looks really nice and user friendly, so I bumped it up to 2 stars.

Very buggy. I've had syncing issues with recurring tasks and now when I open the app, the add task pop up appears at the bottom of my screen. I have to back out of that every time just so I can see my calendar or list of tasks. For an app that claims it will save you time, I've found the opposite to be true. I'll attempt to use it until my subscription is up for renewal. Definitely not worth the $35.99 I spent and I won't be investing in another year.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! In order to better understand contact our team via www.any.do/contact_form. We will be happy to look into it for you.

content: Some of the sentences on my lists go off the screen, so we need an option to wrap the text when it reaches the right side of the screen. As of June 4, 2017, I can not sign on anymore using samsung galaxy after upgrading to Android 7.0 software. As of 6-19-2020, I never did get any.do to work on my Samsung galaxy s7, but it now works on my Samsung note 8.
replyContent: Thank you for the update. We have an extensive Help Center detailing how to utilize the features -https://support.any.do/. You are also welcome to contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form with any questions. We'll be happy for an updated review once you get to know the app better :)

content: Easy setup for the most part but ended up deleting it. Only one level of subtasks makes the to do list suboptimal. Only links to Google based calendars so my work, school and personal calendars aren't seen. [there is a disconnect between the app and the referenced article's options and instructions]. I don't mind paying for premium features as long as it is a one-time payment, the whole SAAS model is annoying.
replyContent: Any.do is a calendar integration and is not a calendar provider. Therefore, you can add any calendar that is on your native device. If you're having a problem and you're not finding a solution in the Help Center, feel free to email customers@any.do with your device, OS, and Any.do version and someone will be happy to help you!

content: I am a paid user of this app. I like this app a lot, until Android 10. They claim what they used to do is not possible but that is not true because another app I use (Daylio) has a nice notification that jumps out at you, like Any.do used to. Now Any.do gives a regular ignorable notification which you click and the app does something on the screen and is pretty pathetic, THEN it gives it's notification to plan your day. So it's two clicks with a big visual pause in between. Not cool. 👎

What a letdown. Forces you to use your device's native calendar with no option to change. Most apps let you connect with an account directly, but this made me use the Samsung calendar, which I have had nothing but issues with. "Integration" options through Zapier offer automation for new events but not a general account sync. Desktop and mobile differences are confusing. I can add my Google account to desktop, but it won't show the events on mobile? Poorly executed, really disappointed
replyContent: You can view any calendar including your google calendar in the mobile version. You can read all about our calendar setup in our Help Center: https://support.any.do/calendar-setup/ As long as you have your google account in your device you will be able to see it. We will be happy to shard more information here www.any.do/contact_form.

content: Buggy interface. The grocery list feature is fine but the schedule is terrible. It kept changing event details after I saved. I had to go back in and turn off alarms for previously saved events (that I had alarms off). And it would NOT let me create an all day event that was only scheduled one day. No matter how many times I changed the dates it kept including the day before in my "all day" event. And then when I would try to edit it, it would change completely to two days before. What a mess.
replyContent: We are not aware of any issues with editing the calendar, so that sounds odd. Please send us a bug report via your app Settings - Support, we will be happy to get to the bottom of this for you.

content: I want a day planner that lets me set a time for tasks without there always being a reminder notification. This app can't seem to provide that. I'm also not happy with how the free option wasn't made available to me during sign up. Seems fishy to say "free forever" on the homepage, but when it comes to signing up, I only saw a 7 day free trial. The help section was a joke, so I unsubscribed immediately.
replyContent: Any.do is a free app. We provide 90% of our features at no cost. We never require our users to upgrade. All users can use the app for free for as long as they please. Any user can dismiss the trial and user the app for free. If you have any feedback regarding our help center we will be happy to hear via our contact form: www.any.do/contact_form

content: Spent 2 hours tinkering with this app just to realize that it can't do what I need it to do. It's quite frustrating that no digital planner has the option of showing future tasks before they're due. I have a task that's due every third Wednesday of the month. I want to see that task on my calendar 3 months ahead so I can plan around it. But nope, the task won't appear until it's marked complete in the previous month. Pointless! How can that feature possibly be helpful for anyone??
replyContent: Any.do is a productivity app, and therefore, the way Recurring Reminders work is that when you complete the current recurrence, the next one pops up. That said, you are welcome to create a calendar event (support.any.do/the-event-menu), which will be displayed on your Calendar View, so you may check your Agenda months ahead :)

content: Just trying it out. Seems like a great app but has a really, really basic miss that I saw referenced in another review: Theres no intuitive way to specify or change the time of a task. Tasks are all just all automatically set for 9 am and theres not visable button or option to change the time. The other user mentioned trying to use Google to figure out how. But such a basic miss seems like a flag that maybe I should try a different app.
replyContent: Hi Seth, please note that you are able to change the time of a task, to do so simply tap on the task you wish to edit, and ether tap on the reminder to edit it, or tap 'Add reminder' to set a reminder. You can learn more here: https://support.any.do/reminders/

content: I'm afraid the app promises a lot but doesn't deliver. I rely heavily in To Do in the office suite. I was looking for a few more features but integration was important to me. The promised integration comes through Zapier which requires get another premium subscription ($20 per month). Zapier is extremely confusing and time consuming. This just isn't any better than To Do and honestly One Note blows it out of the water. If you're already paying for office, don't waste your time here.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! The Zapier integration helps to connect thousands of apps to Any.do and offers up to 5 Zaps completely for free for our Premium users. We encourage users to reach out to us directly so we can offer a full resolution at www.any.do/contact_form.

content: I had made an account for this app a long time ago but didn't use it for long and I forgot why until I re-downloaded it today. This is one of those apps that's incredibly frustrating because a lot of the main advertised features are behind a pay wall and/or you have to make an ADDITIONAL ACCOUNT FOR. Paying more than $1/mo for a list app is ridiculous. If anything it should be a one-time purchase.
replyContent: Any.do is a free app. We provide 95% of our features at no cost, including all core features. We never require our users to upgrade. We modeled all our pricing tiers off of similar services so we could stay competitive. We also occasionally offer promotions, you can inquire about them at premium@any.do!

content: Have on and off tried this app for years. Finally committed & signed up for the yearly plan but I regret my decision. The desktop app constantly displays the new update bar at the top of the window and every single time that I have 'updated' I have lost data. Nothing too major until I recently put in a kind of extensive task w/subtasks only to open the app on my phone and discover it had all been deleted along with a few tasks I set for later completion. Decent interface but won't be renewing.

Stop forcing symbols into dates! I use a lot of fractions in my work and not being able to change the auto-correct to format it as a date is incredibly frustrating! 3/4 is not March 4th to me! Nor is 3-4 or 3.4! At least not when I include it in the title of my item! I have been having to double click into every single item on my list just to remove the improperly translated data. Include a way to toggle this off in settings, or give the user the auto-correct OPTION instead of forcing it. I paid $36 for this app to save time, not so I can beta test it for you!
replyContent: If you add tasks from the + next to the category it will not have the smart type option. You can also disable the smart type by pressing the blue suggestion that pops up. If you have any specific questions, you are welcome to contact us at- https://www.any.do/contact_form, and we’d love to help you out.

content: Once the app reinstalled itself and I lost everything. I still have no idea why it did this. Also, it often doesn't open when I first tap the icon. If I tap it multiple times it eventually opens within a particular task. I found it frustrating and I've now uninstalled it. It would be a great app if some of these bugs could be resolved.
replyContent: This sounds very odd but we apologize for any inconvenience! Please submit a bug report by emailing customers@any.do so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: I liked the app, but it is not opening anymore on my android note 20. Also, you may want to add "Are you sure you want to delete / show completed" pop up window on all the items. I have lost so many things because the app was lagging and it clicked when I didn't want it too. What a nuisance. Please fix it so I can use it again.
replyContent: You can always find all of your completed tasks (as well as restore them) via Setting → Completed Tasks. See this article for more info - https://shorturl.at/agjBO. As for the app not opening on your Android - this is odd! 🤔 Could you please reach out to us via www.any.do/contact_form, so we can look into that for you?

content: The concept is good but the execution lacks. There are constant issues with server sync, and since the server side has priority, updates I make on the phone regularly get wiped out. Every so often the app will prompt me to log in again when I open it...this time it just kicked me out while I was actively using it and updating a list, made me log in again, and didn't keep anything I had already done! My wife already gave up on it and I will probably look elsewhere too
replyContent: This is very odd! We highly recommend you submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: I keep going back to this to see if anything has been fixed or added, every time I'm disappointed. Smart Shopping List is about as dumb a Shopping List as can be. You cannot add or delete categories, you're stuck with whatever categories they seem fit to give you which are grocery based. If you're planning on using it for something like a hardware store and need Building Supplies, Electrical, Plumbing etc you're out of luck. You can't even add Quantity! Isn't that usually a basic feature of a shopping list?! So if you add Potatoes, how many? 5lbs? 1lbs? who knows.
replyContent: Any.do's Smart Grocery List is not the main feature of our app, but an additional productivity tool that we created, to provide a designated space for such items. That said, our Product Team is putting a lot of efforts into updating and improving the Grocery feature's functionality! We will be sure to post on our Social Media about future updates!

content: I like it at lot, but it seems like recently, this v thing is taking out my battery, hogging memory, and using data more than chrome which I use constantly. Until someone can help me figure this out, or if this high usage of phone resources is normal, I can't rate it any higher. I might even have to remove it and search for an alternative.
replyContent: Any.do is a minimalist task manager, which reflects in our design and functionality, and uses minimal device storage, as many other standard apps in this field. If you are experiencing any issue, we will be happy to assist, should you contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: EDIT2 : NONE OF MY WORKSPACE TASKS ARE SHOWING ON THE CALENDAR ON THE APP ! ************************ EDIT: I REFER TO 'MY CALENDAR' beta view on the desktop. Not the google calendar connected to the account ************************* When will you finally add the calendar view to the Android app, to match the calendar view on desktop version?! I really miss this, actually this is the reason I never use the app, only the desktop.
replyContent: 'MY CALENDAR' will show you calendars you connected to the app on the desktop version we do not have an independent calendar. If you are referring the design you can share your feedback with our team under settings-> support.

content: Been using this app for a couple of years at least, it is somewhat useful but the UI has not improved and has very poor usability. Way too many times I end up with tasks forgotten because somehow the reminder is turned off instead of snoozed. This should be critical for an app that is all about helping you remember tasks. If an average person can't use the app with ease, it is the app's problem.
replyContent: In order to better understand and advise you accordingly, please pinpoint the issues you are having and send it to us via Settings → Support or at www.any.do/contact_form. We will be happy to assist you!

content: New update is no use. Earlier version was user friendly. That pop up reminder with snooz used to come with some sound then I could snooz or post pone. This is now not working. Every time I open my phone. All due activities used to pop out showing time then I could plan to snooz,post for time. Now this is not coming. Human tendency some one has to remind.
replyContent: Please contact our team under settings-> support and they will be happy to look into this matter for you.

content: Reminders (especially location based) need to be optionally repeatable. If I didn't accomplish the task, the system should repeat it the next day by default, not just remain as an unaccomplished task in the past. This should be a basic feature and I'm paying for this app.
replyContent: Please send us a bug report in your app via Settings → Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: I've been using this for years, and used to like it. Now you get a loud, obnoxious ad that starts playing out of the blue sometimes when you open a list. They are obviously making the free experience worse to force you to pay up. Another good app ruined by corporate greed.
replyContent: We passed this feedback on, please reach out to our team if the ad pops up more than once under settings-> support.

content: Previously great app that did a lot of things right. Unfortunately the 'My Day' feature added unnecessary clutter & confusing UX and the introduction of ads was the nail in the coffin for me. Don't regress an app then try and charge users to give them the old, more functional version. That's really anti-consumer and pretty scummy.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! We encourage users to reach out to us directly in order to better understand the issue, or feedback and get to the bottom of things so we can offer a full resolution. We work hard to resolve any issues! :). If this is not the type of solution you are looking for, we respect your decision to move to a different app.

content: (edit) In response to reply, THERE IS NO '+'! On the side, only bottom bar. If a list is empty there is only bottom bar!... No tasks here yet, start adding tasks by tapping the '+' button. Well the '+' doesn't exist or the greyed out background one doesn't have a function... Only the bottom bar exists. Seems like an oversight with the design of this app, can't believe it hasn't been corrected to this day. Any.do has been around for a while with several updates, so wake up you lazy devs
replyContent: If you press on the gray + on the right side you will be able to add a task to the specific category. If this doesn't work for you please reach out to our team www.any.do/contact_form and send more information we will be happy to look into it.

content: Any.do used to work well, but recently every time the app is updated, the "what's new" page stop reminders from coming though at their scheduled time unless you open the app, then close out of this pop-up before the reminders scheduled time. Please fix this ASAP as the app is useless otherwise.
replyContent: We would be happy to help you resolve all of the issues you have encountered should you send us a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report).

content: Anoying add about their premium version poping out of nowhere on max volume. Very unpleasant situation to have when you're in the public place if you ask me. Otherwise very good.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! If you are getting the video ad more than once, please contact our team for assistance under settings-> support.

content: Seems no likes this app more than any.do does. No way in hell does this app justify those prices. People either don't care about money or lost their mind if they pay this much recurring forever. You could barely justify a one time $20 payment.
Good app but too many invasive ads about upgrading to pro in the last few months. Makes me consider switching apps.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! If you are getting the video ad more than once, please contact our team for assistance under settings-> support.

content: Used to be excellent. As of 2024, there are several bugs on the mobile version that make it unusable. The most frustrating being when trying to move tasks to a later day, the app moves a different task instead - even recurring ones, causing chaos.
replyContent: That's very odd, please send us a bug report in your app via Settings → Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you 😊

content: Doesn't remove items from list when you finish it. still stays there. widget and app. I would like it gone. reduced to atoms. you can cross it off like it does. but I want it removed! I'm saying the tasks are market out but the uncomplete tasks still persists like u never completed them.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- (Settings-Bug Report).

content: Was an incredible app before they decided to completely overhaul it. Mine was updated a few days ago and now it's glitchy like crazy and I feel like I'm learning a whole new app. I'm now seriously considering cancelling my subscription and going with a different reminder app. The one that comes free on my Samsung phone works very well and has almost all the same functions.
replyContent: Sorry you feel this way. Was there a specific issue you encountered? We will be happy to assist, should you contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: i don't often give bad ratings, as i value everyone who code, and even if i don't like something, other users may find it useful. But what i've encountered in this app is unacceptable. Nearly every section of the app is not working correctly, which is an astounding achievement. i've submitted lengthy examples in the website "Contact us". In short: there's no due dates + extremely inefficient way how we can manage our lists/tasks + doesn't show overdue tasks (!),etc. So literally the basics fail
replyContent: We have due dates please see: https://support.any.do/en/articles/8635354-personal-task-reminders and we do have overdue tasks and you can view them from the calendar view and My Day suggestions see: https://support.any.do/en/articles/8635857-managing-overdue-personal-tasks If you have any questions contact our team under settings-> support.

content: You can't even make tasks appear in the order that you add them, with new tasks at the top 🤦‍♂️😆
replyContent: On the mobile app new tasks will be added to the top. You can also drag and drop tasks to your preferred location. Please reach out to our team so they can assist you https://support.any.do/en/articles/8927080-chat-support and we will look into this matter for you.

content: This app finally makes you to pay money. You may not be able to use the free version for long. Moments just stops working in the free version after a few days and you are forced to give Credit card info and Buy
replyContent: You can dismiss the premium offer and keep using the app for free. Free accounts have limited usage of the moment feature to learn more see: https://support.any.do/en/articles/8635977-any-do-subscription-plans

content: Works fine on Android. Fails miserably when connected to my laptop via phone link. It will not maintain laptop keyboard functionality. Makes the whole process inefficient.
replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with the link. Please submit a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report) with the relevant details, so we can get to the bottom of this for you!

content: Once it was good, but now: extremely bad UI-design with lots of steps to set simple reminders; notifications don't appear; internal design and mechanics contradictions; setting exact time is the pain in comparison with the previous versions. I understand that lots of IT-programmers have to do something to get extra bonuses, but not making the app worse! It also seems that Any.Do team doesn't know the A/B test processes and live experience checking. Otherwise they could understand the difficulties of current design and withdraw the changes. Current version of the app - easiest target for the criticism with many points to mention.
replyContent: Any.do's approach to task and project management is simplistic and we intentionally avoid adding unnecessary features so that users remain focused only on what matters :) Please view our Help Center to learn about all our features here: https://support.any.do and if you have any questions, please contact us here- https://www.any.do/contact_form.

content: It constantly crashes and misses a lot of functionality. Hard to use and annoys with some popups that can be discarded only by closing app and then opening it again and permanent noticfaction that CAN'T be disabled. Payd 30 euro for this and used for month before it got so annoying that I started to look for another app. Fortunately I found one - Todoist. It's unbelievable how much better that is. Also there is version of todoist for PC, for your smart watch and even as browser extension which allows you to easily set a certain web page as task. And all these are synced.
replyContent: Any notification we offer can be disabled in your app settings. In addition, Any.do has a web version, smart watch integration, and a Chrome extension that can add web pages as tasks :) Regarding the crashes: We recommend you submit a bug report via Settings - Support in your app, so we can help resolve this for you ASAP.

content: I'm a student and was looking for something get myself very organized. I have tried series of productivity apps before. Apparently this had one of the features i have always been looking for; integration with other apps which I love. Two things I found disappointing, features are extremely limited without premium, it's almost impossible to use like that also very expensive. I couldn't find statistics; from totally hours and other reports
replyContent: Any.do is a free app. We provide 95% of our features at no cost, including all core features. We never require our users to upgrade. We modeled all our pricing tiers off of similar services so we could stay competitive. We also occasionally offer promotions, you can inquire about them at premium@any.do!

content: I was about to jump wholeheartedly into using this app (its integration with Google Calendar being exactly what I'm looking for) but now I see that it has no search feature on Android. Worse still, Android Search has been on their roadmap since 2015 and it's still not done. 2015!?! In the meantime other apps can build smart lists it out of tags, status and free text. Seriously behind the curve, guys.

I have used this app for a long time and was satisfied. Recent pop-up ads with iritating and rather loud lady did it for me this time. Also having to save the subtasks and if you don't or your screen times out everything so far is lost... Recent updates, UI especially really made the experience worst for me. I am now looking for another app of this kind to replace this
replyContent: If you are getting the video ad often please contact our team under settings-> support and they will be happy to assist you.

content: Frustrating to use. I set up tasks to repeat weekly and of the five, one showed up for the following week but then disappeared and the rest only appeared for the first week. I've triple checkd the settings and they are all set to repeat each Monday. It's another one of those apps that claims to save you time but ends up being a time sink as you mess about with the settings trying to get the damn thing to do the basics.
replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with the app! We will be more than happy to look into this for you and sort this out, should you send us a bug report. Please submit a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report) with the relevant details, so we can get to the bottom of this for you!

content: I've had a subscription for years. I used to be able to invite/assign tasks to colleagues etc, but now I can't without a better subscription so that's frustrating. The navigation of the mobile app and web are both frustrating. I feel I'm going to have to invest a lot of time in upskilling to the features which is also frustrating, and who knows where I go to find those resources.
replyContent: We would be happy to help you with any questions should you contact us here: https://www.any.do/contact_form. feel free to check out our Help Center: Support.any.do. Or if you want tips or news about Any.do, take a look at our blog: blog.any.do.

content: Look this app had potential, but there are a ton of efficiency type issues. For example, if in a list and hit back on phone, it closes the app instead of going back a menu option. Accidentally clicked a task and crossed it off, gonna need remake it. I really want to like this app, and been using it for a while. But ever update i see is usually something like changing color scheme options or something. Been premium and used the app for a few yrs now hoping updates would come, they haven't...
replyContent: In order to save the changes you have to press the save button or swipe the tasks down, otherwise it will revert. We will be happy to hear about your suggestions should you contact us at www.any.do/contact_form :)

content: Still the same issue, 3 years later..I'm giving this app 3 out 5 because there is a really annoying behaviour when you're adding a quick note and if you by mistake tap outside the text box (which one would do on the go) your note is erased and you need to start again. I'm considering uninstalling it because this happens almost every time I add a note which means that it takes me twice the time. Please at least keep the text and don't erase it in case of an accidental tap outside the box. Thanks

I need this app to share tasks real time with my significant other. Unfortunately, when she is adding tasks from iOS, sometimes they do no show up for me. Switching to Microsoft To Do and no problems. Additionally, being able to paste multiple cells from Excel makes MS offering indispensable, something I would sorely miss if I returned to Any.do.
replyContent: We are unaware of any issues with sharing tasks, so that's odd. Please make sure that you are following the instructions provided on our Help Center here- https://support.any.do/sharing-lists-and-tasks/. If you're still experiencing issues, please submit a bug via Settings - Support, we will be happy to look into this for you :)

content: superb design, good for increasing productivity UPDATE: 10 years later, and it has become BLOATED. They should offer a simplified mode!
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! In order to better understand and advise you accordingly, please pinpoint the issues you are having and send it to us via www.any.do/contact_form. We will be happy to assist you :)

content: Nawww, sorry your yearly subscription price scared me off. By the time I've subscribed to every app I consider helpful I'm spending waaay too much. I would have liked it but I have other much more important bills to pay. The low stars is due to the price and there's no point in coming back to justify it because it'll still be too much for me. Edit: I know that I can use it for free, but then I'd still have to put up with ads. Surprisingly I don't like ads. I still consider your sub too much.
replyContent: You should only receive a pop-up about Premium if you try to use a Premium exclusive feature, plus one time when you first log in. If you are seeing it more than this, please submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support so we can look into this for you.

content: Why NOT show the main screen (that shows all lists) on reopening the app, instead of opening the last visited list? (Atleast provide an option). Even the Back Button exits the app instead of taking you to the Lists screen. Only one option to go to the Lists screen --> the button to the far top left! UX simply killed... point enough to make a switch away from this app! EDIT: such an important design change NOT being considered. Great going. Great pricing. Great uhm
replyContent: Hi Parshva, based on user feedback and internal analysis, we do not plan on changing this any time soon. However, we appreciate your input. Should it be relevant in the future, we will look into it again!

content: Not very intuitive and smart typing doesn't work across the different views; you have to be in a specific list. It's more convenient to be able to quickly add a task to a specific list from anywhere. Also, lack of task duration doesn't encourage practical planning; users can get carried away by adding too many tasks for a particular day and not achieve them despite all their planning. Stable desktop & mobile app; experienced no problems with syncing.
replyContent: We are not aware of any issues with the smart type, please reach out to our Support Team, by submitting a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report). We will be more than happy to get to the bottom of this, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: Day 2 of trialling this. So far I've had two location reminders fail, I can't label a location with more than one letter, the only time based reminder that's fired did so while on a phone call so I don't know what it sounds like, not that I can change the sound anyway because the instructions don't work. I had no idea what the buttons meant so the first one tapped the task got snoozed for 28 hours. How is that a typical snooze length? Adding anything more than a basic list item is not intuitive
replyContent:
Hi, this sounds very strange, please send us a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you :)
However regarding changing the notification sound, please note that this can be done via settings => Notification sound, then select the notification you wish to adjust, and tap on 'Sound'!

content: Recurring subscription fees with no option to buy the software once and for all => uninstalled and replaced with a better alternative that one can purchase instead of having to rent it, at a cost that is lower than the repeated rip-off from this one. As for their reply: no, this app does NOT offer anything that the alternatives would not include as well.
replyContent: If you're having trouble figuring out how to take advantage of Any.do, feel free to check out our Help Center: Support.any.do. Or if you want tips or news about Any.do, take a look at our blog: blog.any.do. If you have any specific questions, you are welcome to contact us at- https://www.any.do/contact_form, and we’d love to help you out.

content: Thought it be a great replacement for GTasks. Main issue with Tasks is lack of pc app. I like the any.do widget as it has a transparent option. I use recurring tasks a lot. A routine which can be ticked and on the next day they'll reappear, which I found seemeles in the Google app. Unfortunately in any.do you need to set a reminder for each task with exact time, they don't stack on each other, creating a long list of notifications in the morning. Also no visual event line in calendar month view.
replyContent: Any.do is available on all platforms, including PC. For the Recurring Reminders, note that you need to mark the current Task as 'Complete', then the next reminder will appear. You can set a due date for any Task without a reminder, by simply un-toggling the bell icon. In the widget Calendar view, Events appear below the monthly display.

content: I used to depend on this app to basically run my life, until I installed the latest (as of Mar 19) update. Now it doesn't sync properly with my smartwatch -- ticking tasks off on my watch no longer marks them complete on my phone. Also, the widget is broken now, and doesn't reflect changes I've made unless I restart my phone. I sent a support request to the help team, but have gotten total radio silence. If they don't fix it, I'm cancelling my subscription. Right now it's not worth paying for.
replyContent: Our team replies to standard queries within 48 hours and Premium queries within 24 hours during business days. During weekends this may take a bit longer though rest assured that they will reach out as soon as possible to help you resolve this! :)

content: I came back to Any.do after a while because I quite liked the Groceries feature and was even considering premium before I had the _full screen_ TRY PREMIUM NOW video.. Try being a little more subtle.. I'll go back to Todoist.
replyContent: You can dismiss the video if you wish, we added this new video to showcase the premium features.

content: Unfortunately, the current version of the app doesn't work well at all. Whenever I try to move a task between priorities, it gets jumbled up.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team under settings-> support.

content: 6th March 2024. I'm reducing my review, even still being Anydo's user for a while now. It's laggy and it needs a desparate feature such as in my all my tasks on a particular day, it should Automatically added into my Day. Sorry.
replyContent: In order to better understand and advise you accordingly, please pinpoint the issues you are having and send it to us via www.any.do/contact_form. We will be happy to assist you :)

content: I can't trust this app with my todos. Doesn't consistently save them and phone rotation deletes whatever I'm in the middle of writing.
replyContent: We are not aware of this issue please submit a bug reput under settings-> support so we can investigate this issue.

content: I've had a paid subscription to this app since July 2020. I got it mainly because I want to add items to my grocery list via My Google Home devices using voice commands and I wanted an app that can manage both calendar events and tasks well. This app isn't it. I regret paying for a year's subscription. The grocery list functionality is very limited - you can't add price or even quantity. If you add recurring calendar events, there's no way to set an end date or set the number of occurrences.
replyContent: As explained on our Help Center, the Assistant integration is available for both Premium and Free users, and we only sync with the Notes&Lists feature and not with the designated Google Grocery feature (support.any.do/anydo-google-assistant). As per the price and quantity, and end date for events, our team is already looking into these options :)

content: Works well and looks good. Fantastic that it has Alexa support. But it's lack of decent widgets let's it down compared to similar apps. Separate lists should have separate widgets so that what I'm doing at a particular time can be focused on without having to open the app and without other lists and todos encroaching. I will keep an eye on it and resubscribe to pro if the widgets improve. Update: Now over a year. For me personally, there's been no improvement. Same limited widgets.
replyContent: Your suggestion has actually already been added to our UserVoice page and is pending more votes. If you would like to add your support and receive updates on potential progress, please go here: https://bit.ly/2ZpY8py :)

content: I've had this for years and rethinking it all. so many bugs for a paid version repeat function stops working from time to time. for example of I'm on a call during a pop up of a reminder the following day it stops repeating itself for whatever reason. another issue is the costum button which is far away and gets lost unless I'm very very careful which is annoying. and more issues
replyContent: The way recurring reminders work is that when you complete the current recurrence, the next one pops up. Only when completing the current occurrence you will you be able to see the next one. We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with the app! We will be more than happy to look into it should you send us a bug report (Settings- Support).

content: Deleted review accidentally. 1. I create habit type tasks: the ones that repeat regularly. I don't even dream to have a habit/statistical section, but THERE HAS TO BE A WAY TO SKIP OR FAIL THE REPEATABLE TASK. Now I only can delete it, but is is not representative way. 2. There has to be a way to exclude a list from the "all tasks" list. For example I have list with books to read and films to watch. A lot of tasks, that look bad in the "all tasks" list, I loose real important "no date" tasks because of it. You redirect me to your uservoice, but according to it excluding list from "all tasks" list has been "in roadmap" for 2 years, don't think you really care and your uservoice makes any difference. I know that adding habit tracker might be a heavy feature, but failing the task, or skipping it? Hell no. As well as excluding lists feature, it's also an easy one. But two years? Meh. Just don't pretend you care, be straightforward, like, 'we won't do it in the nearest future, not in our plans'.
replyContent: When you get a reminder, you have options other than deleting it. You can snooze it or change its due date. You cannot exclude lists from all tasks by you can filter by list and minimize the ones you don't want. We are constantly working on updates, but we do it according to our own roadmap - we reserve the right to work on what's highest priority.

content: The grocery list is not syncing properly and is missing items that my wife added on her phone. This has caused issues for us where I've missed items when shopping. This is particularly bad considering the current quarantine and the fact that I have to queue up to get into the shop in the first place. I've tested and when I add the item "snacks" on my wife's phone they don't appear on my grocery list. I can not recommend this app currently because of this.
replyContent: We are unaware of any issues with sharing lists, so that's odd. Please make sure that you are sharing the list according to the instructions on our Help Center here- https://support.any.do/sharing-lists-and-tasks/. If you're still experiencing issues, please submit a bug via Settings - Support, we will be happy to look into this for you :)

content: Used this for years, recently upgraded my phone and reinstalled the app. I've had nothing but problems since. I'm not getting any of my notification reminders. But the apps ads for their black Friday deal seems to come through fine. I can no longer recommend this app. And for the support person that reads this, yes the notification settings are turned on...
replyContent: It sounds like there may be an issue with your device allowing the app to send notifications properly. Please uninstall and reinstall the app's latest version from Google Play. If you're still experiencing any issue, kindly submit a bug report via Settings - Support so our team can look into this for you.

content: The notification bar does not work. The "Add Task" option appears, I enter the task and click on the icon, there's just a progress spinner. The "Close" icon does not dismiss the notification bar either. How inconvenient. Had this issue in Oreo too. Right now I am on Nougat. Also the animations inside the app are slow. The icon where you tap to 'tick' the task is very small.

This is a nicely made app and premium is cheap, but one critical flaw is the reminder sound runs through the ringtone channel instead of the alarm channel, or even the media channel. So unless you enjoy hearing every single notification go off on your phone or your ears are super sensitive to vibrations from across the room this app is not fit for purpose. A shame I just pooched my free trial now
replyContent: Like many apps, we use device notifications for the reminders :) However, if you do not wish to have this sound, you may still stay on top of your tasks via the widget/ the quick-add curtain bar or the push and pop up notifications. There are many ways to keep productive with Any.do :)

content: If you try to add something to the app using the share button, there seems to be a word limit. That means long website addresses won't get added in full and that makes me not rely on the app for saving links and such from across the web or whatever. Already done. They said to wait for a fix through an update around a month ago. Still none. Also, on your website it's says calendar is there on windows. There is no option in the app so where is it ? Neither in the webapp.
replyContent: The My Day view in web/desktop apps displays the calendar with current day's events from Google and/or Outlook calendars. We are currently working on a fuller Calendar feature and once released, we will notify everyone at blog.any.do and in the "What's new?" section of the app. Same goes for the fix for the issue you've mentioned, please stay tuned

content: I find the app inflexible and buggy, with a counter intuitive UI. How to delete or rename tags was not obvious. Using the back button would often exit the app at unusual times. After adding a new tag the app wouldn't allow me to do anything until I exited and restarted. Plus, the premium features seem more like essential features, to me. Looking for an alternative app as we speak.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way, Rose! You are welcome to check out our Help Center (https://bit.ly/2sO10ft) Youtube channel (https://bit.ly/2HeafzE) and blog (blog.any.do) for any questions. Also, feel free to reach out at customers@any.do :)

content: The big downside for me that made me uninstall it is that only makes a simple sound like an incoming message. I need a sound like an incoming call that will continue until I close it, or at least will last for one minute. Otherwise if my phone is not close to me I am loosing the reminder. If this is not an issue for someone is a good application.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback, this suggestion was already added to our UserVoice forum and you are welcome to vote for it here: https://anydo.uservoice.com/forums/143587-general/suggestions/16594918-reminders-add-nag-alarm-option

content: So we've been using this app for a while in conjunction with the Alexa skill (in Canada), which worked well until a few weeks back. Then it wouldn't sync things anymore. Any.do app and Alexa app were both up to date so I tried disabling the skill so I could reinstall and reconnect from scratch... Now it says the skill is "not currently available" so it looks like they ended support for this integration I guess?
replyContent: Due to an issue, you might experience a sync problem with the Alexa integration. We are trying to work with their team to solve it as fast as possible.

content: It sorely needs and UNDO (& backup/restore/revert) feature in case we accidentally touch/swipe a circle/bullet which then gets unintentionally deleted immediately (which I find incredibly frustrating). (It also needs a flexible feature to import & export other common text/data formats like CSV, XML, events to & from calendar… not just copy reminders to tasks) If Google fixes all that then I'd give it 5-stars!
replyContent:
You are able to reinstate any of your completed tasks! Just simply go to the settings => 'Completed tasks' and swipe right to left on the tasks you wish to reinstate!
You can also share your tasks to a new Sheets document, and export it as a CSC, or XML! You can learn more about  exporting your lists here: https://support.any.do/export-import/

content: It's extremely confusing. If you accidentally marked a repeating task as done and restore it, it shows multiple tasks including the original repeating tasks which date then shows the upcoming date. Marking a task with subtopics as done automatically marks everything is done instead of reminding you that it includes subtasks that needs to be completed... My ADHD can't with this app. It drives me mad.
replyContent: Any.do's subtasks do not offer dependancies. Any subtask marked as completed will show up again in the next occurrence. If you complete an occurrence the next one will show up with the same subtasks. To learn more see https://shorturl.at/bpBV4. For support please reach out to us via Settings - Support or via www.any.do/contact_form. 🧐

content: Frustrated that all the useful features are only for premium. not complaining that they are set up that way, but that they dont let you know until you are set up. Also its calendar wont work unless you import an external calendar? defeats the purpose of having a separate calendar. without premium its identical to a hundred other free apps.
replyContent: We provide 95% of our features at no cost, including all core features. We never require our users to upgrade. You can use Any.do for free for as long as you like. You are also correct about the calendar. It is capable of syncing and displaying all external calendar that you save to your device.

content: Getting slightly annoyed at the new "my day" that has replaced Moments. Not only the list to choose from completely ignores that some tasks are already scheduled for later, but it is also impossible to reschedule on the fly using this function. I find it now much harder to organize coming tasks over the week than with the previous versions.
replyContent: Hello, we are sorry you haven't found the advantages that come with MyDay useful yet! MyDay was introduced so that users can prioritize tasks for the current day. MyDay also resets each day to ensure a fresh start. If you have any more questions feel free to reach out to us https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: After a very long use this app is not so great anyway. I accidentally resubscribe on a wrong thing to check if the subscription has gotten better. For for $30+ yearly too much, for an app that have nothing much to offer... and I can't specifically create a task/ reminder for consecutive days in a month. I can do that with another task for free.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way. Any.do is a free app and we modeled our pricing to stay competitive with other similar apps. We will be happy to assist with any question, should you contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form.

content: This is a good app with somewhat helpful widgets. The widget calendar should include tasks on individual days. Events and their notification settings are lacking. If I want to be notified 2 weeks in advance, I simply can't.. In Google Calender, I can set it 4 weeks in advance. With this app I have to set the event date 1 week before it happens and set the notification to 1 week in advance in order to get 2 week notice. These restrictions are a dealbreaker.

Must register with email, Google or FB -- displaying your email address -- just to get onto app. Smack dab near beginning of setup process (full page, per each setting), a full page ad to buy premium version appears. Getting into app? -- Stayed just a min, with the boxed, staring at the boxed, text notification that we have seven (7) days to try app for free. Already concerned about/not liking having to register online to use, stopped setup process, at that page. Uninstalling right now.
replyContent: We provide 95% of our app at no cost, including all core features. We never require users to upgrade. You can use Any.do for free as long as you like. Also, we ask users to make an account because our app syncs cross-platforms. To provide flawless sync, tasks are saved on our servers, which makes them available 24/7 anywhere you log in from! :)

content: Hasn't been meaningfully updated in a long time. Difficult to organize lists and save/archive. Very simple without the ability to add any details like quantity on a grocery list. Used to auto categorize but not working anymore. I still use it because it's easy to share with my wife and that's about it.
replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with the app! We will be more than happy to look into this for you and sort this out, should you send us a bug report. Please submit a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report) with the relevant details, so we can get to the bottom of this for you!

content: Seems no likes this app more than any.do does. No way in hell does this app justify those prices. People either don't care about money or lost their mind if they pay this much recurring forever. You could barely justify a one time $20 payment.
I have to pay for app just to remind me every hour.
replyContent: Any.do personal is a free app, 90% of the app is completely free, including all core functionality, and unlike similar apps, we allow our users to enjoy most of the features for as long and as much as they wish without any 3rd party ads or a requirement to upgrade 😊

content: EDIT2 : NONE OF MY WORKSPACE TASKS ARE SHOWING ON THE CALENDAR ON THE APP ! ************************ EDIT: I REFER TO 'MY CALENDAR' beta view on the desktop. Not the google calendar connected to the account ************************* When will you finally add the calendar view to the Android app, to match the calendar view on desktop version?! I really miss this, actually this is the reason I never use the app, only the desktop.
replyContent: 'MY CALENDAR' will show you calendars you connected to the app on the desktop version we do not have an independent calendar. If you are referring the design you can share your feedback with our team under settings-> support.

content: Anoying add about their premium version poping out of nowhere on max volume. Very unpleasant situation to have when you're in the public place if you ask me. Otherwise very good.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! If you are getting the video ad more than once, please contact our team for assistance under settings-> support.

content: i don't often give bad ratings, as i value everyone who code, and even if i don't like something, other users may find it useful. But what i've encountered in this app is unacceptable. Nearly every section of the app is not working correctly, which is an astounding achievement. i've submitted lengthy examples in the website "Contact us". In short: there's no due dates + extremely inefficient way how we can manage our lists/tasks + doesn't show overdue tasks (!),etc. So literally the basics fail
replyContent: We have due dates please see: https://support.any.do/en/articles/8635354-personal-task-reminders and we do have overdue tasks and you can view them from the calendar view and My Day suggestions see: https://support.any.do/en/articles/8635857-managing-overdue-personal-tasks If you have any questions contact our team under settings-> support.

content: Good app, was using it for many years. But charging to be able to share lists? If I used it for professional reasons I would pay for it, but for simple grocery lists is too much
replyContent: Our workspace plan is great for professional use you can learn all about it here: https://support.any.do/en/articles/9517093-upgrading-to-any-do-teams-workspace

content: New update is no use. Earlier version was user friendly. That pop up reminder with snooz used to come with some sound then I could snooz or post pone. This is now not working. replyContent: What exactly did you like or dislike about the lastest updates? We work hard to make Any.do the best app for our users, and will be happy to receive any feedback you have, should you contact us at www.any.do/contact_form.

content: Barely used because recurring is under a paywall, that's a very common feature every app has for free.
replyContent: While our Advanced Recurring reminder is a paid feature, all users can use the Recurring Reminders feature, which is free! 😊 For instructions on how to set the Recurring Reminders see our Help Center: https://support.any.do/recurring-reminders/. For any questions or assistance, please contact us at any.do/contact_form.

content: This used to be an amazing app. Now, i wouldnt recommend wasting your time with it. Recently, a lot of it has changed. Like for example, one of my favourite features of this app was that it would give you suggestions for your to do list like "finish" or "clean" or "buy" like sentence starters to prompt the ideas. Then they phased that and a bunch of other stuff out and now days it's just like every other to do list app. Seriously. Don't download it, it's not worth it.
replyContent: We still have that feature accessible via the Widgets! You can learn more about it here - https://support.any.do/widgets/. We encourage you to reach out to us directly via Settings → Support in order to better understand your feedback and get to the bottom of things so we can offer a full resolution! 😊

content: It's extremely confusing. If you accidentally marked a repeating task as done and restore it, it shows multiple tasks including the original repeating tasks which date then shows the upcoming date. Marking a task with subtopics as done automatically marks everything is done instead of reminding you that it includes subtasks that needs to be completed... My ADHD can't with this app. It drives me mad.
replyContent: Any.do's subtasks do not offer dependancies. Any subtask marked as completed will show up again in the next occurrence. If you complete an occurrence the next one will show up with the same subtasks. To learn more see https://shorturl.at/bpBV4. For support please reach out to us via Settings - Support or via www.any.do/contact_form. 🧐

content: App doesn't autosave. If we write a task and press home / the screen goes off, our unsaved task will be gone. Not robust enough
replyContent: The app only saves the changes if you press save. This helps users who accidentally were editing a task and did not mean to erase the data that was already there. So nothing will get lost.

content: Decent but recent changes ahem Omer are not helpful! It's giving less sticky, pushing new features (😴) and makes me want to move to another app!🤭 I doubt replying to their customer feedback will get any changes. The priority will be paid customers naturally.
replyContent: We reply to all users within the time frame we committed to. We are sorry you feel this way! In order to better understand and advise you accordingly, please pinpoint the issues you are having and send it to us via www.any.do/contact_form. We will be happy to assist you :)

content: Very buggy. I've had syncing issues with recurring tasks and now when I open the app, the add task pop up appears at the bottom of my screen. I have to back out of that every time just so I can see my calendar or list of tasks. For an app that claims it will save you time, I've found the opposite to be true. I'll attempt to use it until my subscription is up for renewal. Definitely not worth the $35.99 I spent and I won't be investing in another year.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! In order to better understand contact our team via www.any.do/contact_form. We will be happy to look into it for you.

content: Not available for Samsung Watches
replyContent: Although Any.do is compatible with Android Wear OS, it is not currently compatible with Samsung Wearables. We plan to add more options in the future.

content: I want to subscribe my premium acount
replyContent: We are sorry to hear this, you are welcome to contact our support team for assistance here: www.any.do/contact_form.

content: It used to be simple and effective, but it now has the most loud and obnoxious ads. Beware of opening this app in a class, library, church service, or any other quiet setting that you'll happen to need your lists or notes. It will advertise to everyone around you. I will be uninstalling this app. There are plenty of to-do list apps out there. You don't have to settle for this one. Edit: My phone is always on silent mode so that has not worked. I found another free app that works great! Thanks!
replyContent: For a completely ad-free experience, you might consider our premium subscription. In the meantime, using the app in silent mode or enabling the "Do Not Disturb" feature on your device can help prevent any disruptions.

content: I'm not sure what happened, but now the app randomly creates and adds weird items to a grocery list that I keep deleting. No matter what I do, it keeps making a grocery list every few days while I'm not even using the app. Love the pop-up task reminder at the bottom, but the ghost grocery list creation and randomly adding items has me looking for a different app for my to-do lists.
replyContent: This seems to be an ad (outside of our app) that you're interacting with. Please clear the app's data from the device by going to Settings→Apps→Any.do→Clear data/cache/storage - varies per device. Then, uninstall and re-install the app via Google Play. If it still happens please send us a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report).

content: Not for me! Off the bat, it assumes that you have an extra hour on waking to plan the rest of your day. Um, no! If I did, I don't need an app. Doesn't allow duration entry. Sounds that cannot be turned off. Time frames not sensible, creating custom EVERY time gets OLD. Supremely confusing. Doesn't allow duration entry. Can't repeat that enough. It does work, but if you're cramming in 10/hour, you're better off just spreadsheeting it. Tried them side-by-side, Excel won. And I 🤬🤬🤬 hate Excel.
replyContent: You can set duration in the calendar integration for events, tasks are set to act as action items. You can set reminders and due dates by typing in natural language like reminder me tomorrow at 9:30. You can also drag and drop items in the time category for easy planning. If you need assistance please contact us under settings-> support.

content: Since I wrote my original review in 2017, I have continued to use and rely on the app, but I still have my frustrations. Often, I will type a to do before selecting the time, but the time buttons are so small that I will accidentally hit outside of them, and my to do disappears, meaning I have to retype it again. Also, the pop-ups and list don't sync. So, if I delete a to do on the list in the app, the pop-up remains. I'd also like to be able to remove a batch of to dos at once. The features outweigh the frustrations for me with this app, and I do depend on it daily. I've been using this app for years and loved it... until the last couple of weeks. It has stopped notifying me when a task is due. I have uninstalled and reinstalled, and it works for one day and then stops again. I need an app that notifies me. I am frustrated because I have depended upon and used this app for years without issue, and I have quite the list made!
replyContent: We're so sorry for this Elizabeth! Please note that you can change your font size on you device to be able to see the buttons clearly, regarding the reminders please submit a bug through Settings - Support, our team will be happy to assist you and make sure you are able to use the app properly :)

content: Sadly this is the best to do list I have seen.  Very glitchy.  Tasks done weeks ago magically show up and you have to delete them again.  A grocery list I didn't even want replicated itself 12 times.  My personal list replicated itself 13 times and when I deleted the second to last iteration of this it deleted everything I had ever typed into my lists.  Calendar support only available on ipad and android phone, not in browser window.  You have to trick the system into puting a date on items by setting a reminder and then going back in to deactivate the reminder.  I like that you can move items around however you want and that items left undone today stay in the today category instead of just floating out of the system.  It is odd that something as unfinished as this emerges as king of the hill in this category.  I would have thought that the global creativity and intelligence of humanity would have far surpassed this but apparently not.
replyContent: These are some very odd issues you're experiencing! We highly recommend you submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support so we can look into these issues for you. Regarding the due dates: You can create a task with a due date but no reminder by swiping the bell on the top right of the reminders screen to the left.

content: I got this because it was one of the few list apps that worked with Alexa. Asking Alexa to add things to my list is super easy and it shows up and immediately! But when it comes to editing lists on my phone, it's an absolute pain!!! Most the time it crashes. It did this on my Note 5, and now on my 9. It actually seems worse! I can barely navigate the app without it crashing on me. Please fix! Update: It still crashes when I edit the menu. Sill using my galaxy 9.
replyContent: Hi Jennette, this sounds very odd! Please submit a bug to our team via Settings - Support detailing what exactly you're doing before the app crashes so we can look into this for you :)

content: Custom sound taken away, now you say they're back, thry aren't showing up. Hit and miss with quick add task doing voice input is annoying too. Make that a setting, but the biggest is the custom sound issue. Now adding a timed reminder is harder, just a tiny little bell icon to try and hit (it's crammed next to other icons, so it's easy to tap the wrong one.) Make better improvements, like a continuous scrolling calendar, instead of it jumping between months for a reminder the next day.
replyContent: Any.do is a minimalist task manager, which reflects in our design and functionality. Please note that you can add a Reminder in various ways. To learn more about adding Reminders, you are welcome to visit our Help Center at- https://support.any.do/reminders/. If you have any questions, please let us know here- https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: This app is simple yet functional. I love everything about it and I definitely recommend it. I even tried other popular apps (like todoist) but they don't compare in both simplicity, functionality, and UI. However, any.do glitches horribly. The problems used to be fixed by clearing cache, but now that doesn't even help anymore. I'm now trying to just keep the amount of my tasks really small, which helps. Though really this app should be able to handle more than 40 tasks.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: No way to create recurring tasks without reminders. Like, I know I have to do something (sometimes during) every day, I just need a checkbox to mark it done. I've got a lot of routines the daily completion of which I want to track. But I don't need alerts for all of them every day, cluttering my notifications. Also, no way to pre-skip a future repeated task for a day of two, because you can only see the single upcoming one, and not the ones after it.
replyContent: Please note that the Recurring Reminders are meant to help you keep track of tasks you have to do every day. Once you complete the current recurrence, the next one pops up, so if you wish to skip a recurrence, simply mark it as complete. That said, thank you for the feedback! If we see more demand for more options, we'll be sure to look into it :)
