content: Overall, the app is pretty good. I have a few complaints, but they don't imapct the basic usefulness of the app. 1. The app doesn't make a noise when a reminder comes up. 2. It has been sporadic and may not keep a reminder posted even when it hasn't been marked complete. 3. The format for setting a reminder day is clunky. Recurring reminders are especially difficult and may not even be available (for example, there is no way to set a recurring reminder to every 6 months).
replyContent: This sounds very odd as we're not aware of any issues with receiving or setting up reminders. Please submit a bug report via Settings - Support and our team will look into this ASAP.

content: Alot of great features that I normally find helpful. Biggest plus with this is the reminder, location, my day tasks, and the focus timer! With all that said their were things it lacks like customization of color theme, visual layout format options, additional description for subtasks, showing all features for your tasks in one go rather than selecting written task again to access additional tasks feat, home/setting button disappears when in non- home view. Feels disorganized and glitches often.
replyContent: We believe in a minimalistic approach, and we try to reflect that in our design. This is something that a lot of our users like, however we understand that everyone likes different layouts and UIs. That being said, you are welcome to post your suggestions on our UserVoice page: anydo.uservoice.com and we will look into them if we see high demand!

content: I had an older version of this app on my previous phone and loved it. However, the usability has gone way down somewhere in between.... You need to get rid of the analog clock thing when adding reminders. It takes way too many finger taps than is necessary to set a simple reminder for a given task, and annoyingly resets to the current day and time every time you try to edit a reminder you have created. This is confusing and makes it hard to use this app on-the-go, which is when I need it most..
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way!  We moved to the new Android native clock screen to boost our app's performance. That said, I will pass your feedback to our Product Team.

content: I have used this for a while and, though it isn't a perfect fit, it does a great job of allowing me to schedule alarms for tasks and easy snoozing of those alarms. But they updated and fixed what wasn't broken. Now, all uncompleted tasks show in the task window with no delineation of whether they are recent, scheduled, or past due. Visually, it is very confusing. I'm probably going to dump this app. I would like a good calendar view of things scheduled on each day and it doesn't have that.
replyContent: Please note that we have never released such an update. We are unaware of any issues with the Reminders settings, so that sounds odd. Please send us a bug report via your app Settings - Support, we will be happy to get to the bottom of this for you.

content: Eh, it wasn't for me. Maybe it's because I was using the free version, I didn't think this app was very intuitive at all. First of all, it's very annoying to not be able to set my own reminder times for tasks. I had the option to either choose 9 in the morning or 6 in the evening. What the heck? Secondly, the reminder feature goes off a little too often. Only one reminder is needed. I know I could have turned notifications off, but I did want reminders for my tasks. I should have been able to control the number of reminders. Also, it was pretty lame that I couldn't make multiple lists. I was just dissatisfied overall with my limited options. I deleted and am using another to do list app
replyContent: You can set a reminder for any time you want using the "Custom" option in your reminder settings. Also, you should only get one reminder per task. If this is not the case, please submit a bug report via Settings - Support, so we can look into this for you. You can also make as many lists as you want from the Grid View screen.

content: This could be an AWESOME app. I upgraded so I could add stuff from my various devices. I like that I have my tasks, calendar and even grocery list in one place. However the app CONSTANTLY CRASHES!! EVERY SINGLE DAY it crashes and the ONLY way I can go back into it is if I force close it thru my settings and then open it back up. If that annoyance could be fixed, this could easily be a 5 star app that I would recommend. But at this point, I'm ready to cut my losses and go back to paper and pen!
replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with the app! We will be more than happy to look into this for you and sort this out, should you send us a bug report (Settings- Support), with the relevant details, so we can get to the bottom of this for you!

content: I've been using this app for probably a year now. Loved it! Tho lately, it's slow! It used to auto save and now after every action you have to hit save sometimes it'll save on its own and a lot of times it doesn't even save! SO Going back to pen paper! I also really miss the grid view with the big blue boxes to represent all the folders. It would be nice if when you add things to the list, it can ask if you want it at the bottom or first on that list.
replyContent: The new navigation allows you to find Shortcuts, Lists, Tags and Grocery Lists all under one menu! Tasks are added to the top of the list, and can be easily reordered. Lastly, we are unaware of any issues or lags when saving tasks. Please send us a bug report via your app Settings- Support, and we will be happy to get to the bottom of this for you.

content: So far so good but two improvements would allow me to delete the other planner app I have on my phone.  1) Reminders. I am looking for an app that would act like a print planner where I would list my tasks by day for the future. I'd like to be able to check an app for Mon., Tue, Weds., etc but without having to set a specific reminder for each. Monday should just be Monday without needing to set a time. Would be great to just have a list for the whole day.  2) For lists such as grocery lists, I don't see any setting to allow the app to stay on screen if you are currently in a store and trying to buy off your list. This is important!! No one wants to grocery shop and have to constantly unlock their screen to see the list.
replyContent: You can set a due date without a reminder by setting a reminder and then toggling the bell icon on the right side to disable the alarm. Regarding your Grocery List suggestion, I will pass it to our Dev Team. In the meantime, you can set your device to lock only after manually closing it if you would like that under the device settings.

content: Very robust program, with a good mix of simplicity and capability. HOWEVER, it doesn't seem to be able to display a list on my Wear OS watch (Ticwatch Pro 3). I can input lists from my watch which sync to my phone, but I can't see the lists on my watch after I send the list to my phone. It would be so much better if I could refer to that list on my watch, without having to take out my phone.
replyContent: We are looking into possibly adding this suggestion in upcoming versions. Thank you for your feedback.

content: Not bad, but it definitely prioritizes its "task tracking" purpose over its "calendar" function. Not for me since I'm looking for a calendar app. This doesn't have a month-wide view where the appointments are shown on the day. Instead, you can show all the days of the month, but the "appointments" (or tasks) are shown in the bottom half of the page, and only up to one week.
replyContent: Any.do is a task management app, that said we have a calendar widget that shows a monthly display. To learn more about it see: https://support.any.do/widgets. For further questions, please feel free to contact us here- https://www.any.do/contact_form.

content: Great app but recently I can't turn off the pop-up notifications even when turned off in my phone. It interrupts all other activity in the moment and stops what I'm doing. It's so annoying that I'm deleting the app as customer service couldn't help me resolve this. Really disappointed as I loved this app for year's until the annoying pop-up feature.
replyContent: If you disable the "appear on top" option it should stop this, we would love to have another look into this matter for you so we can help.

content: Mainly, I want the option to have a bigger font!! I forgot to cancel after the free week so I guess I am stuck with it for a year... but the ONLY reason I wanted to cancel thus otherwise good app is the font size. 7/3/19. I did not want to increase the font size of all the other apps etc on my phone in order to increase this one. The others were an adequate size. Since I could not change the size of the font internally to the app, I ended up not using it at all and now I am cancelling.
replyContent: Heya, you can increase fonts from your device's Settings :) As for any subscription issues, you're welcome to reach out to Premium@any.do and our team would be happy to help!

content: Some nice features here. Their approach really set it apart from the other I've tried so far. It's a strong contender as a Wunderlist replacement. The only reason I am still not confident on a switch is their Wear integration. It's terrible! The app doesn't listen to the watch at all. I've tried completing and snoozing and it does nothing. The watch app can only add tasks, so the screenshots they're sharing here are DECEPTIVE. I also wish I could hide completed task, instead of deleting.
replyContent:
Dear Denise,
Could you please contact us via Customers@any.do? We'd love to hear more about this issue in order to assist you.

content: It used to be awesome but I've been having way too many bugs that have almost made it useless. Tasks will disappear after having just added them. Another is having subtasks get locked and unable to edit, or they disappear entirely without having checked it. The grocery is no longer sorting by department (Pantry, Dairy, Meat) and is throwing everything into other. This was especially useful so I saved time reviewing the list and not having to backtrack in the store.
replyContent: Tap the arrow in Quick Bar to save tasks & tap on subtasks to edit them. Completed subtask will remain unless you press on the cross to delete them. We are aware of the issue with the Smart Grocery list. To fix it, try logging out and back in, that should help! If you have any further issues please contact us via Settings → Support! 😊

content: It's a great app, but $36 a year subscription? I don't think so. I might pay $5 to buy it as a one time purchase, but that is insane. Edit: I love how the developer responded quoting a non-existent industry standard pricing... $3-$4 one time would be standard for android apps to unlock the advanced features. You can't even choose when a recurring todo happens without a subscription, making the free version all but unusable. There are lots of other reasonably priced apps that will do this.
replyContent: The Recurring tasks are available for Free to all users. You can set a daily\weekly\monthly\yearly recurring task. Choose the date it starts. Premium users enjoy advanced Recurring Reminders. We will be glad to assist you with any further questions should you contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form.

content: App still needs a lot of work. It's not at the point of being worth a paid subscription. It needs more organizational tools, an easier way to repeat tasks daily/weekly/monthly, as well as a timeframe for each task (not for notifications, but for organization). Also, when getting events from the calendar it should only grab current or future events to reduce the clutter.
replyContent: What organizational tools are you looking for? And what are we missing with our recurring tasks?

content: I love the concept of the app I'm just not digging the functionality. Trying to set a custom date and time is a complete pain in the you know what. Every time I select pm it's stays at am. I have to do it multiple times before it catches. Same issue with the clock. I try to rotate the dial to select an hour and it hangs and throws me over to minutes. I go back to hours and it does the same thing. I finally just gave up. Back to the old string around the finger. ☹️
replyContent: If you're using a single-time reminder for the current day and the morning hours have passed than you will not be able to set the reminder for AM :) Simply select a different date and the AM option will be available.

content: New update was step backwards. My recommemdations: 1) Have daily/weekly/monthly calendar views that show reminders and events in visual boxes (instead of just a list). 2) allow rearranging of the order of subtasks and add subtask reminder capability. Also should be able to check off individual subtasks. 3) allow a task to be turned into a calendar event instead of just a reminder 4) show that an event has subtasks from main view
replyContent: We do support re-ordering subtasks! You can drag/drop them the same as tasks! You can check off individual subtasks too! You can also see whether tasks have subtasks from the main view if it has our subtask icon! As for your other suggestions: These are great ideas! We've forwarded them to our product team and will definitely look into adding them.

content: Overall a good productivity enhancer. However, randomly refuses to stay open. I can call it up, it come on for 2seconds then disappears. Will work fine for a while, then starts to randomly shift months and years while I'm creating a schedule, then dissappears and won't stay up for more than 2seconds..... help! I've rebooted both app and phone ( galaxy s10).
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly!

content: !!REFUND REQUEST!! I trial'ed this on the app and loved it! When I migrated my tasks and started using it full time, I found some issues with the web interface that I can't live with. (logs me out every night. requires a resync of my calendar every log on. no outlook calendar on the PC. I have to reselect my alternate calendars every time I have to log back on. all tasks require a due date or they will show up in Today.) The app is GREAT! Web needs some additional functionality for my purposes. There wasn't a money back guarantee, but I'd love a refund if you're willing. Thanks!
replyContent: Please use this link to access the web app https://desktop.any.do It will stay logged in this way and keep your calendar synced. If you subscribe your outlook account to your google calendar you will be able to see its events in your PC :) If you have any other questions please contact us via support setting in your app, we will be happy to assist.

content: I subscribe to the pro version. I like everything about Any.do except I've been unable to stop it from adding calendar events as tasks. I've worked back and forth with support. I have no calendars added to the app or any integrations in my Google calendar, yet everything I add still appears as a task in Any.do. No one can seem to figure it out.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: I used to love this app and recommend it to friends regularly. The updates have made it harder to use. I don't need anything fancy. I just need a list. I don't want to clear or uncheck all items on my grocery list, I just want to go through it and untick the ones I need today. I regret ever using the 'smart' grocery list bc now, even though I have turned it off, it won't revert to basic and my list is essentially useless.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way. We plan to issue a feature to convert Grocery Lists to regular ones in one of our next versions. We apologize for any inconvenience.

content: Another "free" app that just wants you to upgrade to premium. I'm not paying $2.99 MONTHLY for something as basic as labels and color coding. I played with it for a bit, and find the interface annoying just to try to edit the grocery list was a pain. Also when trying to add a task I kept accidentally closing the new task as I tried to swipe left thru the options to select someday. I touched it too high so whatever I typed was lost. Uninstalling & will try out others that are actually free
replyContent: Sorry you feel this way. Any.do is a minimalist task manager, which reflects in our design and functionality. 90% of the app is completely free, including all core functionality, however, the Color Tags are a part of the Premium features. If you are experiencing any issues, we will gladly assist, should you contact us at- www.any.do/contact_form :)

content: Great features, ability to collaborate, and plenty of options. I just wish the interface was designed by a human being, it's the most cluttered and hard to navigate todo list app by far. Compare it to Google Tasks for example: You just open the app and start typing, and everything you need is right there, with easily discoverable features. This app constantly had me frustrated and searching around for what I wanted to do. UI in general looks like a high schooler with a UI hobby made it. Basic af
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! We love user feedback and we are doing all we can to constantly improve. You are welcome to reach out to us at www.any.do/contact_form and we will gladly assist you on any question or issue you may experience :)

content: The app is pretty good and has good features. However, when I shared a grocery list with my fiance it wouldn't let him accept and it it sent him TONS of emails regarding it. Literally 1 every few minutes for hours and I have no clue how to stop this without him just unsubscribing. Given that sharing is a big part of why I wanted the app, it does put a damper on things for me.

Looks good at first but lacks basic widgets. For example, you can't control the font size on the widget. In order for it to show you both tasks and calendar entries for your day, you'll need to devote nearly your whole screen to see it. No compact view to only show your day's items. There's a mandatory footer and header on the widget that takes up valuable real estate that cannot be turned off.
replyContent: The calendar view will show events and tasks together for your day. For the rest of your feedback please contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form, and we’d love to look into if for you.

content: Love it! Allows me to drag items from one day to another without having to type things in twice. ***Update: after using this app for 3 years it suddenly wanted me to sign in and now EVERYTHING is gone ***2nd UPDATE: user error ;) Fast response from customer support! Back to 5 stars!***3rd update: 2023 very glitchy, trying to move items from one day to another, suddenly pops back or arbitrarily lands on another day. Happens multiple times during the day. I want to like this app. Only 3 stars
replyContent: We would be happy to help you resolve all of the issues you have encountered should you send us a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report).

content: Beautiful interface but it is very annoying to navigate and not fluid. Creating reoccurring tasks seems to be a pain. Not sure if it's me or the app, but I kept having to change the time 2-3 times to get the correct times reoccurence. Grocery list is awesome. The calendar looks like Google calendar which is nice but it is choppy to navigate.
replyContent: We are here for you! You are welcome to reach out to us so we could assist you in resolving all of your issues ASAP :) Please write to us at https://www.any.do/contact_form.

content: The app continues to improve, but it lacks one feature for me... the ability to turn off the pop- up I get on my screen every morning to tell me it's ready to "plan my day". Let me make this clear...I don't want you to plan my day so stop telling me to do it. I've tried turning off all notifications, but no luck. And everywhere I go on the app it tries to sell me the premium upgrade.... just annoying.

Perfect except for one fatal flaw. (READ) Coming from G Tasks, Wunderlist and MS ToDo, I enjoy the added G Calender integration and the Time-blocking feature. Well designed and smooth interface. HOWEVER, the major concern is that it doesn't let you combine multiple lists in one folder. I need a work folder with multiple lists for projects, a school folder with lists for classes etc. It gets messy and it desperately needs folders. PLEASE update for the millions of us from MS To-Do and the likes.
replyContent: As of now we have lists with tasks and under tasks we have subtasks. We are going to release in the near future Amy.do Workspace that we have projects with sections. We will be sure to advertise the release :)

content: It could be great but too hard to delete an item on your agenda. It's like you put it on your agenda and it just doesn't disappear after it's over it just keeps on repeating very annoying sad that I paid the full subscription amount thinking it would help me to stay focused with my work day, but only for a few days until it started repeating itself and I tried to find a way to cancel or delete something out of the agenda completely
replyContent: You sound like you may have a recurring reminder. This is a task that is intended to repeat after each time you mark it complete. To delete this, open up the task's reminder settings, and then press the "x" icon or the "trash can" icon to delete the reminder. Save your changes, and you should now be able to clear the task successfully.

content: I've turned off every notification option I can find and I still get pop up reminders on my screen. I just want a silent reminder in my notification bar. Can't tell you how many times a reminder has popped up during a call and I can't press the end button to hang up. Or accidently clicked the reminder while trying to do something else on my phone. Please give an option or tell me where to find it for notifications WITHOUT a popup on the screen that steals focus on whatever I'm working on.
replyContent: Hi Cody, please note, we have disabled the popup for anyone who uses Android Q, however we may look into adding more versions of Android to this list in the future.

content: Love this app, but some functions make the productivity lacking. In my experience, there is a limited amount of notifications I can receive from this app per day. There appears to be no way to change this on the settings for my phone or the app. This is problematic for me, because I have the premium version and have it connected to Zapier. I am not receiving push notifications when actions are taking place. Very disappointing, as this is crucial for time management projects with teams.

It's got promise, just not there yet. To many glitches to justify the premium version. Small things here an there but the main problem is events consistently erase information and become in unable to edit. Now you have permanent events stuck in your calendar that cannot be changed. For the free version I guess you could put up with it but it's still annoying. It's got style and potential. One day I hope to be back and check it out again.
replyContent: We are not aware of any issues with editing the calendar, so that's odd. Please send us a bug report via your app Settings - Support, we will be happy to get to the bottom of this for you.

content: Response to dev: I'm removing the complaint about recurring events, they do have them its just kind of weird to set up at first. As for pricing, I'm just going off of the integration ad from the app itself. If Zapier integration isn't legit then your app has been compromised. Its alright for a basic to-do list. Nothing fancy, not a ton of features by itself. Clean, and simple. Offers integrations through Zapier, which is very expensive for individual users.
replyContent: Regarding to the price - we recommend checking out our Pricing Page for more details https://www.any.do/pricing. As for the Zapier integration - it offers up to 5 Zaps completely for free for our Premium users. You can read more about it here - https://support.any.do/zapier.

content: Extremely aggressive in pushing the premium and paid version. Also overly complex since as its name denotes, it tries to do everything or anything. It may be beneficial to consolidate and duplicate tasks of several other apps even though some can perform better. Compare the shopping list in Google Keep which is easier to add or subtract items from a constant shopping list. This app combining tasks from other apps can be useful, depending on an individual's preferences and abilities.
replyContent: Any.do is a minimalist task manager, to help our users remain focused only on what matters. You can learn all about the app and the features at- support.any.do. Note that the Premium ad only shows up when first opening the app, and when clicking on 'Go Premium', while 90% of the app is completely free, including all core functionality!

content: Has Any.do changed the way Moment works? Five stars for me until recently, and not sure if it's associated with change to Android 10 or a change with the app. I used to have Moment pop up daily. I no longer get Moment, nor continued pop-up on screen reminders for tasks throughout the day. Just looking for clarification that these are no longer features in the non-paid version.

I've been using the app for a while mostly just as a reminder app. Finally, I put together a plan to use it as my primary task tracker. Great app for managing tasks 👏 A little learning curve 🤔 Sync with Google Calendar was easy 😁 No CUSTOM Task reminder sounds?!!? 😡 (💦 sound = Drink) Also, no multi-reminders for Tasks or times for Subtasks. Had to put 4 of the SAME daily tasks in as Stretch 1, Stretch 2....etc.

Overall, I like the app. However, I'm uninstalling because of the pop-up notification that goes over other apps and basically freezes my phone until i dismiss it. The app doesn't have permission to draw over other apps and no way to disable this notification. The only reason it isn't 1 star is because overall the app is good.. they just ruin it with that 'feature'.

It's pretty complicated to get used to and not fast to use at all if you're doing more than adding s generic task... Annoyed that I subscribed for. YEAR thinking it would actually be able to synchronize with the popular apps I use but no. It only syncs with like, three, and you need some third party thing that you basically have to code yourself for other apps. Stupid. Not even worth the black Friday discount subscription price.
replyContent: We recommend all users to check out our extensive Help Center to better learn how to utilize the app- support.any.do. Please note that Any.do offers multiple independent integrations with leading services like Alexa, Gmail, WhatsApp and more, and Zapier allows you to connect to 1500+ other apps. For assistance, contact us- www.any.do/contact_form.

content: I love this app and have been using for year's. Since the last update and a change of phones the app isn't working right. I can't set the am/pm on a reminder, it sets it up by itself with the wrong time. Very frustrating as this app keeps my whole life organized. Really hoping for an update so I can go back to 5 stars.
replyContent: Hi Nancy, we received your bug report and we're looking into this with our Dev Team! We apologize for the inconvenience and will do our best to get this resolved ASAP.

content: Updated: It's widget can switch between calander / todolist and view the events for the calander, in the widget when clicking instead of it opening the calander app like most apps. It's task list doesn't seem to sync to gtasks but the calander does. Upgrade to premium to add things like a recurring event, daily planner, WhatsApp reminders, extra colors etc.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you aren't enjoying Any.do. If you have any feedback about the app that you'd like to share, we'd love to hear it at Customers@any.do. We're constantly trying to make the best app possible for our users, so feedback like yours is vital for improving the app.

content: I left a review earlier that was one star. While the app wasn't for me (I found that it was confusing and didn't suit my needs so I deleted it shortly after) The customer service was fantastic. I was charged for a subscription even though I didn't use the app because I made a mistake in canceling the subscription. I sent an email detailing my problem and asking for a refund. The response was quick and a refund was granted I thought it was only fair to come back and leave a nicer review.
replyContent: Thanks for updating your review! Please note that you are welcome to use the app's free version, for as much as you wish :)

content: Anydo is great, but... - 1star for no account free option. I value privacy more than cross-platform. - 1 star for upgrade requiring yearly payments. I understand that $3/mo doesn't seem like much to developers, but for people who have many apps and limited funds, subscriptionware adds up. (And we don't hit a coffee shop more than a couple times a year, so swallow the urge to make that comparison) Anydo is simple to use and has a clean, clear interface. Too bad there's no simple upgrade.
replyContent: Like many other apps, we require users to log in with an account, to make sure that all your information is available 24/7 across all platforms. That said, 90% of the app is completely free! There is no need to upgrade, since you can use all the core features of Any.do for free!

content: When it works, it works pretty well. But it has a lot of glitches. And now recently it will automatically move my tasks around into a different order. And if I move something to a different location on the list, in a second or two, it moves it back and maybe even moves some other things around. It is now doing this all the time,and it's incredibly frustrating when I'm trying to put things in the order I want to get them done. So I'm looking for a new list app cuz I'm tired of fighting with this.
replyContent: We will be happy to review this issue, please send us a bug report so we can get to the bottom of this for you. Settings-> support-> report a bug.

content: Started out strong... First few days perfect, synced to smart watch and woke with everything planned. But now it's not sending the notifications regularly - not to watch or android phone. Added it to the PC and tried the phone widget - maybe that broke it. Weird pile of repeated completed daily tasks with no time set, while the daily tasks with times don't notify. Some work then don't - very frustrating. Clearing the cache/reinstall didn't work. Feels like a battle to get it to function. :/

*EDIT* My task list is back. Will report back on app functionality*------Checked any.do today and all my tasks were gone. I downloaded the update hoping that would fix it but still no tasks. Not sure if this is a bug but seems other users have been having similar issues according to reviews. Also reading that previous standard features are now premium and must be paid for. Horrible thing to do to current users and without any notice.
replyContent: Any.do is a free app. We provide 95% of our features at no cost, including all core features. We never made a free feature Premium. We are unaware of any issue with disappearing tasks. If you experienced such issue, please submit a bug report from settings - support. If you need any further support, we are here for you at Customers@any.do :)

content: Time to revise I guess! The app worked fine but I cannot end the billing. I stopped working a year ago. I have contacted them several times. I reinstalled the software because they said subscription was controlled n app. I cannot stop their billing. I am on fixed income since last yr but I cannot stop their billing. I have tried since 2/23! I wouldn't sign up again if I can get unsigned I get report through my Google but there is no active subscription to disable. DON'T subscribe! DO NOT DO IT!
replyContent: You can find information on how to cancel all subscription plans on our website at https://bit.ly/3nIPU5A. Our team would be happy to look into your subscription issue, should you contact us at www.any.do/contact_form.

content: Presently use for Tasks &Reminders only, but it's great! Needed support once, and was very helpful and quick! Reducing to 3 Stars. They must've made some changes that I don't care for. Too many reminder steps, and the reminder doesn't show up when it supposed to. Looking for new Reminder App.
replyContent: What do you find troublesome about the update? We'd love to get your feedback about what specifically you liked or disliked about the new update, by writing to us at Customers@any.do. We're constantly trying to provide the best possible app for our users, and feedback like yours help us do so.

content: Used this when it was a slick and minimal to-do app years ago and wanted to give it another shot. Slick UX still, but no way to sync the calendar (that takes up half of the apps feature set) with my outlook / work calendar without jumping through hoops and zapier integrations. Between that and the other task apps I already have, uninstalled for now.
replyContent: On the mobile app you can sync any calendar you wish on the desktop apps we have a free workaround to view your events from other calendars, we are sorry this is not the solution you were looking for.

content: This app was great until they started adding a self-promotion advertisement that is Loud and obnoxious! it pops out of nowhere "These 3 tools..." without nitice and it's become the most annoying thing ever, overshadowing all the great things of Any.do > What is the thought process? that by surprising users with obnoxious loud advertisements one would suddenly feel the urge to upgrade? More like an urge to uninstall
forced users to give credit card detail to try and use. thats not a good method. caused wasted transactions. immediately i found this app was not what i wanted. i need a calender monthly view
replyContent: You can dismiss the premium offer and use the app for free.

content: Very strange ux for simple day tasks app. Some elements works like you don't expect it (example - top left corner checkox is tips/notifications screen and not select all elements). You have to get use to it, but I failed. p.s. and also very strange to get annoing tutorial video in the middle of your working process with tasks. Also it is strange that people in this ads are telling you something but you cant hear it (when I'm working with tasks I dont have ability to unmute phone). Add some subti
replyContent: We passed on your feedback regarding the new videos we added. The notification center icon has a red dot if you have a new update and it looks. To learn more see: https://support.any.do/en/articles/8616775-the-notifications-center

content: The colour of app and on screen Android button is the same. This makes it very difficult to find on screen navigation buttons while using the app.
replyContent: We are not sure what you are referring to.🤔 Can you please send a screenshot to Settings -> Support

content: App was good. Now the AI gimmicks and other stupid subscription model and it's ads have screwed up the app.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way. We sent the feedback to our team.

content: 20-apr-2024 After recent updates, I am not getting recurring reminders. Simple and powerful. I have been using this for several years. I loved the missed call feature. Now it seems like gone. Also the desktop version do not take reminder commands.
replyContent: Kindly note that due to API changes implemented by Google, Any.do is no longer able to support the Missed Call and Call Follow Up feature

content: This was a great 5 star app 10 years ago when I first used it, and still great 5 years ago. Haven't used it for a while, installed again, now it's just really complicated, confusing, and difficult to use. And there are some CSS issues on the plan page for the family plan.
replyContent: Please reach out to our Support Team, by submitting a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report). We will be more than happy to get to the bottom of this, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: loud obnoxious add will randomly start playing while adding items to your list. no way to silence it other than exit the app
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! If you are getting the video ad more than once, please contact our team for assistance under settings-> support.

content: Doesn't seems to be able to repeat task. Don't have 1 time payment. Only monthly subscription.
replyContent: We have a yearly and a monthly plan, the Recurring tasks are available for Free to all users. You can set a daily\weekly\monthly\yearly recurring task. Choose the date it starts. Premium users enjoy advanced Recurring Reminders. Please see more information here: https://support.any.do/en/articles/8635373-recurring-reminders-for-personal-tasks

content: Amazing app, but I had some problems with it. When I set up to remember me in sometimes, the app didn't remember with pop us or even notification. All permissions is allowed on my cell phone. Sometimes the app works very well, show notifications and sometimes, the app doesn't work. Yesterday I set up to remember me 9:30 PM, just in the morning in other day, that shows notification about yesterday. I don't know if the problem is the app,isn't otimized enough in this moment in develop.
replyContent: Hi, we are not 100% sure we understand what you are referring to. We would be happy to assist you should you send us a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report).

content: I used it for a couple days and did not want to use it. PROBLEM IS THEY WILL NOT LET ME CANCEL. THEY WILL CHARGE MY CREDIT CARD. PLEASE HELP!!! The cancelation was made with their help. The "Delete Account" should include a sentence about canceling the subscription.
replyContent: You can find information on how to cancel all subscription plans on our website at https://support.any.do/en/articles/8636514-refunds-cancellations. Our team would be happy to look into your subscription issue, should you contact us at www.any.do/contact_form.

content: Great app. I've been using it for years now and I love it. Great to see new features being added every now and then to keep it fresh and useful. Update: I have an issue with saving subtasks. Sometimes there's replication even when I create just one subtask. Also, can you enable autosave? God forbid if I create tasks and my phone screen turns off before I save coz I'll lose any new changes I made. I used to autosave a while back. Please fix this.
replyContent: If you are experiencing issues with the subtasks please submit a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report). So our team can get to the bottom of this for you :)

content: To be fair, I downloaded it and uninstalled it after a couple of minutes. The reason for this is that I hate apps that scream "pay me money" since the instance you download it, and this one did that exactly. With the "free premium trial" being in your face all the time, and then setting it up or going through the tutorial you could see all the features and all you could see is "premium". Just do the app as a paid one instead of begging for people to pay for it. It looks amazing though.
replyContent: Please note that 90% of the app is completely free, and we allow our users to enjoy all core features for as much as they wish without a requirement to upgrade :) The Premium ad only shows up when first opening the app, and when clicking on a Premium feature. You can opt out by clicking on 'No, Thanks' on the ad :)

content: This was a great app, a year or more, ago. The simplicity of adding and checking off tasks, without clutter of a bunch of fancy features, was it's strength. Basically, it was as simple as making a list on a piece of paper, with the added bonus of having reminders. Now, however, it requires more steps to add to-dos, and is becoming more of a complicated app, loosing the original appeal. As of some time ago, notifications also stopped working, which mean I will leave, after some 5+ years of use.

Decent app, very helpful to split things up visually but several issues over the past few months of usage. Tasks suddenly stop syncing up from a desktop PC to the app, deletion of lists seem to work but then the lists re-appear, and most recently all the tasks that have been completed over a period of time are suddenly back in my list. On a basic level, this app is useful, for anything more than that it's not the solution I was hoping for. I am a little OCD but if you are too then look elsewhere
replyContent: We're sorry for this experience! Please submit a bug report via Settings - Support so our team can look into this for you!

content: Really difficult to review. Have been using this for years but now dropping out of use. If you just need a very simple task list with in-your-face reminders then this is the only one on the market that. It's reminders jump out. If you Keep it simple then it is ace. But big flaws too. New features keep in getting introduced in a way that are not compatible with old ones. And some features introduced but dropped. Some ideas just not really followed through properly. So close to being amazing.
replyContent: If you have any suggestions for the app you can also post your idea on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it!

content: I really like any.do and having my to do list and events in the same place. However I have knocked off stars because I need more customisable repeat options and notifications. Sometimes my tasks are every two weeks, or every other day, or every 3 days. Would be nice for this option. I also like to put reminders in for my work calendar. I don't seem to get the option to change this when doing a new event reminder. Can't afford premium. Shame. Back to Google calendar. :(
replyContent:
Hi, please note that we do support advanced recurrence settings! You are able to customize your recurring reminders in this way, however please note that this is a premium feature.
You can learn more here: https://support.any.do/recurring-reminders/

content: I have used this app for years, it is great if you want to be more organized and get reminders of the tasks you need to do. I must say however, that the app itself has regressed throughout the years with all the updates. Things used to be simple and intuitive, now I don't understand what half the buttons do, basic functions like deleting and removing tasks are way too clunky. The concept of the app is great but I can't recommend it anymore, each update makes it worse.
replyContent: Please note that completing and deleting tasks, have stayed the same all along. We'd love to get your feedback about what specifically you liked or disliked about the new update, by writing to us at https://www.any.do/contact_form. We're constantly trying to provide the best possible app for our users, and feedback like yours help us do so.

content: Some features just don't work in the free app! I have tried to set a daily reminder for 9am to put a ticket in my car. Once I click "Done", it sets the reminder the next day.... at 1am. I dismissed the 1am reminder once, half asleep as the sound woke me up, it never reminded me again and now I have a parking fine to pay. I have real memory difficulties and need an app that actually works properly! Disappointing, as I find the one off reminders really helpful.
replyContent: We are unaware of any issue with the Recurring Reminders, so that's odd. Please make sure to follow instructions provided on our Help Center at- https://support.any.do/recurring-reminders/. For any questions or assistance, please contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form, and we will be happy to look into it for you.

content: Great when it works, but currently keeps crashing. At the moment each time I try to open the app it just closes itself. Also when I try to rearrange a task it doesn't always work, particulay if it's one out of a recurring sequence. Even if I select 'only this one' it tries to change all events in that sequence, which is very frustrating. Shame, because there's a lot I really like about the app but the faults make it literally unusable.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: GREAT APP BUT: Slowly getting use to the new UI. Two things with subtasks that drive me crazy though: pressing 'back' (the button used on many apps to close the keyboard) deletes your new subtasks entry, and unless you exit back to the main list before leaving the app, your new subtask entry will not be saved. Sure I can get around this with careful use, but it's up to the developers to make the app work intuitively. Please fix!
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We've forwarded your suggestion to our product team and will definitely look into implementing it if we see more similar feedback from other users.

content: Using Share this list crashes the App. Need a fix. Rest seems fine.
replyContent: As we’ve announced on our Blog - https://www.any.do/blog/, and sent by email to users with shared lists, the list sharing will be phased out in favor of our collaboration and sharing we launched. You can try it out right away with a 14-day free trial. You can learn all about it here: https://www.any.do/workspace 😊

content: As someone who forgets a lot of things, this app is just great. Not only does it remind me of daily things I need to do, but also with the repeat option I'm never late paying bills and more. A lot of issues ever since I switched to Xiaomi Redmi Note 6 Pro. My Plan Your Day will not comence at all, reminders don't repeat or they are blocked in the background. Don't know if it Xiaomi or this app, anyone please help?
replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with the app! We will be more than happy to look into this for you and sort this out, should you send us a bug report. Please submit a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report) with the relevant details, so we can get to the bottom of this for you!

content: I used this app some time ago, at which point it was not overcomplicated. Now it is, however still less overcomplicated than its competitors. The day planning concept is nice, at least for people who don't have a dozen of apps that are most important each (Slack, work Google Calendar and Jira, namely). It doesn't do dirty tricks like notifications as reminders, and convincing you to override DND. Some interface design choices are confusing, still. Adding calendar doubles the cal notifications.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! You can actually import your Jira items to My Day, and integrate with Slack in our Workspace plan, to avoid managing several apps at once :) To learn more about our imports and integrations, see: https://bit.ly/3S3Pho7

content: A good app but it's got such an annoying design flaw... Every time you go to add a reminder and select a time from the swipable menu with "tomorrow morning, next week, someday, custom" options, the menu is so thin that if you don't click with extreme precision within the menu boundaries it closes the 'add reminder" section and deletes whatever you've typed. I accidentally click outside the menu alllllll the time and have to re-type everything multiple times.
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback, In the meantime you can add tasks using the + symbol next to the category, there you can add reminders with out is closing. You can also add reminder after you save the task and have a full reminders menu.

content: Was initially a 5 star review, as all was very useful. However, over the last month or so it has been experiencing alot of instability. Frequent "lock ups" (screen freezes and won't do anything till it's forceably closed), crashing, not saving data correctly, or at all (very frustrating if you have written something lengthy). I've now taken to drafting anything I put in there in another app first (which is pretty ridiculous). Unsure if this is due to app "load" as I have alot of data stored.
replyContent: Please uninstall and reinstall the app's latest version from Google Play. If you're still experiencing any issues, kindly contact us via Settings → Support or via www.any.do/contact_form, so our team can look into this for you. 🧐

content: It looks good, but it isn't as intuitive as it feels it should be. There are a lot of quirks. When I add a task, then go in to set it to repeat, it marks the first occurrence as done. Sometimes when amending reminders it creates duplicates in the list. I tried using things like "6am daily" when using the quick create, as it says you can use natural language, but it doesn't recognise daily. I can't see how to set a task as daily immediately, you have to create a task then go in and edit it.
replyContent: We would be happy to help you resolve all of the issues you have encountered should you send us a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report).

content: My notifications bar is telling me i have no tasks today even when i know i do which is kind of frustrating. Plus when i log into the app, my tasks aren't in chronological order for some reason after i set times for them at the beginning of the day. Other than that, i think it's a fab app and i love the little pop ups that happen at the beginning of the day and when a task needs to be done!
replyContent:
Regarding the notification bar, this is odd! We highly recommend you submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support. 
Note that our tasks are ordered chronologically only on our Calendar View, while on our Task View you can drag and drop tasks to anywhere you like :)

content: The free app works well but pops up with annoying notifications every now and then to remind you to set more reminders... Kind of pointless. I'm also not a fan of the subscription model for premium. The layout and app itself is good though so it's a shame about those negatives. I would have considered buying if there was a one-time payment model.
replyContent: You can disable any notifications you don't like from the app. The Any.do Moment reminder which can be toggled off in settings. The only other notifications you should receive are for reminders, which if you don't like, you can turn off these reminders and simply have due dates for tasks without any notification.

content: Good but the mobile app doesn't seem to sync to my google calendar. Not the case for the web page on my laptop though. I've tried reinstalling but to no avail.
replyContent: Please contact our team under settings-> support and we will be happy to look into this matter.

content: The app is OK but it could be much better in terms of usability. For example: 1. When setting a new reminder, the first button (which you are most likely to press without thinking) should be 'set timer', not 'share the task'. More people will want to set a reminder than share a person note. 2. The 'focus' button when the reminder comes up is in the prime location for when you are typing/using your phone and leads to you accidentally cancelling reminders each time.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We truly value our users input, and our Product team is always adding user suggestions to our roadmap. We would be more than happy to hear any other suggestions you have for the app at Customers@any.do!

content: I was excited to use this app but I was disappointed to find out it's pretty bare bones unless you pay for premium.
replyContent: We have many free features you are welcome to learn all about them here: https://support.any.do/en/articles/8635977-any-do-subscription-plans#h_0a18ffebbb

content: the simple layout makes navigation easy and intuitive. I decided to try this as an alternative to Google calendar and whislt its integration of AI assistants and task tracking seems very good, as a calendar I have to say im not impressed. Looking at the calendar from a months perspective doesnt show at a glance which days you have something happening, rather, below the calendar is a schedule view which shows you what events you have which i find confusing. Would be nice to view by month.
replyContent: If you would like to see color tags for events on the monthly view, you can view it on our widget https://support.any.do/widgets/ :)

content: I'm new to using Any.do, so I'm still really unfamiliar with the app. I'm so far finding that the free version is quite limited... I wanted to try the free version before doing the free trial for the premium, to compare the differences. The main point I'm unhappy with, is the fact that the reminders don't make any noise, so if you're not looking at your phone, you never realize you're getting a reminder. Is there a way in the free version to put a sound to the reminders?
replyContent: You should hear sound when receiving an Any.do reminder! We highly recommend you submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: App features are good, user interface is friendly but its confusing and time taking. I made recurring tasks but it showed only that particular day task was made after that you have to select the task. Here I was expecting that task will be lined up automatically. Things good in app is AI support, and other features.
replyContent: Recurring reminders are generated upon completion 🤓 Once the first item is set up, you will see the next ones appear as the current items are done.

content: I like it, a lot and also not a lot. I like the way it looks once the tasks are created, but I dislike creating the tasks using the current interface. 4 comments. 1. I have the full version with WhatsApp linked and it causes duplicate reminders. 2. The widgets are not recognized by my homescreen replacement app (go launcher). 3. I would like to be able to resize the fonts and spacing. 4. Creating tasks via WhatsApp or Google assistant is very limited in its possibilities and often erroneous.
replyContent: Hi Co, please note that you are able to turn off receiving Whatsapp reminders via settings => integrations => Whatsapp. We would be more than happy to hear any further feedback you may have, and assist with any issue, please contact us at Customers@any.do or submit a bug report via Settings - Support, so we can further assist you!

content: Nice but there are few things that make my experience difficut: 1. It's definitely inconvenient to drag task from one manu to another 2. No option to change the manues to be in parallel (like columns) or to change the titles 3. Web ui super small! You cannot see the big page at once (I really didnt understand why it's so small!) 4. No direct chat or support
replyContent: Please note that you can drag and drop tasks (support.any.do/tasks), and change the lists' titles as explained here - support.any.do/lists. The parallel columns view is available on the Web apps at this time, and we would be happy to receive any feedback you have regarding the UI. Please feel free to contact us anytime at- www.any.do/contact_form.

content: Very useful app if you are in the habit of forgetting things. But it has one major defect. If you have set up a recurring reminder and if you miss one instance of that reminder, further instances will never show up. They are gone forever. I had to pay a penalty fee for late payment into my credit card because of that ridiculous bug.

Used to love this app, till the last update where they introduced the My Day feature which was a bit redundant since the calendar view was perfect fine to view your day (and more useful too). But the biggest kicker is that they took away the 'quick task add activity.' Now you have to go into the app then press add then choose between event and task. A To Do List without a quick add feature is like a car without power steering. Usable but inconvenient, bordering on impractical.
replyContent: You can use the widget the add an event or a task quickly, if you have any suggestions, you are welcome to post your suggestion on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it!

content: Nicely organised good app, please work on calendar graphics.
replyContent: Please share your ideas with us under setting -> support. Thank you!

content: App was perfect until they added annoying unskipable pop up ads
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! If you are getting the video ad more than once, please contact our team for assistance under settings-> support.

content: I have been using this app for a while now because it was simple and I could easily look and check off tasks as I finished them, I just needed the basics, until recently didn't have any problems with the free version. Now an annoying pop up with their premium app shows up. I will be looking for a new app
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! If you are getting the video ad more than once, please contact our team for assistance under settings-> support.

content: Hi, today the editing or deleting of events stoped working. When selected to be edited the event opens in a window without it's name and if you choose edit the window closes and goes back to the calendar. Also by swiping your finger on the list it can not be deleted. I really love the app, it's has worked perfectly so far but like this it's useless, please advise. Kind regards, Marta Santos
replyContent: This is very odd! We highly recommend you submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: I'm about to uninstall it. I used it for a few months, not the worst, but never really liked the UX. I would prefer a much simpler app. Also the notification system was a dealbreaker because the bubble only showes the app name, not the event.
replyContent: Our app is very simple if you need any assistance or have any questions feel free to contact our team under settings -> support. The notification settings can be adjusted from your mobile device settings. You can get the event in the notification if you set it that way.

content: I regret paying for a subscription to any.do. Seems like a good app, but keeps showing me text that says "connect Google calendar to plan your day." There seems no way to say "no thanks, now stop asking me this! I find it irritating. Meanwhile, I found a beautiful Tasks app that does everything I want, is free, and does not nag me, so I think I will switch to that.
replyContent: We are not sure what you are referring to, are you referring to the calendar view in the app? Our team will be happy to look into this, should you contact us at- www.any.do/contact_form.

content: brilliant app, worth the money, but please please please fix the annoying main screen. Whenever you open the app it doesn't allow you click on anything, until you type something in the box at the bottom. I'm not always opening the app to set a reminder, sometimes I just want to look at my lists. I'm forced to hit the back button or type something and cancel it, before I can touch anything else on the screen.
replyContent: Are you using your native app launcher or a different one? Kindly contact us via Settings → Support or via www.any.do/contact_form, so our team can look into this for you. 🧐

content: This is a simple free app. With an easy to use features and interface. But not much to explore, limited, with only the premium features as something that might pique your interest on. Other than those, this app does what it says on the description. If you're interested in a straight-to-the-point checklist, with minimal features, I think this can be your go to app. (3 stars; since this is not what I, personally, would look for in a to do app)
replyContent: 90% of the app is completely free, including all core functionality, and unlike similar apps, we allow our users to enjoy most of the features for as long and as much as they wish without any 3rd party ads or a requirement to upgrade :)

content: still works but it was better before they made it more complicated to slap a price tag on "premium" features.
replyContent: Our subscription plans are not new, are you referring to a specific feature or issue? If so please send your feedback here www.any.do/contact_form

content: Reminders have stopped working after latest build update. When the reminder's set time arrives, nothing happens. Possibly WearOS related. Please fix!
replyContent: As long as you’ve turned your reminders ON and enabled the app notifications in your device settings, you should be getting them. Please check out this article https://support.any.do/en/articles/8635354-personal-task-reminders.If you're experiencing any issues please submit a bug report via Settings - Support so our team can look into this.

content: When you have a list open and hit the android back button the app closes. It would be much more intuitive if instead it goes back to the view with all lists. Also the notifications for repeated tasks don't work properly. I just get the first notification but not the repeated ones for the following weeks.
replyContent: The way recurring reminders work is that when you complete the current recurrence, the next one pops up. If you are not viewing the app in date view, it will look like the same task has popped up again, but it is really the next occurrence of the task. Only when completing the current occurrence, will you be able to see the next one.

content: does not seem to work with google calendar, I see no reason to give them my payment info for a free premium trial. // I managed to add the google calendar. it took all the events, bur not the reminders in calendar . I still won't use this, as it seems to be a replacement interface but I like the google display better. I don't need to pay this much for few benefits to me. I have not found anything that I like yet, either.
replyContent: The payment info is a Google Play requirement which Any.do has no control over :) That said, 95% of the app is completely free and unlike similar apps, we allow our users to enjoy most of the features for as long and as much as they wish without any 3rd party ads or a requirement to upgrade :)

content: Good app but... There are things that is annoyingly hidden behind a subscription that I find frustrating cause they should be free. The worst is colors on the events on calendar etc. Why the hell do I have to pay for something that is free in Google, that you even can pull from. E.g. if I change colors in Google Calendar and pull that, the colors are changed. Subscriptions just need to die, period. Pay for something = it's yours. On top of that it lacks week numbers on calendar.
replyContent:
The calendar integration is not a paid feature, premium users can create as many color tags as they want for tasks.
To learn more see: https://support.any.do/en/articles/8635977-any-do-subscription-plans

content: Hi, Developers! I started to use this app and seems liked it but for now there's 1 thing that distracts me. The calendar widget so convenient and nice, everything is visible, the key word is EVERYTHING. Every task I'm adding becomes visible on this widget, and I'd like to see only those I'm working on or planned, not all from every list. So I can be more focused. Hope you work this out, thanks for hearing me ☺️ Have a wonderful day!
replyContent: This is a great idea! We've forwarded it to our product team for consideration. And if we see more support for a similar feature from other users we'll definitely look into adding it. :)

content: Pretty good app but nothing crazy that I can't achieve with Google calendars already if there is I'm not in need for the feature atm. I've really been looking for the feature to set a reoccurring remind with a full custom option for say repeat every 43 days or repeat 3 months, then 4 months then 3 then 4 etc this sorts of features would be amazingly handy as you would then not have to set up a new reminder for each date after having worked them out manually. If you add this feature please LMK
replyContent:
Thank you for your feedback. We truly value our users input, and our Product team is always adding user suggestions to our roadmap. The suggestion you posted has already added to our UserVoice forum, and you are welcome to vote for it here: https://bit.ly/2mol4oZ
The more votes a suggestion gets, the more likely it is to be added in the future!

content: Been using this app to replace Gtasks and after a couple if days so far it is pretty good. Only given three stars as I have a Ticwatch Pro wear OS watch and the app does not let me complete or snooze a task from the watch. I get notification and a list of options to snooze 15mins, 60mins, tommorrw or mark Done. What ever I select nothing happens and the notification remains on watch. The reminder also appears on phone and the functions work fine if selected from phone.
replyContent: We are so sorry for this issue! Please submit a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report) with the relevant details, so we can get to the bottom of this for you!

content: Had to leave the beta when I saw the nice large bold text input (when you hit the + button) go away. I love the current nice large text design on the input. Hopefully it doesn't go away or at least remains an option. Turning off auto updates for a while on this app just in case you decide to make this poor life decision final.
replyContent: Please note you can control the font size from your device settings :)

content: It would be helpful if subtasks have the same functions as tasks. My job right now has a lot of long-term and complicated projects so I needed to have subtasks under one task and the like. That's where I felt a bit lacking which made me transfer to a different app sadly 🙁. Any.Do will always be my first love and I was quite reluctant to change but my job is getting more taxing lately 😌. If Any.Do has functional controls over subtasks, it is likely I resume using it.
replyContent: We're already working on it and a feature is currently in Beta :) We hope to have it out for all users as soon as possible and recommend staying tuned for updates on our social media!

content: The new update just made things much worse and confusing. I use this app constantly. The new system put in place of "my day" is just useless for me as I had my tasks for the day in tasks. My grocery list also changed for some reason (before everything was compartmentalised in sections automatically). Also, you have added lots of "integration feature" "2000 apps" but Google home is not there? Why is alexa assistant there and not Google??? Very upsetting. At least that would have been useful.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. The grocery list categories should be working. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly!

content: Please add a search icon to find a recurring task. Maybe even the ability to add as a recurring event
replyContent: You can use the search option any time please see: https://support.any.do/en/articles/8636889-the-universal-search

content: When entering grocery itema, I like that it auto populates items that you can tap on while you're typing but after you tap on an item, it should delete what you started typing in the test field. Even better, if you could simply hit enter to add the most relavent item on the left, that would be awesome. Much like it works on spotlight with iOS or mac os.
replyContent: Thank you for the suggestion. You can also post your idea on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it!

content: Just one thing and I will definitely change to 5 stars. Make the 'Quick add bar' easier to use! Just expand the letter 'ADD A TASK' in the notification bar. Or at least make it easier to reach when using one hand. I'm right handed but the 'add a task' is located on the bottom left of the bar so it's hard to reach with a thumb. Please, I believe it's not too much to ask for.
replyContent: Thank you for your suggestion! We've forwarded it to our product team for consideration. And if we see more support for a similar feature from other users we'll definitely look into adding it. :)

content: I like the application and the ui and love the way it displays notifications. But it's missing native integrations with Google suite, the sync with Google calendar is laggy for desktop and Android app, there could be plenty of features like detection of time and date on desktop app and more focus on work days like daily schedules of tasks with time periods and focus mode on desktop. I hope you improve it and I am willing to pay for it then, now I will use the free version for personal purposes.
replyContent: We appreciate your feedback, we have a gmail add on from GSuite Marketplace: support.any.do/any-do-gmail. The desktop apps have the smart type feature if it is not working, please submit a bug report and out team will be happy to look into this for you :) If our Dev team see high demand for Focus mode- desktop they will consider implementing it.

content: The tasks completed are no longer shown on the date itself, which made us hard to trace back what were the activities done on that particular day Add on review: thanks for the reply. But when I check on my calendar, completed tasks are no longer shown. I'm not sure we are on the same page. Yes They are still on the task list but no longer in calendar
replyContent: If you do not remove the Completed Tasks from your active lists, they will continue to show in the Calendar View :) Once moved to the Completed Tasks folder, these tasks are cleared from all views. The tasks will only appear on the original dates you added them to. If you cannot see them please reach out to the team at www.any.do/contact_form.

content: Change in the calendar feature really made the experience worst :( It became more difficult to identify days with appointments because you have to click on each day and roll all the way down to see through the hours. Can you, please, fix this or return to the previous version? I really enjoy this app and I don't want to change to another one.
replyContent: Please note that we have not made any changes to the calendar. However, you may simply select you preferred view, to see your entire agenda, under the calendars menu, from the top left corner of the Calendar View (https://support.any.do/calendar-view/). For further assistance, please contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: Great app! But have a few suggestions that would make it the best app in the market! Trust me people are looking for this! 1) The ability to add your schedule with a few clicks. For example you can set reoccuring events, but peoples schedules alternate. Would be great to be able to click the days you work group then at the same time and categorize them under work. (For reference look at the nursegrid app) 2) add your spouse or family directly. So everything is synced real time.(familywall)
replyContent: We have forwarded your idea to the product team Thank you for your feedback. We truly value our users input, and our Product team is always adding user suggestions to our roadmap. Regarding the real time sync with your family, I would recommend trying out shared lists, you can find more about it here: https://support.any.do/sharing-lists-and-tasks/

content: Overall not a bad app. For the first week or so, it gave me notifications when it was supposed to, but after that, it's almost like it forgot sometimes itself, e.g. notification on Saturday when I set it for Friday. Reminders for things I have set daily don't even come up anymore, but it remembers to give me an display-over-app notification to remind me to set a reminder. Also, no push notifications that take you into the app so you'd have to do it yourself. Sub-tasks are my favourite feature!
replyContent: We are unaware of any issues with the Reminders, so that's odd. Please make sure to follow this troubleshooting article on our Help Center at- https://bit.ly/3cw9BZx. If you're still experiencing any issue, please submit a bug report via your app Settings - Support, and our team will be happy to look into it for you.

content: The app works great. If you don't use the reoccurring task option. When you create a task, that reoccurs daily and you didn't do the task today, the next instance of the task is added on the next day to your today list. The problem is, the app doesn't always remove the predecessor instance of the task what results in a buggy mess. Is there no system in place to remove all older instances of a reoccurring task, when it gets added to the today list?
replyContent: The way Recurring Reminders work is that when you complete the current recurrence, the next one pops up. Without completing the current item, the next recurrence won't come up. If the previous recurrence has been completed, you can clear it from your view by tapping "Clear Completed". For further questions, contact us at- www.any.do/contact_form

content: I was using this app when it started initially .Its a good app, but then I left because it started charging. I again have to use it as I found it good for time management but it has increased its price .As price in USD for countries like Pakistan its too much. I think for developing countries charges should be as Apple charges . They charge according to the country. This is good.
replyContent: A payment can only be made upon the user's authorization. We also use Google Play as a payment provider and the pricing is localized per country. Did you try to upgrade from your mobile app? Please reach out to our team for further assistance any.do/contact_form.

content: The previous version was much better. In the new version, in plan my day all the task are mixed up. Such as the tasks scheduled for next week or next month. All are mixed up. In the old version only daily task used to be highlighted in plan my day.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! In order to better understand and advise you accordingly, please pinpoint the issues you are having and send it to us via www.any.do/contact_form. We will be happy to assist you :)

content: We are missing a chat feature AND notification when a task is changed / completed / modified in shared lists. Any.do is pretty good for my personal use but even though we are both premium, we don't see any possibility of interaction with the - kind of interaction Wunderlist provides not just tiny notification WITHIN the app.

Repeated tasks scheduling is limited. Needs after certain number of days/weeks/months/etc, and a specific week day in a month. (EI: second Monday of the month. Etc). But other then that its a very good and easy on the eye, intuitive app but needs improvement
replyContent: Those options are part of our Premium offering. You can learn more about our Premium features at Any.do/Premium. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out at Customers@any.do and we will gladly assist you :)

content: This app was a life saver for me. But its not working properly with my new OnePlus 7. It doesn't gives reminders which I set for whatever time. I get it once in a while, but most of the time no reminder. Please provide a solution for this asap. Thanks. Edit (7/7): It started working now. All I did was, in the battery settings, selected Any Do app, n selected the option Dont Optimize in it.
replyContent: We are so happy your app is back up and running smoothly now! 😉

content: Love this app however I bought premium and since the app has been constantly crashing on me I still try and use it on a day to day basis as I have hundreds of tasks I've transferred in it and I love the app when it works but when it crashes daily it gets annoying and I hope they fix it soon. I have contacted support regarding this and have yet to receive support to fix this. I am still using the app daily as I do still like it but does get annoying when functions don't work.
replyContent: We are unaware of any issues with the app not closing correctly, so that's odd. Please send us a bug report via your app's Settings - Support, and we will be sure to get to the bottom of this for you.

content: I used to be a big fan of any.do products and I used any.do, any.cal for years, I think these apps are really easy to use. However, when I set a reminder for an appointment every Monday, it only allows me to set reminders on every Thursday( the date that I created that reminder) instead of Monday. it's really disappointing.
replyContent: Heya, did you try changing the start date? If you did and it's still not working, please submit a bug via Settings - Support so our team can look into it for you!

content: Couldn't Find an option for what I was looking for: widget with events from calendar of several days ahead.. It has the option to add new events (and tasks!) right from the widget and the rest of cool functionalities but not the key one I was looking for... Edit: thank you for the answer but I think that will just work for the tasks and not the events correct? I don't need the whole month view (I can deal with the space taking on my screen for the advantage) but I do need the agenda
replyContent: Please note that the Calendar widget shows you your upcoming events for as many days ahead as you please. The whole month view is a part of the design and functionality. For further information contact us directly at https://www.any.do/contact_form and we will be happy to help :)

content: useful for lists, but too many newer features you can't disable cluttering the app, making it inconvenient to use. I have used the app for years, before premium was a thing, taking break over the last year. this issue had only started occurring after updates that had happened more recently, adding new features, but cluttering the ui.
replyContent: Our approach to task and project management is simplistic and our exclusive features help users remain focused and productive :) We recommend learning more about the app and all features here- https://support.any.do.
