content: Is it possible to change the time the "I'll remind you again in so many minutes" is displayed after pressing snooze...it's constantly blocking other functions on my phone and there's no way of swiping it aside, or getting rid of it...I'm usually doing something on my phone when a reminder pops up...I'm pressing snooze because I'm busy ..but I'm still delayed by the reminder now blocking the screen with this acknowledgement of what you've asked it to do...it's frustrating and unnecessary!
replyContent: You can set your preferred notification setting from settings-> apps-> notifications. If you are experiencing issues please contact us directly by submitting a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you :)

content: Please make the widgets more customizable and make us able to change the background transparency. Edit: Looks like you didn't understand. I'm talking about the background transparency of the widgets. Again, if you didn't understand - I'm talking about the ability to change the background transparency, the blackish background which makes the contrast higher and isn't necessary on wallpapers which aren't too bright.
replyContent: We have many widgets including resizeable ones :)

content: Edited: Had a premium account and really liked the app but it got buggy and basically stopped working in the ways I needed on my samsung s10+. Support was unable to help so I requested a refund, which they quickly granted, and I've moved to a different app. Three stars for the app being good until it stopped working for me, for quick service, and for the easy breakup.
replyContent: Sorry to hear you are experiencing issues! We are not aware of a problem with recurring tasks however, our team will be happy to look into it should you report a bug via Settings - Support 🙂

content: Not truly a usable free version due to consant nag svreens. I will be uninstalling this and moving to a different app eg todo or todoist which is are as good or better and do not nag. This is quite a good To Do app but it too often comes up with prompts to upgrade to the premium so it really discourages free users subscription-based version and now is trying to expand tothe workplace project space with even more nag screens.
replyContent: Any.do is a free app. We provide 95% of our features at no cost, including all core features. We never require our users to upgrade. We modeled all our pricing tiers off of similar services so we could stay competitive. We also occasionally offer promotions, you can inquire about them at premium@any.do!

content: Recurring tasks an essential feature is available only in premium. Premium is not available for one time purchase. monthly payment is way too much for an Indian. it got to be affordable with one time payment for everyone to use. may be some one time payment option for different features like recurrent tasks, location reminder and paid themes would have been made it accessible for many.
replyContent: Our standard recurring reminders are available to all of our users, you can learn more about here - https://bit.ly/2GAP1JW. To learn more about our special Premium offers, please reach out to us at Customers@any.do :)

content: Good app, small inconvenience. When finishing typing I use the back swipe gesture to close the keyboard, but that doesn't happen. Instead going back while typing closes the current view. Also if you don't manually close the keyboard after finishing typing the keyboard stays up until you type again and close it or leave the app (the keyboard even stays up if you check the recent apps apps).
replyContent: Hi, we are not 100% sure we understand what you are referring you. We would be happy to assist you should you send us a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report.

content: I mainly wanted to use this app's grocery list with my Google Home. It's not syncing up with my Home even though I changed my defaults to Any.do in my Google Home settings. I really like that the list populates by department, but if it won't connect to my Google home, I'll have to try with a different list app.
replyContent: You are welcome to learn how to connect and work with our Google Assistant integration, on our Help Center here- support.any.do/anydo-google-assistant. Should you need any further assistance, please feel free to reach out to us at - www.any.do/contact_form, and our Support Team will be happy to help! :)

content: A minimalistic task management and scheduling app with an beautiful interface and great widgets as well and packs a punch in terms of free features. Any.do does not allow sublists and allows only one level of subtasks to ensure simplicity, but compromising power. I have also found it quite cumbersome to add a task, put it into the right list and add a label to it. This is a long drawn out process which takes so much time and completely ruins the rest of the simplicity the app has.
replyContent: Hi Sujay, thanks for the feedback! Any.do supports a minimalist design which leaves things at surface level. This is why we do not plan on adding more layers for the time being. As for adding tasks, you may add them directly to a specific list from the All view or the Grid View :) For instructions, reach out to customers@any.do.

content: It's a great app but please remove the Workspace advertisement from the top of the tasks page. It is enough that you tell users about it but some of us use this app as a solo user not in a collaborative or work setting. Don't clutter up the tasks page. Allow deletion of grocery item entries. The "smart grouping" in grocery lists is also not very smart.
replyContent: Did you get the ad more than once? f you are seeing it more than this, please submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support so we can look into this for you.

content: Nuisance app. It probably works fine, but it's definitely not for me. However, when I decided to uninstall it, it gave me no easy way to delete my account. To delete my account I need to enter a password. I never set a password because I signed up with Google. So I have to login to create a password just to enter password to delete the account. I haven't figured out how to revoke the permissions I gave. This is abusive. Deleting an account and data should be straightforward.
replyContent: Please note that in order to delete a profile that has been connected with an external ID, you will need to first create a password for the account. After creating your password, you may delete your account under the profile page in the mobile app or via our Web app. For further assistance, please feel free to contact us- www.any.do/contact_form.

content: I have been using this app ever since I switched to an Android phone 5-6 years ago, and I have liked it for the most part. However, the recent addition of the "focus" button in the pop-up reminder bar is annoying. Focus is only available in the premium version and there's no way to turn it off. Time to shop for a new to-do list app.
replyContent: Please note all of the app's features are inherent to the design, therefore we are not planning on removing any of these features, premium or not. Furthermore you are not obligated to use this feature. We are sorry to see you go, but we hope you can find an app that better suites your needs!

content: Not sure why but sometimes when I make an edit on one of the items on the list, next time I open the app the changes are not saved. Happened couple times already and I'm sure I clicked the check mark to save the item before leaving the app. A bit annoying
replyContent: This is strange behavior. You may be experiencing syncing issues. Please submit a bug report through your app by going to Settings - Support so we can check this for you.

content: I really like must of the app but it has 2 horrible bugs that made me uninstall it. I might download it again if that is fixed.
replyContent: We are not aware of any issues with adding events through the widget. Please email customers@any.do with your account and device details so we can get to the bottom of this for you!

content: The widget is nice. But if you have a Samsung phone, the task and events sync with other services makes a comparable experience with no subscription fee or zapier headache. And the Evernote integration which is what intitally peaked my interest ... Doesn't support Evernote tasks.. It only creates a task in anydo if a page is created in Evernote per zapier.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! We would be happy to hear your suggestions on how to improve the Zapier integration through Evernote. In order to better understand and advise you accordingly, please reach out to us via www.any.do/contact_form.

content: I've been using this app for years. But recently, the reminders that I set keep turning off. If a reminder dings me and I snooze it once or twice, it turns off altogether.
replyContent: We will be happy to look into this, should you contact us at any.do/contact_form or via Settings → Support.

content: Bad I tried to set a reminder and it only allowed recurring reminders in 4 time increments and at the same time of day that I'm currently setting it, with some wiggle room - couldn't change it from PM to AM. No wonder I never use it. I need to set reminders at night for all the stuff I forgot to do during the day!
replyContent: We would be happy to help you resolve all of the issues you have encountered should you send us a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report).

content: The latest app update (7/26/20), "new app navigation..." is a definite downgrade, from panes to a one side scroll, now I can no longer see full task list names, the "all tasks" option is changed, the new layout sucks. Why do developers always do this, "fix" things that aren't broken? Why can't you just improve the things people are requesting, instead of changing everything else around too? This ver is much harder/inconvenient to navigate than the previous one was. Trying to revert to older.
replyContent: This sounds odd! While the new navigation offers new shortcuts and an improved design, it has not changed the basic filtering and view options which have remained exactly the same as before. We will be happy to assist with any question, should you contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form.

content: Love the app, but it's almost useless on my Galaxy View because the app switches back to portrait mode when adding a task, for a tablet that sits stationary in landscape mode, it just doesn't work. love the app on my phone and the website is nice too.

content: An amazing app! Making my life definitely easier. Just one thing: It is apparently impossible to mute the reminders completely - despite the "silent" option in Android's Apps' setting section. They still make the phone vibrate, which I don't like.
replyContent: You can disable reminders altogether from your notification settings :)

content: No experience with it. install / "Open" goes to a login screen. No thanks. I do not want to login to use this. I'd appreciate it if developers would say upfront that their app is not a standalone, local, private version. Too bad, could have been just what I need, otherwise. Sure looks good. To dev: thanks for the response. I rechecked. Neither the images nor writeup specifies an account is MANDATORY. "can" is different than "must". Updated with Extra star for prompt service. Thx.
replyContent: Heya! We ask users to register for an account so that we can save their data on our servers, allowing for cross-platform sync and ensuring no information is ever lost :) The cross platform sync is mentioned in the app's marketing images on Google Play.

content: Awesome app but hate the new placement of the buttons. When you use to create a task you clicked under the title to select when you wanted a reminder. Now it's halfway down the page. I keep hitting "share task" and it takes forever to back out of that screen.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! Please note that we have done this to make the app more consistent across all platforms, however we will be sure to review your feedback!

content: Hi team, I liked your app free version. I want to try full version for sometime, for effective usage. But there is no free trail or monthly subscription. It is asking for yearly subscription for which I don't take a chance. I hope you understood and provide solution for this. TIA.
replyContent: We have a 7 day trial , if you are not able to see it our team would be happy to send you a direct link you upgrade, should you contact us at www.any.do/contact_form.

content: Honestly, this app is not user friendly, is not intuitive. When I try to schedule a repeating task, it's confusing. After selecting a task to be repeated, I am asked how many days?! What the heck does that mean?! How the heck can I SIMPLY set a task to be repeated every day? Developers, where's the user guide?
replyContent: Any.do supports advanced recurring reminders. This means that you can choose how many days will be set in between each occurrence. You could have a task go off every 2 days, 5 days, or 20 days. If you want a task to repeat every day, just set the number to "1 days" and you'll be set! :)

content: It's okay, but very focused on tasks, when sometimes I just want a list. The integration with Alexa and list sharing are the best features, but sync can be flaky at times. Also there doesn't seem to be a way to dismiss all those notifications!
replyContent: You can use the Someday section to have tasks in a list with no due date. The integration with Alexa is currently down and we war working with the amazon team to resolve it. If you have any feedback you would like to share please write us here :) https://www.any.do/contact_form.

content: The is good and is really helpful when i plan my day. replyContent: This is very odd! We highly recommend you submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: It seems like it could be good but very disappointed that it's subscription based and that there's not a one time purchase option. Not sure if pro has this option but it also doesnt seem to have a history of completed tasks. Will need to keep looking.

content: App looks great. UI is wonderful and the feature it have , they all are useful. Only problem because of which I uninstalled the app was simple and basic features like recurring task creations are made premium. Switching to tick tick for the same reason.

content: this used to be my favorite app for planning my day and I would get a lot more done with the "start your day" feature, but since the update a few months ago making it "more intuitive" made it less intuitive for me, and after months I still haven't been able to get it to work the way I'd like it to. to sort out my pending tasks for the day.

content: It used to be awesome, 5 star.. now it's iphone like design, make it difficult to navigate, can't move tasks between folders. There are better todo list apps. Missing lots of customizations. Not like there are bugs.. its just very iphone like(boring).

I don't like a widget with the monthly calendar plus events plus task. That monthly calendar is too big and unnecessary. When they change it I'll give the 5

content: I used this app some time ago, at which point it was not overcomplicated. Now it is, however still less overcomplicated than its competitors. The day planning concept is nice, at least for people who don't have a dozen of apps that are most important each (Slack, work Google Calendar and Jira, namely). It doesn't do dirty tricks like notifications as reminders, and convincing you to override DND. Some interface design choices are confusing, still. Adding calendar doubles the cal notifications.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! You can actually import your Jira items to My Day, and integrate with Slack in our Workspace plan, to avoid managing several apps at once :) To learn more about our imports and integrations, see: https://bit.ly/3S3Pho7

content: It used to be awesome but I've been having way too many bugs that have almost made it useless. Tasks will disappear after having just added them. The grocery is no longer sorting by department (Pantry, Dairy, Meat) and is throwing everything into other. replyContent: Tap the arrow in Quick Bar to save tasks & tap on subtasks to edit them. Completed subtask will remain unless you press on the cross to delete them. We are aware of the issue with the Smart Grocery list. To fix it, try logging out and back in, that should help! If you have any further issues please contact us via Settings → Support! 😊

content: Response to dev: I'm removing the complaint about recurring events, they do have them its just kind of weird to set up at first. replyContent: Regarding to the price - we recommend checking out our Pricing Page for more details https://www.any.do/pricing. As for the Zapier integration - it offers up to 5 Zaps completely for free for our Premium users. You can read more about it here - https://support.any.do/zapier.

content: This app is simple yet functional. I love everything about it and I definitely recommend it. content: When you have a list open and hit the android back button the app closes. It would be much more intuitive if instead it goes back to the view with all lists. Also the notifications for repeated tasks don't work properly. I just get the first notification but not the repeated ones for the following weeks.
replyContent: The way recurring reminders work is that when you complete the current recurrence, the next one pops up. If you are not viewing the app in date view, it will look like the same task has popped up again, but it is really the next occurrence of the task. Only when completing the current occurrence, will you be able to see the next one.
