content: I use the app almost only through Calendar Widget. There are two bugs. 1) Today is not marked now. In old previous versions, he was marked. 2) When you tap on a another day and tap "New event", the app set today as the day of the task. And you need to close the task creator... tap on today... then tap on the required day... and then "New event". Now the day of the task is correct. Please fix. The rest of the app is great.
replyContent: We will be happy to assist, should you contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form. Or send us a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you :)

content: The basic app is all I need but I find the automatic upshift of tasks from upcoming and sometime to tomorrow and then today is unrealistic and annoying. Great at moving tasks from tomorrow to today but please leave upcoming and sometime tasks where I put them until I want to move them up myself.
replyContent: The upcoming tasks have a due date and will move to the correct time category. That said someday tasks do not have a due date and will stay under the someday category until you move them.

content: It's beautiful But premium features in this app are basic free features on other apps lmao. Paid color tags!?
replyContent: The Color Tags are a part of the Premium features. However, standard users have the option to use the yellow priority tag, or prioritize the tasks by categorizing them into different lists. We also occasionally offer promotions, you can inquire about them at www.any.do/contact_form

content: I'd give it more stars, but it seems to lack the same functionality on my tablet that it has in Mobile. Why can't I have grid view and the ability to add lists on my tablet??
replyContent: You should have the grid view in the tablet app. We will be more than happy to look into this for you and sort this out, should you send us a bug report. Please submit a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report) with the relevant details, so we can get to the bottom of this for you!

content: Its nice，but its hard to get used to the multilingual keyboard。
replyContent: Any.do does not have an independent keyboard. The keyboard that is set on your device will show in Any.do :)

content: Switched to another app since they are not supporting Alexa integration anymore...which was a killer feature. They didn't even Tr to get it running again. And I don't want to invest in premium just to make it happen via Zapier? Really bad decision any.do
replyContent: Due to ongoing issues with Amazon, Any.do no longer offers a direct integration with Alexa. We do want to have it for future versions is it becomes possible.

content: good👌
replyContent: We work hard to make Any.do the best that it can be! How do you think we can make this a 5 stars review? We'll be happy to receive any feedback!

content: I like this app. I use it a lot. Edit again: the issue I mentioned months ago is still broken. I sent reports to the company, vid, pictures. They got back to me, but they haven't fixed the issue. They broke things with updates. When entering my sub list, my phone switched to landscape mode for a second. When turned back to portrait, my list was gone. Please fix this!
replyContent: Please submit a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report) with the relevant details, so we can get to the bottom of this for you!

content: I don't like the fact that drag and drop of tasks is not good. It works only in a specific manner. That is It does not indicate when you can drop the task after dragging. There is no visual clue. Wow! On snooze the task gets rearranged in calendar view. The only feature I never seen in any other apps. Never miss a call back that was important. The best part I like the most is the in app notification from where you can select task and postpone as usual.
replyContent: Sorry about that. We are not aware of any issues with the drag and drop functionality. Kindly contact us at- https://www.any.do/contact_form, with any relevant information (as explained here- https://support.any.do/sending-files-to-support/), and we will be happy to look into it for you.

content: It's good, the best I've found. I'd like to see new calendar entry as an app shortcut, and I'd really like to see a greater focus on location based reminders as this is one of the few apps that works with them reliably, but it still takes too many taps to set one up and time based is clearly the preference of the app developers.
replyContent: Thank you for updating your review! :)

content: I have to give this a 3.5 but I gave four stars since it's not an option (I'm trying to be fair). Overall pretty decent to-do app. I've been having a recurring problem on my pixel 2XL with the screen becoming laggy and turning black for a few seconds when the daily task list pops up. That's not a deal breaker, however the reason I can't get this any higher is the lack of Google Assistant integration. It's been in "Coming Soon" status for months. I have given up and gone to just Google To Do.
replyContent: Hey Gary, we are sorry you feel this way! If you have any technical issues with Any.do, please submit a bug from Settings > Support. The Google Assistant integration should be released very soon, and we understand your frustration and apologize for the long wait.

content: Clean, simple interface. Generally fast and easy to add things as I think of them. However.....I wish the app didn't think it was so smart. I find the auto-spelling annoying. Putting in 8-10 ft. electric cord under lists was automatically interpreted as August 10th. And the assumptions about categories for shopping lists is annoying. 5 different things to get a hardware store end up in 4 different categories. Changing the categories for shopping lists is not easy to manage (and why do they show up under Tasks at all?)
replyContent: Sorry about that! Please note that you can disable the Smart Type reminder, by clicking on the highlighted time that shows in blue. As per the categories, when each item is added, it is filed under a relevant category, or a new one is generated accordingly. At this time, please note that categories can not be added manually or edited.

content: It's a pretty good app, but there are a few issues. It doesn't sort tasks that occur on the same day by which task has it's reminder set for earlier in the day. Instead when I select sort by time, it orders tasks that occur the same day in a seemingly random order. For example, a 12PM task will be at the top but a 10AM task is at the bottom. Additionally, if there is a way to delete color tags, I have not found it. At some point a couple of my tags duplicated and now I can't delete the extras.
replyContent: You can delete the tags from the desktop or web version, we will add this option back for the Android app in the next versions. Once you sort by time it will have your tasks in the order of the time and date, once you manually change the order or add a new task this will override the sorting.

content: It suddenly quit syncing. I've tried logging off and back on again with no luck. When I try to do it manually it just already says that it was synced "just now"...even though none of the things I have added show up. Never had this problem before. If I can't get it resolved I will remove app and find something different. Very frustrating. Update: I did a FORCE STOP on the app, and it seems to be back to normal. It works for what I need (shopping list) but isn't the easiest for rearranging the list, and the advertisement at the bottom of the list is very annoying and makes rearranging the list even more difficult.
replyContent: Please note that you can move items between categories on the Smart Grocery List by tapping the item you want to change the category of, and choosing your desired category. The pop up at the bottom simply suggest adding identifiable grocery items to your list, and is not an ad. To learn more, visit our Help Center at- support.any.do/grocery-list.

content: I've used this app to manage personal and work tasks for over four years with no trouble. Over the last few weeks, I've noticed that tasks which I've modified (by adding or removing words) are randomly defaulting to what was there previously. This morning I saw a task blink away and return as the previous version of the task (missing the words I'd added). I rely on my tasks being accurate and have never had this happen until recently. Any hope of a fix?
replyContent: Sorry about that. We are unaware of any issues with the tasks not being saved correctly, so that's odd. Please send us a bug report via your app Settings - Support, with more relevant info, and we will be happy to get to the bottom of this for you.

content: A great app for keeping things straight! This is the only app I've ever paid for the premium, and it's worth it. It's great even without premium, but it makes remembering daily repetitive tasks much easier. I have trouble remembering things like that, or knowing if I've already done it. Only thing keeping me from putting 5 stars is that completed tasks have to be manually deleted after theyre marked complete, and reminders will randomly stop showing up. Maybe the update will fix the second one!

The app looks great visually, and I really think the devs put a lot of time into it. But I'm not sure how it offers any real benefit over Google Calendar, considering the features are largely the same. Plus, this app still isn't available for the Samsung Galaxy Watch3. Truthfully, I would still be willing to pay $2.99 a month just to support the devs (the app really does look great), but there's no option to pay monthly, just one yearly price. If there was a monthly option, I'd likely subscribe.
replyContent: Please note that there is a monthly subscription option as well, which can be found under settings- Go Premium. For any questions or assistance, please contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form we will be happy to look into it for you :)

content: Super useful task list and calendar tool, with plenty of integrations. I wish the calendar had more alarm options and that the location entry actually used Google Maps (or other map service). I like using Any Do for my calendar instead of my Google calendar app, since my tasks integrate nicely into my calendar, but having to go into the Google calendar to add more alarms and specific location after creating a new appointment in the any do calendar is time consuming and frustrating.

Long time user of this app, problem is it doesn't have a search feature. Or if it does I can't find it. Sometimes I forget where I filed my note or task (again longtime user) and then it takes me a while to go through all my files to figure out which title heading I put it under, but if it had a search feature I could quickly find it and get back to being productive. For this reason I gave it 4 stars because it has room for improvement.

I have used Any.do for quite a while, especially for shopping lists on my phone. After a recent update, I cannot find a way to add to any list I have. That was my original review after an update. The help center was great and after only 2 emails and a screenshot, I was able to add to my lists again. The update made the feature to add items to my lists have a different look but it all works well now that I know the new look.
replyContent: Thanks for updating your review! We really appreciate it! 😊

content: Confused. I'm not sure what happened and I'm glad I didn't have a long grocery list because I just had to transfer everything from my "Grocery List" to a new one so it would open like a normal list and not as a pop up. I don't understand why y'all thought that was a good idea but whatever. I've clicked everything I can think to click. "Convert to regular list" isn't an option that I've seen anywhere. Is that only in premium?
replyContent: You can convert your Smart Grocery Lists into regular lists by opening their list options and selecting "Convert to regular list." :)

content: I've had this planner app for years. It just recently started bouncing back an entire year when I put new appts in. For example...I just put an appt in for May 11, 2024. After I saved it, the calendar jumped all the way back to May of 2023, and I had to manually scroll back to 2024. I know... first world problems, lol. But it would be nice if this could be corrected.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly!

content: Would give 5 stars if it wasn't buggy and didn't cause me to miss a task. The calendar widget is a complete failure. It randomly removes some of the calendars that are synced and creates a duplicate of repeated tasks when they are marked as complete. The whole reason I subscribed to this app was because I needed to sync all my calendars and make my life easier by maintaining them all in one place and not miss any appointments or tasks. The app is useless if I can't rely on it to display and sync correctly. Fix the bugs and I'll reinstall and change to 5 stars.
replyContent: We're sorry for this! We're not aware of any issues with the calendar but would be happy to look into this for you :)  Please submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can diagnose and solve this issue ASAP.

content: This app has been my sidekick ever since it was released around 8 years ago!! The grocery list feature they recently developed really makes shopping a breeze. My only complaint, and the reason for only 4/5 stars, is that the long-press always vibrates when reorganizing tasks, even when my ringer is off. Really annoying when youre in a super quiet place, not just for me but for others as well. Otherwise, absolutely my favorite app on my phone!
replyContent: We already have a UserVoice for this and are happy to work on it if it gets enough votes! Feel free to vote by clicking here: https://bit.ly/2LHgWdY

content: Honestly, needs a lot more features for me to be worth paying premium for (I tried out the free trial). The deal breaker for me was the fact that I can't set custom alerts for calender events.. maximum I can do is 2 days before event.. why can't I customize it (i.e 2 weeks or 10 days)? Then they need other things like automatic dark theme switching. Other than that, it's a nice productivity app. Love that it combines tasks and events into the calendar
replyContent: Any.do is a free app. We provide 90% of our features at no cost, including all core features. Please note that event notifications can be set up to a week prior to the event. Additionally, the dark theme is available for Premium users at this time, however, we are working on adding it to the standard version in the near future.

content: The app looks great but it's limited. You cannot add notes for specific days. You cannot add a calander unless you connect it to your email calander and the stake white color scheme can't be changed unless you buy premium. Which is about 18$ a year. I would love to see a daily note option with text editing allowed and the ability to add a calander without having to sync it with your Google calendar.
replyContent: Please note that Any.do offers a Calendar Integration, but not its own calendar at this time. You can add Notes and files to any task, and assign it with a reminder to be notified on a specific day (support.any.do/notes-files). Kindly note that we've recently added the Dark Theme, to be available for all users for free.

content: Overall good and useful. I'll likely continue to use, and.. .. . ..I would like more control of reminder sounds including repeating (so i don't miss it) and sounds without needing to open app. (maybe there are settings i can adjust). also more integration with other apps including Trello and Evernote and more a general multi app share feature would be great. As is i am copying and reentering things in multiple apps, and i want to just send them.

I like the ease of creating different to do lists, ability to create subtasks, and that i can make my grocery shopping list according to what store I shop at. It's great that the grocery list are automatically sorted by aisle for you. However, i noticed that if i add a price to the beginning or end of the grocery item, that it gets put in the 'other' aisle category. I also like how you can switch something in one list to a different one just by tapping on it. Nice work 👍
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback Lisa! We're glad you're enjoying the app and we will definitely look into allowing adding prices and quantities to Grocery Items without losing their categorization :)

content: better one of the hundreds of apps I've tried in this category I would definitely say top 10!! it's definitely a different look and approach to the "to do" or "List" apps that are usually out there! you could say it's more of a simple or easier way of looking at everything that you need to accomplish as it uses the today tomorrow and some day layout but it can also be useful for details as it has the options for subtasks if you so choose! keeping it for a while for sure over a bunch of others
replyContent: Thank you for your review, we are glad to hear you like the minimalist approach and our layout!

content: I LOVE this app. It was the one I narrowed down to after having downloaded several to-do apps. HOWEVER, I wish it had just a plain note taking feature for day to day things to remember, without it being attached to a to-do item. I also wish the interface was slightly easier to manage, there are a couple fixes that would increase the apps ability to be intuitive for the user. (An easier way to undo checking off a list item, being able to view the agendas differently ie calendar and tasks)
replyContent: Any.do is a minimalist task manager, which reflects in our design and functionality. However, We'd love to get your detailed feedback by writing to us at - https://www.any.do/contact_form. We're constantly trying to provide the best possible app for our users, and feedback like yours help us do so.

content: almost perfect. I do wish we could sort by list AND time instead of either-or. and it's not quite to the point that wunderlist was. but the voice control is incredibly handy, and it's decent at both shopping & to-do lists (although grocery lists feel a bit weird/limited compared to to-do lists). and the paid version is not necessary for most basic functions, although I personally upgraded because I felt it was worth it.

App is very simple which is what I wanted. Can sync to Google now. Can put as widget on home screen. Tasks are same color but seperated by date and will say "this week" etc. with list below. Wish I could put a date ending; for example I put a reminder "spring break 3/1 to 3/5" but can only put a start date and anything else has to go on note. Notification only show on task bar and never chime for the time selected. I keep using bc simplicity tho to have view of what all I have to do for month.

This is my favorite to-do type of app, it's gorgeous on an oled display, but I really wish there were a better way to set up repeatable checklists. To start a good habit I find the reminder to do it everyday very helpfyl, but even better is tracking how many times I actually did after a week and when. This app allows repeat events with notifications but doesn't track time completed or show completed or incomplete events on Cal or Google calendar so making schedule adjustments is a chore.
replyContent: Thank you for the suggestion. You can also post your idea on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it!😃

content: I wanted to b a more organized person so this app was editors choice, and I subscribed to Any-do for the year. I'm just not sure what the difference is between this app and a glorified notebook. I mean I'm still getting to understand, ex: Any-do moments I have no idea whats going on there (any advice). Also it claims to sync to all Google apps but I've seen things I put on NOTE that have yet to sync. Any way maybe I'm wrong and will keep practicing, overall it's a good organizer

Coordinates Humans 🙌🏾 This app was my go-to until covid hit. Keeping my personal, consulting business, and day work calendars in one app was madness. I broke off my day work to microsoft .to do on a separate device. Any.do now coordinates my consulting and my personal and family tasks, lists, and bills. Its refreshing. I do have syncing issues for calendar events as well as a crash everytime I add people to invites when creating an event. Thats why I gave it 4-stars. Love it for tasks.
replyContent: We are unaware of any issues with editing the calendar, or adding invitees to events, so that sounds odd. Please send us a bug report via your app Settings - Support, we will be happy to get to the bottom of this for you.

content: Honestly, awesome app... or at least used to be. Lately, it is extremely laggy, which is honestly a pain in the ass when trying to check which tasks u have to do. Also, it seems like there is a new feature where every time you back out of a task, it asks you if you want to save or discard; previously, it just auto-saved, which was very neat. On top of that, whenever I try to add a tag to my task, it doesn't save. It either takes me multiple tries to save the tag, or it just never saves. Plz fix.

Very helpful. I bought premium its not a subscription which I love. Problems: 1. The widget lists everything you need to do today and in the futuren in a long list with no divide. I see that and panic. 2. Being able to select multiple lists to display but not all. I don't need my shopping list showing on the widget 24/7. But I would like my appointments and daily chores displayed without having to change between lists (because I wont) 3. Being able to color code lists would be awesome.
replyContent: Thank you for your review, the premium plan is a subscription, you are welcome to contact us at www.any.do/contact_form, and we’d love to give you all of the information you need. Our widget can display your tasks by list. You can open one list at a time from the left menu. You can use color tags for your tasks :)

content: I really appreciate many of the features in this app, especially the ability to sync with Alexa task (or grocery) lists and see the list easily via the widget! One feature that I've not been able to find (and would love) is a dark mode setting for the quick-add notification. This would be a great feature to add (or make it default if the app is in dark mode). Thank you for all the great work on this app! Very pleased!
replyContent: The dark theme is part of our premium offering. You can learn more about this at any.do/premium 😀

content: Worked great for me in the past but now I am no longer able to share tasks. I had not shared tasks in a while so I do not know when this broke. The Share option from the support page does not show up in the desktop app or the android app. I can still see the sharing that I had previously setup for other lists but I can no longer share with new people.
replyContent: As we’ve announced on our Blog and sent by email to users with shared lists, The list sharing will be phased out in favor of our new collaboration and sharing experience which will be launching very soon. You can try it out right away register here https://www.any.do/teams After you register the official invite and links will come within 1-3 days

content: As someone with ADHD, organizational tools are a necessity and this is one of the best. I say that having tried just about every well rated organizational app in the app store. That said, this is obviously still in development. The web version is missing many important aspects. However new features are coming out regularly and the team is very responsive. Once a few more features are up to par (namely the website and the smart lists) I'll be changing this to a 5 star reveiw and paying for pro.
replyContent: Thank you for your support Rin! We are working on improving our Web App constantly and planning on adding new features soon! :)

content: I used to love this (five stars) before you changed it. I was able to set repeatable tasks for each day of the week, but now if I set a repeating task today, for example, for every Wednesday, the reminder will come up today, not Wednesday. I want the reminder on the day I want. I am very disappointed. By the way, I won't use Any Do for my grocery list. I use a better one that keeps a running cost (including tax) for each store I go to.
replyContent: We are aware of this issue and working on an updated version that will fix it. Stay tuned! :)

content: All it needs is Google Calendar integration. Edit: Oh wait it does have it! I was using the Any.do Chrome Extension (the little pop out thing) when writing this review. The Any.do Chrome Extension does not have the ability to display Google Calendar events alongside one's Any.do tasks whereas the Any.do Android app does indeed have it. AFAIK. It doesn't have IFTTT applets but I'd return if it made some.
replyContent: Glad to hear you got the Google Calendar integration working! Should you need any assistance with the feature, you're always welcome to reach out to customers@any.do 😄 We appreciate your feedback about IFTTT and will pass it on to our Product Team.

content: Missing one key feature that is a deal breaker for me. I MUST have the option to create recurring tasks based on date of completion. Ex: If I have a recurring task set up to complete every 10 days, but I actually go 15 days before completing it, I don't want to be reminded again in 5 days. I want the next due date to advance 10 days from whenever I last completed it. It's unfortunate because I love everything about this app, but won't subscribe to the paid version until this feature is added.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We truly value our users input, and our Product team is always adding user suggestions to our roadmap. The suggestion you posted has already added to our UserVoice forum, and you are welcome to vote for it here: https://bit.ly/2A0PyUT. The more votes a suggestion gets, the more likely it is to be added in the future!

content: Pretty good app! I've been looking for something where I can make events and "check it off." I couldn't find anything else besides this one. The sync feature with Google calendar works great but it reverts back to April 28th and you have to scroll to preset day for whatever reason. Aside form the bugs it's actually just the app I was looking for!
replyContent: Regarding the calendar integration, Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: 1) It has a calendar feature but you can't customize the calendar events repetition as much as you can in google (can do daily but not 5 days a week all in one entry). 2) edit: figured the task sorting part out. Sort by time and collapse upcoming/tomorrow and it will just show your daily tasks. I like that. But it's still not worth paying for unless the calendar event customization is as good as Google's since that is free.
replyContent: Thank you for the suggestion. Our team is working according to a road map that we set every year, in order to keep the app simplistic. Every feature that we add is well thought out, tested and proven as valuable to our users. That said, as soon as our team will find this suggestion highly requested, we will do our best to release it asap.

content: Love the app, but when I transferred it to a new phone, it prompted for a login, and I can't remember my password. Went to do a password reset, but my wifi security won't let me access the page from the link Any.do sent for the password reset. This is the first time that my wifi security has EVER rejected a link to a password change. That's really NOT cool. I refuse to override and risk my internet safety, so my lists are all lost. Get rid of the hacking/invasive code in the password reset link!
replyContent: Please reach out to us at any.do/contact_form, mentioning the email address your Any.do account is registered under and the new password you would like to set - we will be happy to assist you and change it from our side!

content: Really nice todo list app,  love the web interface and notification features. Also the plan my day is a brilliant feature.  However for the more advanced users this software is lacking in features and overviews. Also found some weird behaviour when setting up recurring tasks.   For any novice users, you have a great app here. If you're looking for something on steroids, look at todoist.
replyContent: This is very odd! We highly recommend you submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: I absolutely love the Any.do app. I have a terrible memory, and this app is great with helping to remember all the things I have to do in a day. I also love that I can snooze tasks, and that it will remind me to make phone calls as needed. The only thing I dislike about it is that you have to pay for premium in order to set reminders based on location rather than time. Like I said, though, great app.

I've used Any.do for years, both paid and free. I love how you can prioritize tasks, and the daily review of tasks easily helps keep you on track. The calendar that shows events and tasks is great. Highly recommended! My only comment would be that I wish it was a bit more customizable in the free version. 😀
replyContent: Thank you for updating your review, In the app settings you have an option to customize the app to your needs. For example you can choose your preferred home screen, the day the week starts, language, reminder sound, default list and more :)

content: Used it only for a few days, but the initial impression of the app is good. The daily activities are easy to update. Separate folders for specific tasks. And it's in the free version. I'm pretty sure the paid version will have more options. But so far, it's a superb app.
replyContent: We appreciate the feedback! 🤓

content: Having most of the features needed to get the job done. Please add 2 features that will make app more user friendly. First, please add option to edit task directly from calendar without any pop up. Second add Eisenhower matrix to prioritize the tasks.
replyContent: We have a blog post on how to use the method with Any.do https://www.any.do/blog/eisenhower-matrix/ We do have an option to edit tasks from the calendar, please reach out to our team if this option is not visible under settings-> support.

content: Swipe right to complete, often do to item task below it. Notification disapear in flash with any touch on screen so i dont know what task are notificated, it happens while typing.
replyContent: We would be happy to help you resolve all of the issues you have encountered should you send us a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report).

content: Update on 04-07-24: I'm an addicted user but seems the annoying add will now break my addiction if that kept on starting that noise in my office and home Reducing the stars as well ----------- Review in 2029 Using since 5 years, has avoided hundreds of tasks getting missed
replyContent: Sorry about that. We are unaware of any issues with the recurring tasks. Please submit a bug report via your app Settings - Support with more details about what is happening, so our team can look into it for you!

content: the mobile ui is weird. I want to see a lost when I open it, not what I have added or scheduled for a day. not sure if there's a setting to change that
replyContent: There's an option to set your default view right in the app's Setting 🤓 You can see instructions right here: https://support.any.do/en/articles/8609910-customizing-your-any-do-profile#h_6909cac534

content: I want to resubscribe, but the app is showing I'm not eligible for free trial since I used to decide not to subscribe when 7 day trial had passed. Now, when I want to subscribe, I cannot upgrade to the personal plan ?
replyContent: The app offers 1 trial period per account. If you already utilized it you will not see this option again 🙃 However, you are welcome to contact our Support Team at https://www.any.do/contact_form and they will gladly help you set a trial plan directly!

content: Just a little note: was better when the priority tag showed up the colour in the list. Now it doesn't, making all tasks look the same.
replyContent: You should be able to see the tags in the list view just like before. The size might be a bit smaller. Are you sure you are using the list view? https://support.any.do/en/articles/8740578-the-list-view

content: I just switched from Apple to Android and I've been looking for a good replacement for the Reminders app because it was so integral in how my family functioned. Finally found one. I just downloaded it but it looks like this is what will work for us. My only complaint is that I wish that I could have sections in my personal lists, like how they have in the family section.
replyContent: Thank you for the suggestion. You can also post your idea on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it!

content: The new UI update is a great upgrade. Overall a simple and easy app to use to manage tasks
replyContent: If you're enjoying the app, we'd very much appreciate it if you had any recommendations/suggestions for us to get a 5 star rating. You can share your ideas with us at setting-> support. Thank you!

content: Love it!! 9/7/21- what happened to the shopping list? 4.26.24- I am back to using my Galaxy S8 and I had this installed on it because my newer phone had died in some water. My complaint is I cannot seem to use this app anymore The only thing that I'm able to still use is the calendar widget. is a Galaxy S8 not supported anymore?
replyContent: This sounds very odd, please contact our team under settings-> support so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: I wish the individual items on my to-do list shows the date that indicates when I added them - this app used to do this until a sudden change occurred - but otherwise the app gets the job done.
replyContent: You are welcome to post your suggestion on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it! 😊

content: Great tool. I use it every day. There's a bug, however, that's very annoying. I'm on Galaxy Note 9. When I move the items, there's 80% chance the item will loose previously assigned datetime and will be moved to the Someday list. It's very annoying and time consuming! This is the sorting mode by Time. Additionally, when I choose this mode, majority of items belonging to various lists, unfortunately, will not be sorted by date & time, so I'd have to move them manually... Please fix these issues
replyContent: For a chronological view of your tasks, by reminder time, please go to the Calendar View :) Keep in mind that the Task View does not sort tasks by the hour, but only by specific time categories (Today, Tomorrow, Upcoming and Someday). If you're still experiencing any issue, please submit a bug report via Settings - Support, we'll be happy to help.

content: Very nice. One thing lacking in this and all similar apps I've noticed: lack of customizeability. The semi-transparent widget is cool, maybe my favourite so far. But surely it's not such a stretch to allow custom colours and an opacity slider? Otherwise seems fine, apart from the ridiculous premium fee for features that exist on preinstalled apps. My web hosting is cheaper than this, come on guys.
replyContent: 90% of the app is completely free, including all core functionality. Our premium subscription plans are based on standard business models for the industry. Regarding the opacity slider, you can also post your idea on our UserVoice page: anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea :)

content: Very good app, simple and easy intuitive organization. The available free vs paid things are also very well balanced. The only thing I would change is giving it the ability to put tasks at a scheduled time. The task itself, not the notification, which is how it currently works. It makes it so you HAVE to have a notification if you want the task in the right place in the calendar.

1 week in. not bad. somewhat intuituve. I like this app so far for its thoughtful blend of simplicity and intuitive features that go beyond being a task list, & more into routine habits. some important features are hard to find or change after initial set up. my day planning activity 'anydo.moment': I could not find all week to modify... So, it was starting this important step at a difficult time of day to use. Many simmilar apps aim & claim to be useful but only achieve novelty.
replyContent: Thanks for the review Kirk! As a new user we highly recommend checking out our Help Center to learn more about utilizing the features (https://support.any.do/), as well as our Blog which contains lots of articles on how to best apply these tools to your daily routine (http://blog.any.do/) 😊

content: It's a great app, but there are a couple small issues I think are essential to be improved. 1. If I accidentally click off of a task as I'm creating one (which is easily done when trying to scroll along to set a custom time for the reminder), it will go away and I have to re-create the whole task again. 2. When I snooze a task that's on repeat (I.E Portuguese word of the day), it resets the task and stops repeating it also.
replyContent: Hi Leo, we truly appreciate your feedback, and your idea has been sent to our product team for further review! In regards to what happens when you snooze a task, that sounds a little strange, please send us a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you :)

content: I really love this app. I find myself wanting to make tasks for myself about it. It has an incredibly clean UI and feels great to use. The only issue I have with it is the pricing model for the pro version. For 5 or 6- admittedly useful- features, there's a monthly subscription. Which personally I find to be ludicrous. I'd willingly pay a one time charge, but a monthly payment is just silly for this app.

I love this app and I am so glad that I have found it. I wish I had found it sooner, then I wouldn't have wasted my money on other apps! The only things I would like improved is: - preview of the tasks in the tags and my list view. - the box view for the tags to be colour coded. Instead of the text, the whole box is in the chosen colour. - Quicker synchronisation with windows Keep up the great work!
replyContent: We 💙 you! Please note that we display tags this way in order to allow for multiple tags to be visible for a task in list view. However, we'll be sure to let the product team know your feedback, and make sure to consider it for a future update!

content: So far, so good! I've been eyeing this app for quite a long time and I'm pretty satisfied so far! I'd just suggest two features: being able to see completed tasks on the calendar, without them showing up all the time unless you clear all of them! And I'd love to see more features with the tags, like being able to sort tasks by them and putting different "levels" on them. For instance, this tag has more priority than the others. Thanks for the hard work!
replyContent: At the moment you can go to your grid view and sort it via tags. That said, those are great ideas! We've forwarded them to our product team for consideration. And if we see more support for similar features from other users we'll definitely look into adding them. :)

content: I love this application so much!!! Good job to the developers. However, I've been having some issues lately with the application. The application refuses to notify me of some tasks I planned to do. When trying to set the time for a reminder, the clock's 5 minutes faster and automatically blocks the other minutes before. As an alternative, I set the date and time using natural language but sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. Kindly fix this. Once again, it's a wonderful application.
replyContent: We are unaware of any issues with the Reminders, so that's odd. Please note that the "Custom" reminder option is designed to set the earliest reminder in a 5 minutes time :) That said, if you're experiencing a different issue, our team will be happy to look into it for you, should you submit a bug report via your app Settings - Support.

content: Suggestions: - Make the tag colors the background of the task, and not just a small line under the task title. At least have this as an option. - The trees in the Focus mode are all the same no matter how quick or long you do a task. Add variety to this mode: trees/plants to choose from, other decorations, probably even animals or different landscapes. Add more music to choose from, too. I definitely love the look and feel of this app. I enjoy it better with Premium, though.
replyContent: Those are wonderful suggestions. we have forwarded them to our Product team and will definitely consider it for future versions. You can also post your idea on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it ASAP!

content: I love this app for keeping track of my homework, but I wish they would add some kind of timetable functionality for students. Also I think it's a bit poor that you have to pay for a subscription if you want to use the focus mode. In general the app is great, though, ideal for keeping track of everything I need to do, and it's great that I can set recurring reminders for orchestra, clubs etc.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback, we provide 90% of our features at no cost. You can post your idea on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it!

content: I LOVED this app because it has a calendar and to-do list in one go. I can categorize my tasks and put subtasks below. But when I recently updated the app, no radio button to tick off for the subtasks. I handle a lot of tasks categorized. Plus the notes below the subtasks is not there anymore. You need to add more clicks. It was easy and organized. Now, in uninstalling. So sad, i thought I have found the app. Was about to go Premium to get the full benefits but uninstalling. 😢
replyContent: This is strange behavior. The button to complete subtasks was never removed, and neither were the notes below the task. If you're not seeing these, we recommend you submit a bug report via Settings - Support so we can check this issue on our end.

content: It's fast, easy to use, and I like how my repeated daily tasks only show up one day at a time and only shows up in the next day after I've completed the task the day prior. The moments feature makes daily planning a breeze, too. In terms of areas for improvement, I would like to see the Gmail zap integration fixed because it isn't working on my side. Also, for an auto-sort feature in my task lists so I don't have to keep refreshing it when I adjust the reminder times. Thanks. :)

Clean, straight forward, and easy to use for me so it makes it more effective and likely that I'll continue using it. No distractions and helps me plan my day I really like being able to access it on both phones and computer too. Would like the sync updates between phone and desktop to be better / faster, hopefully that will improve soon. Would also like some additional functionality but that comes under premium.

Really good app that has helped me get much more organised! Just one change to make it perfect. When deleting an event from the calendar, pleeease add an option to "delete this and future events". At the moment there are only options to delete one or delete all. Sometimes I need to delete client appointments from then on, but need the others in the previous weeks for invoicing, etc. Would make my life much easier 😅
replyContent: Thank you for the suggestion. You can also post your idea on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it!

content: The app is good, but it's not for me. I found it too overwhelming. I prefer a more simple and quick app for my reminders, like Microsoft Tasks or Google Keep. Also, many features are paid. That by itself is not bad, but a subscription is a bit too much for a reminder app, especially considering that many of these paid features are available for free in other apps, like the ones form Google and Microsoft. It should good for professional use, if you're willing to pay for a subscription.
replyContent: Any.do is both a product and a service, and we aim to help our users remain productive, with exclusive features and a simple design and functionality :) We recommend learning more about the app and the features here- https://support.any.do. We will be happy to assist with any question, should you contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: Love it, it's user-friendly, no ads pop up, and is highly effective though I am not using the premium version
replyContent: If you're enjoying the app, we'd very much appreciate it if you had any recommendations/suggestions for us to get a 5 star rating. You can share your ideas with us at any.do/contact_form. Thank you!

content: It's a GREAT app. 4 Stars because I think one addition would be a way to have 2 identical widgets running without being connected. Like 1 widget set for my daily goals tasks (shower, laundry, gym), and the second widget for tasks I update and add throughout the day (pick up milk, get haircut)! That way i don't get overwhelmed by a single long list but instead have 2 smaller lists. I'm a "one screen all widgets" guy. Another addition would possibly be a widget calendar list, instead of having the 30 day calendar + each days events. Seems useless to have such a huge window of calendar days when I really just need to have a list of events of each day. Samsung calendar has this widget and it's perfect.
replyContent: Having additional widgets is a great idea! We've forwarded this suggestion to our product team for consideration, and if we see support from more users for a similar idea, we'll definitely look into implementing this.

content: Pros - Really good app in terms of productivity and usability. - Love how it's possible to colour code and label tasks eg personal, work, university etc. - Love that it syncs with my Google calendar. - Plus I love the app's UI. - I also like the focus option; Cons - I think the focus option should be more like the forest app and not allow you to go away from the screen/tree, otherwise the tree dies. - I also think you should be able to add attachments to events like you can with Tasks.

This is the best to do app I have come across so far, I love the interactive features and the pop up. I will recommend some improvements e.g. 1. pop-up shouldn't just disappear if you mistakenly click on your screen until you snooze or postpone. 2. tasks forgotten should pop up at some intervals until it is marked as done, even if the date is in the past.
replyContent: Those are great ideas! We've forwarded them to our product team for consideration. And if we see more support for similar features from other users we'll definitely look into adding them :)

content: I absolutely love this app, I run my own property maintenance business and it's just what I need to remind me about appointments and ordering supplies etc. The integration with WhatsApp is an excellent idea - I haven't missed a reminder yet. My only criticism is that it doesn't have a decent month view on the calendar, so I end up gravitating back to Google calendar, if that could be sorted out would be 5 stars from me.
replyContent: Please note that Any.do is a minimalist task manager, to help our users remain focused only on what matters :) The Agenda view (https://support.any.do/monthly-calendar-agenda/) was designed to help you see all of your upcoming meetings and tasks, and is ideal for users who plan ahead! For any questions, please contact us at- www.any.do/contact_form

content: I switched to Any.Do premium from Google Calendar+Keep. Please add an option for a custom reminder (more than 1 week), also when choosing all day event, the maximum time for a reminder is 2 days, which custom time could be productive as well. Other than that, awesome app, have been using it few years ago and decided to give it another try.

It's OK but it's not for me. I'm a student and cannot pay for an upgrade in the app. The free options are a bit limited so I, had to delete this app. Hope you enjoy it tho😊 Edit: Thank you for replying. I will make sure to give it another try and re-rate it depending on my second experience :) 2nd edit: it's very helpful. It does what it's created for: planning and keeping your life organized. And with reminders for us forgetful people . Bravo😁 I still feel like its missing something...
replyContent: Please note that 90% of the app is completely free, including all core functionality :) We'd love to get your feedback and suggestions, by writing to us at https://www.any.do/contact_form. We're constantly trying to provide the best possible app for our users, and feedback like yours help us do so.

content: Updated ratibg to a 4 star on 2nd April 2021 after fixes I am a premium member. The latest update introduced a new interface that although is good in some aspects but has taken away the best features of the previous one. Can no longer collapse the folders to see how Many tasks per folder. Collapsing also makes scrolling easier. Plan your day feature is buggy. After completing task rescheduling one has to wait 30 seconds or more for server to synch up otherwise the plan reverts back to old one.

Great app. A couple suggestions to make it 5 stars. Would be good if the search actually found the item soi could drag it around as needed. Also ability to turn off alarm/reminder by default. Also Android app sometimes throws my task I'm trying to move around right down to the bottom and takes minutes to go find it then drag it back to the top
replyContent: We are not aware of any issues with the search feature. Regarding the drag and drop and the default alarm option, we will be more than happy to look into this for you and sort this out, should you send us a bug report (Settings- Support).

content: still would be a lot better if you had notifications that forces the user to snooze or dismiss. also I think it's a bad idea to have a "Done" button in an edit window of the task. you already have a place to result mark the task as done. this done button in the edit window is actually so much a pain coz that's the place anybody would expect an "ok" or "save" button to save the edit.

Very useful for day to day and repeatable tasks. Only problem I've had is when some repeating tasks stop displaying notifications and I have to delete them and re-enter them, which is a massive waste of time, especially when you have quite a few different ones set up. Edit: it seems reinstalling the app fixes this issue.
replyContent: We would be happy to help you resolve all of the issues you have encountered should you send us a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report).

content: I generally like the app, moving from Calengoo(a great app) after 6 years. I used a trial version of this app and it looked quite good. Decided to subscribe for this app with annual subscription. After a few hours, I get a notice requiring me to subscribe. Thinking that my earlier subscription did not go through, I subscribed again, then only to note that I was charged twice for the same app. Please cancel only my 2nd subscription and refund that payment. Thanks.
replyContent: We will be happy to assist you regarding the duplicate subscription. Please contact us from your premium account under settings-> support :)

content: A great app. The reminders are intuitive. The app has enhanced my productivity greatly. It's a bit pricey, though, for premium use (especially to add new users/workspaces). A workspace costs same price as a fresh premium subscription, making it not cost-friendly for teammates. Other than that, it's a great planner, to-do list and reminder app.
replyContent: We ensured that Any.do workspace would be fairly priced by basing our cost on standard industry business models. We have lower prices than most of our competitors :)

content: One of the best apps there, recursive, monthly check list to do, even with sub-tasks. Good job. I'm giving just 4 stars because notifications are too much, you need to consolidate them in just one expandable and also because "do later" or "done" pop ups are a little strange, you can check a do later time for first one or something like that but not everything.

Great app to be organized! (1) The whatsapp feature is fantastic - super easy to set reminders on the move, on the laptop via whatsapp web, & very effective to make sure I don't miss anything. (2) the widgets aren't great. I have a widget on my phone home screen/ Tab & the date doesn't automatically change so sometimes I'm looking at yesterday's tasks/calendar & I have to manually open the app - correct it... I can't seem to tick off the tasks from the widget. I have to open the app. Irritating!
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! We are working on making improvements to the widgets in the near future and for the sync process all together :) If you have any specific questions, you are welcome to contact us at- https://www.any.do/contact_form, and we’d love to help you out.

content: I've used this app for many years with good experience. Lately the UX and complexity have caused some problems, nonetheless, new features have been very good. However, with the latest update I can no longer see tasks planned for tomorrow, a feature that was the reason for using this app to begin with. It's just gone with no possibility to configure it again. I do understand development of new features, but I do not appreciate removal of features that are being used. Great app, not for me anymore
replyContent: Please note that in order to sort the lists by timeline, you can simply go to the "All Tasks" view, or any specific list, and change the sorting from 'List' to 'Time' under the menu on the top right corner :) If you have any further questions, please contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form.

content: I like that you can move items around on your lists. I don't like that it no longer works with Google Home.
replyContent: Google announced that they no longer support the integration with third party apps.😔 If you have any questions or further feedback about the app that you'd like to share with us, we'd love to hear it via Settings → Support!

content: Can we modify the sound of the notification so that it will standout like an alarm perhaps? thank you very much in advance.
replyContent: Be advised that the notification relies on your phone sound settings. You can also choose a preferred sound for your notifications by simply going to your Device Settings → Any.do → Notification Sounds. For further assistance contact us at www.any.do/contact_form.

content: Tried many 'to do list' apps and Any.do best fits my needs. Has been using the web browser and mobile app on a daily basis for several years. Good UI and flexibility that allows everyone to manage their lists in the way they wish. Great value for the money, but it's worth mentioning that I often come across bugs that ruin the experience and make it difficult to work smoothly with the app.
replyContent: Was there a specific issue you encountered? We will be happy to assist, should you kindly submit a bug report via Settings - Support so our team can look into this for you.

content: This is the best To Do list app / orginiler that I used by far. I like the fact that it is cross-platform, it's quite intuitive and easy to use. Regarding issues, I think that the design could be a bit better and cleaner, and there are a few small glitches like the fact that the order of tasks is not being updated according to time right after and you have to refresh it. Otherwise, a great app!
replyContent: The new year promotion was 45% off of the price we offer directly, not the pricing in the app store. Thank you for your feedback and we allow users to select the location of tasks by drag and drop so if it automatically sorest by time is will not let you drag and drop.

content: Absolutely wonderful. This app is so helpful. I love that it integrates with so many apps so easily. All I had to do was link my Google accounts and all my events were there. The only thing that sucks is that you can't share calendars the way you can share lists. It'd be great so that instead of having to constantly talk about it, my family could coordinate schedules right in this app. If not for that, I would've gave 5 stars.
replyContent: At this time, Any.do offers a Calendar Integration not an independent calendar. That said, if you integrate a shared calendar, you will be able to see its events in the app and others can integrate the same calendar :)

content: Everything else is great. Except for the widget. I switched from. TickTick but the widget makes me wanna go back. Its way too laggy. No matter how fast the device is. At first, I thought it was just my device, but then I checked it on the S7. The result was the same. A little optimization would be nice.
replyContent: This sounds odd! Please submit a bug via Settings - Support so our team can look into this for you :)

content: This app used to be amazing for staying organised. It syncs with your Google calendar so everything can be in one place. My favourite feature was in the morning it will help you plan your day and choose what tasks you'll be doing, and it would play a cute jingle with a motivational message at the end. It doesn't do that anymore and now keeps trying to making me create a team workspace which is not why I use it.
replyContent: We uploaded a new beta version with fixes to the daily push moment notification. We recommend joining the beta community and in the new version setting your preferences for the daily push. To learn more see: https://support.any.do/super-users/. The fix will be released to all standard users in the next few days as well.

content: This app retrieves all the events from all your Google calendars by default. Potential security hazard depending on use case. Beware
replyContent: We offer a calendar integration and not an independent calendar if you allow the app to have calendar permissions you will be able to access your calendar events and edit them or add new ones. You can also disable the calendar permission and use the app to manage your tasks only.

content: I love this app but am having one big problem...while ticking off items with the app open the app often closes and has to be restarted. If I use the widget to tick items off it doesn't happen...but then I can't use the widget to create new items for all of my lists because there is nowhere to select the list I want to add to so a new item goes to the default list...so I have keep switching between the widget and the app. I submitted a bug report some time ago but nothing happened.
replyContent: Sorry for this! Please submit a bug via Settings - Support so our team can have this resolved for you :)

content: Subscription and Customer Service I used this app at the recommendation of a friend. I purchased a subscription plan several years ago. I contacted customer service this year as I saw a charge on my credit card and I did not realize I had still been paying for the subscription. For several years. Turns out my subscription was renewed automatically. The customer service team was great and I received a refund without any hassle. I'm very happy with their service.
replyContent: We were happy to help! 😊 According to our terms of service, unless the user cancells the subscription, it does get automatically renewed. We have step-by-step cancellation instructions in our Help Center at https://bit.ly/3nIPU5A available at all times.

content: Hi there, I've just started using the app and it's great! Just so that I already got the premium version! It's just great so far and I have nothing to complain about. The reason I'm giving 4 stars (for now) is for the fact that there's one major feature I really need that I can't find it on Any.do: The ability to setup a reminder for a different timezone. For example, I want a reminder to go off whenever US stock market opens (9:30 ET) independent on what country I am.Is that possible on Any.do?

Very useful, I am someone who constantly needs to write to-do lists for the day as I am forgetful and this app is simple and easy to use. I add a task for any particular date and cross it out when I'm done. You can also set times so the app reminds you, which is very helpful. I recommend so as to not use paper to write down lists all the time👍
replyContent: We work hard to make Any.do the best that it can be! How do you think we can make this a 5 stars review? We'll be happy to receive any feedback!

content: Nice app with cool UI and features but not for me. -The notification is rather obstructive when I need to call quicky but have to snooze several pending notifications. - Worst is when the notification appears during typing and I accidentally tap on some button. The notification disappears but I do not know what action on which task I selected. - Default snooze options provide in app are just not enough.
replyContent: Thanks for the review! We appreciate your feedback about our notifications and reminders. We've forwarded it to our product team for consideration.

content: Lovely app. One problem though, billing is yearly. An option for monthly payments should be made available. Even if it's just for the first 2 months only and then maybe quarterly after that. Still not sure I wanna make a commitment for such a long time frame after a 7 day trial. Edit: On it right away. Thanks guys. 👊🏾
replyContent: We have a monthly plan, if you are not able to see it our team would be happy to send you a direct link you upgrade, should you contact us at www.any.do/contact_form.

content: When I edit the notes section of a task, the editable field is very small, very hard to add something. Please fix this, it is very hard to use and notes is something I use a lot Ideal expected behaviour is to edit in the exieting section which is already full screen, not to have a pop-up. In the pop-up you have to scroll down where you want to add or modify something
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. You are welcome to post your suggestion on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it!

content: Please can you make white transparent widget or even better, put options to choose purple or celestial blue with transparency. Thank you. black is dark and I don't like dark colours. Please.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! You are welcome to post this as a product suggestion our UserVoice page as explained here: https://support.any.do/en/articles/8634447-uservoice-suggest-a-feature. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it ASAP!

content: the mobile ui is weird. I want to see a lost when I open it, not what I have added or scheduled for a day. not sure if there's a setting to change that
replyContent: There's an option to set your default view right in the app's Setting 🤓 You can see instructions right here: https://support.any.do/en/articles/8609910-customizing-your-any-do-profile#h_6909cac534

content: I want to resubscribe, but the app is showing I'm not eligible for free trial since I used to decide not to subscribe when 7 day trial had passed. Now, when I want to subscribe, I cannot upgrade to the personal plan ?
replyContent: The app offers 1 trial period per account. If you already utilized it you will not see this option again 🙃 However, you are welcome to contact our Support Team at https://www.any.do/contact_form and they will gladly help you set a trial plan directly!

content: still need some improvement but overall a good app
replyContent: Thanks for the review! You are more than welcome to submit feedback and suggestions via our UserVoice feed 😃 For more details, see https://support.any.do/en/articles/8634447-uservoice-suggest-a-feature

content: Used it only for a few days, but the initial impression of the app is good. The daily activities are easy to update. Separate folders for specific tasks. And it's in the free version. I'm pretty sure the paid version will have more options. But so far, it's a superb app.
replyContent: We appreciate the feedback! 🤓

content: Let try it
replyContent: Hi, we designed the app to be a great method to add tasks quickly, we try to help you out as much as we can, so you can be as productive as you can be! We recommend checking out our help center to learn about all our features here: https://support.any.do and if you have any questions, please let us know at Settings -> Support

content: Having most of the features needed to get the job done. Please add 2 features that will make app more user friendly. First, please add option to edit task directly from calendar without any pop up. Second add Eisenhower matrix to prioritize the tasks.
replyContent: We have a blog post on how to use the method with Any.do https://www.any.do/blog/eisenhower-matrix/ We do have an option to edit tasks from the calendar, please reach out to our team if this option is not visible under settings-> support.

content: It's a good task scheduling app.
replyContent: If you're enjoying the app, we'd very much appreciate it if you had any recommendations/suggestions for us to get a 5 star rating. You can share your ideas with us at Settings -> Support . Thank you!

content: Update on 04-07-24: I'm an addicted user but seems the annoying add will now break my addiction if that kept on starting that noise in my office and home Reducing the stars as well ----------- Review in 2029 Using since 5 years, has avoided hundreds of tasks getting missed
replyContent: Sorry about that. We are unaware of any issues with the recurring tasks. Please submit a bug report via your app Settings - Support with more details about what is happening, so our team can look into it for you!

content: nice to the app
replyContent: If you're enjoying the app, we'd very much appreciate it if you had any recommendations/suggestions for us to get a 5 star rating. You can share your ideas with us at Settings -> Support . Thank you!

content: Nice app
replyContent: If you're enjoying the app, we'd very much appreciate it if you had any recommendations/suggestions for us to get a 5 star rating. You can share your ideas with us at Settings -> Support . Thank you!

content: ok
replyContent: If you're enjoying the app, we'd very much appreciate it if you had any recommendations/suggestions for us to get a 5 star rating. You can share your ideas with us at Settings -> Support . Thank you!
