content: Truly the best planning app! I was looking for a planning app with widgets that can change their size. Was harder than I thought! I love that you can see everythubg even in the smallest widget. That was very important to me. What I also like is that you can see all your tasks in a time line sorted by time. This way I don't miss anything. Subtasks and notes are helpful. I like the separate feature for the shopping list! This app is super flexible and intuitive!
replyContent: Glad to hear that you're enjoying the features and that Any.do is helping you stay organized! We hope you will share the app with your friends and family so they can try it out too ;)

content: Anydo keeps priorities in front of you, allows you to continually add, prioritize, delegate, move, and adjust tasks, thoughts, reminders, events, etc. in whatever way makes sense to you. It's motivating to check tasks off as you go through the day. It can be as precise or as relaxed as you set it to be. It works best for me by giving me a place to capture and instantly prioritize and plan things as they pop up. I love that it keeps me accountable and motivated without forcing a rigid schedule.

As someone who really does a bad job making to do lists, this app really makes making them a breeze. Traditionally I don't make lists, or planners, etc because of the overhead in doing so; I'd rather spend that time doing the things I know I need to do. For a while now I've tried to find an app that would change that, that would make planning a breeze. After trying SEVERAL planning/TODO apps, this one quickly rose to the top. The interface is clean and simple and adding tasks takes no time at all - literally seconds. And above all, the Any Do moments make re-organanizing those tasks VERY simple and constantly keeps you on top of everything but in a non-intrusive way. Keep up the great work!
replyContent: Wow! We're ecstatic to hear how much Any.do helps you! 😄 Thanks for the support!

content: After trying literally every cal app on the app store this is the one. I've used Any.do a few times over the years but it was never quite right. This time they nailed it. It's a super simple UI but has everything you need without being annoying or overbearing. Very simple to use & figure out. 15 mins messing with it & I'm fully ready to go. I transferred all my biz meetings, personal sched. etc. In minutes. Definitely give it a try, even if you have before. It's totally worth it.
replyContent: Thank you for your review! 💙  We would be happy for you to share this with your friends & family!

content: Very pleased with the app and runs smoothly on both my S5 and Note 5. Like the simple but elegant interface and am not easy to please in this area. Want to upgrade, but dislike monthly fees - offer flat rate (unclear what warrants recurring payments). The 'storage of files related to task' not useful for me. UPDATE: Upgraded to 5-star app, just would like flat rate upgrade option. Overall very good!
replyContent: Hi John, thank you for your review! Please note that we modeled all our pricing tiers off of similar services so we could stay competitive. However we also occasionally offer promotions, you can inquire about them at premium@any.do!

content: App is user friendly and does what is needed, and more, without being complicated. I've never had any issues with this app, and I've used it for several years via different Samsung phones. Being able to arrange items and list catagories is great. Being able to easily share a list is nice. I love that I can easily add and view notes on any chosen item. I can't imagine anyone being disappointed with Any.do. The app backs up data, as well, so I've never lost existing info when changing phones.
replyContent: We love our veteran users and are thrilled that you can rely on us to help you be organized, productive, and keep your information safe! Thank you so much for your support 😁

content: Overall: this app is awesome and so intuitive for organizing any type of to do list you want to make. I love the options for adding details to each task. One improvement that would help me: I wish there was a little status bar with a percentage or something on tasks that have subtasks so that you could see partial progress when some subtasks are complete.

Fantastic UI with near perfect integration with calendar. I would love the ability to make tasks with no due dates that do not show up in the "someday section." Things like my grocery list and books/movies to read I don't need a date for and don't want them in the way when I'm looking at date-specific tasks. Edit: thanks for the reply! Not sure if I am missing this somewhere, but I would love to see the ability to comment on tasks. Would really help with communication with my team. Thanks!
replyContent: Wow! Thanks for the support! Also the "Someday" category is intended for tasks with no due dates. Anything with a due date will automatically fall into the Today, Tomorrow, or Upcoming section. The Someday section contains the remaining tasks which will have no due date. You can write comments in the "Notes" section of your task.

content: Great app! The simplicity of adding a task with a reminder has been very useful. I usually try new apps and forget about them shortly after but I've been using any.do for several years because of how quick and simple the interface is. I get a lot of satisfaction crossing a task off of a physical paper list so the added feature on this app to do so is nice too.

Love this app. I like to utilize lists to keep myself organized as well as to feel the small accomplishments. (Even on days when you can't get through everything it's nice to see the progress you're making) I use it for groceries, to do lists, tasks that will help reach a short/longterm goal, work to do lists, and more. It's great that you can have more than one list, set reminders, attach a file, add notes or a tag with priority. It's the best app I've found.
replyContent: Thanks for the awesome review! Glad seeing you're enjoying using the features! 🤓💙

content: I have found this to be an amazing experience for helping me stay on track! I have adult adhd 👀🤣 ..I tried to use other planning apps, and they weren't for me. I have to say, "Any.do has forever changed my life with timeliness, schedules, and events! I have read a lot of reviews, and I did my own research. This app can/could be your dally assistant to put you on the path for being more organized and getting back to being stress free! What do you have to lose? It's free! Best Regards
replyContent: We 💙 hearing that Any.do is the solution you were looking for to manage all of your to-dos in one app! Feel free to spread the word to your friends and family so that they can have their productivity boosted as well! 😊

content: I reinstalled this program and now it works great. I think there's a bug when importing from Google calendar. (I submitted logs). Update- I decided against using this, the calendar integration is not as good as I had hoped. I can use Google calendar with better functionality for my purposes. I don't need separate lists, what I need is the ability to easily color code calendar entries and to add reminders. YMMV.
replyContent: I'm so glad that your app is working the way it should now! Thank you for your support!

content: Amazing and very simple to use which is good for anyone with a busy schedule. Easy to Quickly put all plans for that day or as far ahead as you want. Jot down any reminder at anytime during the day in a few seconds or change anything already put in. Easy to share with anyone else if wanted. Easy to set up with any other calendar or app so it automatically saves in your to-do list. And quick, easy tips to help you with anything you need to know about the app. Love it!💞💯💞

I love this app. It has so much functionality. Moreso than I even know! I really like that it is a hybrid task/to-do list with a working calendar so you can have your daily tasks but also put your appointments and meetings on the calendar in advance. So many others seem to be one or the other. Plus it prompts you each day with a "Plan Your Day" sequence which is a nice reminder what is needed that day. I wish adding new stuff was included in the prompt, but i can let that slide. Thanks creators!

**2021: still using!** Super clean interface. I like the nudges to plan my day. Connects nicely with the any.do Cal app with a widget that prompts me to enter to-dos right after a meeting. Feels like this works the way my brain works. Super props for the connection with Amazon Echo. I add to my shopping and to-do list right from my kitchen, when I am up to my elbows in dishes. It really catches all of my to-dos, and gently encourages me to actually do them. Winner. I hardly ever write reviews.
replyContent:
So glad you like the app and the new Alexa integration! We work hard to make the app as helpful as possible. 
Keep your eye out for our new calendar integration coming out next month :)

content: I never write reviews or endorse products, but this one, I have to hand it to any.do -great job. It's always seemed like a no-brainer to me that some one build a planner, calendar, and to do list all in one with the added features of being able to pin in attachments to tasks (and hopefully calendar events in the future....?) with a killer widget (hope to see the "my lists" section end up as a widget option someday too!), and sleek interface, I don't know if I've ever nerded out so hard on an app.

I've tried nearly every other "to do" app available, and none of them compare to Any.do: even the paid ones. The feature that holds Any.do above the rest, in my opinion, is the unfailable reminder system. This app literally hijacks your screen to remind you to plan out your day or to complete a task. I'm sure not all would find this a necessity, but personally, a simple alarm just won't do. I benefit greatly from the forceful nature of this app. It's pretty amazing, actually. Good job!

Love this app! This is the only app that lets me move items around on my lists, like moving unavailable grocery items to the bottom. I also like that my completed items stay with me if I want, like my packing list, so after a trip I can make all items active again for the next trip without having to think of everything again. And the completed items on the grocery list jog my memory for the next shopping trip. I just use the basic app and am very happy with it.

Stopped working with Google Assistant. No notice of why. Literally my entire reason for using this app. I'm done. EDIT - My review was unfair. Their response here was measured, professional and appreciated. While I'm disappointed that I can no longer set Any.do tasks from my Google home ecosystem, this is Google's fault for discontinuing compatibility, not Any.do's. The fact that I'm so frustrated to lose Any.do integration speaks to the seamless, intuitive interface of their excellent app.
replyContent: Thanks for updating your review! We really appreciate the support! 😊

content: Started using this a long time ago, recently redownloaded after going through a period of not using any productivity apps and, returning to this app I love what they've done with it. The integrations to the calendar, the sub-task feature, the various categorization options, and the customizable any.do moment are all very useful and exactly what I was wanting from this type of an app. Basically it's good at what is does, and they update! It also had my old tasks, which was a good little chuckle.

great app! unfortunately does not allow for notes about (or long descriptions of) sub-tasks, but everything else: tasks, topics, google calendar integration, etc. it's got everything to serve my needs in a very clean and visible UI. thank you for such an amazing app, definitely considering going pro once it becomes more integrated into my routine and I decide I need the extra features.

By far the best planning app out! I just have one issue. I happily outdid the premium yearly fee, but upgraded my phone the following month. When I uninstalled and installed on my new phone, it recognized me, email, even old tasks, but did not transfer plan. Can someone please help me with this. Thank you. Keep up the good work!
replyContent: We're so glad you like Any.do so much! 😄 For any issues with subscriptions/Premium, contact us at Premium@any.do. We'd love to help resolve your trouble.

content: new user, so far so great! just started using and am on the premium trial period. already I think it will be worth the annual fee! I'm in love with the sorted grocery list that i can print or share with my husband. i also appreciate the "plan your day" that allows me to select which items in my to do list i want to accomplish today and which i want to postpone. integrating with my calendar is also very useful so that i can see my appointments, events, and to do list all in one place! AWESOME
replyContent: Thank you four your support! You are welcome to check out our Help Center (https://bit.ly/2sO10ft) Youtube channel (https://bit.ly/2HeafzE) and blog (blog.any.do) for any questions. Also feel free to reach out at customers@any.do :)

content: I need to use it more honestly, reluctant to purchase pro version of the app due to there being no set price. I would pay a one time fee for this to be my main planner. I use it on my phoen and on my laptop to plan ahead keep my days structured, grocery lists that i can send out to others, great overall app 10/10.. But I dont want to be on any more subscription services other than Netflix, Hulu, and Audible.

I've only had this app for a short period of time and it's already made a HUGE difference in my day to day life. No more paper lists to obsess over, lose, or struggle to read because of my sloppy handwriting! I have a super hard time staying on track and getting things done, so this app is super helpful. It's user-friendly, it has a ton of helpful reminders and task/listing options, and it connects to my Google Assistant to do (and sync!) everything. Highly recommend!!

Honestly, I struggle with most reminder apps because they make too easy to get rid of notifications. This app forces me to choose between checking something as done, snoozing the reminder for a duration of my choice, or a "focus" mode that goes into that tree planting focus app thing. I like that it forces me to make an active decision about whether I'm going to put something off or not.

I absolutely love this app. I like having to do lists for myself but my calendar would often be over cluttered, or I would forget something I needed to do. I love the snooze option where it asks how long you want to snooze the reminder and ypu can set to an exact time and day easily. The unpaid option for this app is perfect for me.
replyContent: Thanks for your review! We love hearing that our snooze option is working for your schedule :) We really appreciate the support!

content: This app is amazing. This is such a well put together app I had to get a subscription to support the developers. A couple suggestions: 1. Can we connect the calendar to Facebook events? 2. More themes and backgrounds 3. Continue to improve reminder/notification options and displays. I am a big person that loves to be reminded because I often times forget to do things
replyContent: Cheers Austin! We appreciate the support 😘 If you have the FB calendar on your device, you will be able to see it in Any.do as well :) We limit themes and background as we like to keep the app clean and simple per our design standards but we will take this and the reminders suggestion under consideration for future developments!

content: It's not just a callendar! It's an excellent electronic version of a planner! In the callendar section, type events for every day of the week or month! Type in the location of the event and it will synch with your GPS! In the task section make separate list such a grocery list or regular list of items or tasks you need! Pretty cool and usefully for success in school, work, and personal life!

After trying several different task app's, I came across Any.do for a few years ago. Since then I've have had no reason to switch. This app is easy, intuitive and customizable to fit my needs. From a development and maintenance POV, I have also found Any.do to be thoughtful in their updates for both mobile and desktop versions.
replyContent: Thank you for your support! :)

content: i love any.do ive gotten 4 other people at least using it everyday! so convenient and easy to make lists add to different lists and i like the opportunity to share lists with my husband and we can check things off and they show up on both ends. i love the daily reminders that keep us from slacking off! amazing app! way better than the reminder app that comes with my samsung phone!
replyContent: We ❤️️ you too!

content: by far the BEST note app I have ever used the user interface is aesthetically pleasing and easy to grasp, the quick add to ur list button is reliable and unobtrusive, it allows you to integrate with calender and any other note taking app you may have been using before, u can separate the tasks and it automatically....nevermind just try it. it's fantastic! and that's just the free version. I haven't even tried the free trial yet. cool.

I complain about crashes and it was immediately fixed!Good job!! Now the crashes have returned! I really need it fixed because I need to change apps otherwise 😩 I followed your instructions on deleting the data, etc but it just now crashed again. I am a patient person and I have used Any Do for years but let's try one more time and then I will have to find another app. It crashed again 😑 Working great now. THEY KEPT ME INFORMED ON THE STATUS UNTIL IT WAS FIXED ! I TOTALLY RECOMMEND IT.!
replyContent: Hi John, We work hard to make Any.do the best that it can be! 😉 Thanks for sharing, and make sure to spread the word to your friends and family so that they can have their productivity boosted as well!

content: I've tried several different list/to do apps and none are quite as versatile as Any.do. I love that I can integrate it with my Alexa and add things to my shopping list. I also love that I can share and collaborate lists with my husband. The only sightly buggy thing I've encountered is trying to move a new list, made at the bottom of my numerous lists, to the top. It'll often get stuck and pre-order however it likes. If I go back and try a second or third time, I can get it to move

Its great, doing the job it need to. But i wish the homescreen widget is more simpler. I feel there is a lot of text, boxes. I wish it can replace the texts calendar, tasks, add task to some simple icons. Like putting a "+" sign for add task text on the widget and then giving the mic icon on the input field instead having it prior. Also, showing the tasks just for that day and removing the tomorrow, upcoming, someday things in the widget. Just my opinion, to have the widget simple.
replyContent: We support 4 different widgets for different levels of minimalism! Take a look at our Help Center article to see which one works best for your purposes: support.any.do/widgets

content: This app is really cool. one feature I would really appreciate is if you could allow events to be completed, or allow tasks to have durations/end times. A common problem I have is a task has a specific time and duration, but sometimes I don't get around to it at the exact time so I would like it to only be completed when I actually manually mark it off.

Five stars. Able to organize and tag quickly. Love the 'Plan Your Day' feature. I ended up going back to old school and using physical index cards instead of any apps, since that works better with my mind, but this was the best app I had found of many tried. Fair pricing as well. Excellent for separating out personal and shopping and grocery lists as well.

This app is awesome! I'm using the bare bones version (not the premium) and signed in on all my devices, laptop, tablet and phone. I make/update my lists on the PC at home, I then reach into my pocket at the pharmacy, supermarket or while running errands and don't arrive back home kicking myself because I forgot something and now have to waste precious time and energy on another trip. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
replyContent: We're so glad you're enjoying Any.do! 😄

content: VERY EASY TO USE!!!! I have ADD and this app has greatly assisted me in keeping on task and completing task! There is no greater feeling than looking at all the task I have completed throughout the day. It motivates me to keep going and decreases distractions. I have added it to my daughter's phone who shares my disorder. The groccery list is awesome also. I love how it breaks items into categories.

Love this app! Comes with a widget function so I can access and plan my day right from the homepage, not to mention you can customise the widget to fit with the style of your homescreen. Favourite feature is that the widget displays all the dates in a month along with any given day's tasks right below at the same time, so I dont have to switch back & forth. It syncs with Google Calendar events for a seamless experience. Its free version is powerful and already satisfies most my planning needs.
replyContent: Thanks for the awesome review Amy! So glad that you're finding the features useful and that Any.so is keeping you on top of your agenda! 🤓👊

content: This app is usually pretty solid. Today, it won't let me get into it anymore. It keeps stopping. must have something to do with the update from yesterday. Rebooting the phone didn't fix it. Luckily, looks like i can still use the app via the widget, just can't get into the app proper. Support was able to fix this problem by deleting the data and uninstalling & reinstalling. i was nervous about losing everything, but all of my tasks came back and the app is back to it's stellar self.
replyContent: Thank you for updating your review! :)

content: Awesome app. I use this more than any other app. I've used it for years. I am a very task oriented person and me being able to create a separate list for my family members, work, etc. And setting alarms on when tasks need to be done is invaluable. Reduces stress in having to remember what I have to do and allows me to have more productive & happy days. Try it and you'll be glad you did.
replyContent: We are so happy that Any.do helps you to stay organized Tom!😊

content: Simply put, it makes my life easier. I haven't paid for the premium version yet, and unlike other apps where the basic version is garbage so you have to pay for premium, this app provides tons of benefits for free. I've tried A LOT of different notes apps to find the right one is this is by far the best one you can get. The premium version offers even more benefits and I will most likely upgrade soon.
replyContent: Thank you for the 5 stars, we appreciate it! 😊

content: Great way to remember things at the right time. The scheduling a new reminder is a bit clumsy. The default pre-selected times are not what I would like, and I have to always scroll to 'Custom', at the end of the list. I would like to define my own time slots to choose from.
replyContent:
Thank you for your feedback. We truly value our users input, and our Product team is always adding user suggestions to our roadmap. The suggestion you posted has already added to our UserVoice forum, and you are welcome to vote for it here: https://bit.ly/2Qu3prb
The more votes a suggestion gets, the more likely it is to be added in the future!

content: I love using any.do for organizing all my tasks! I use it as a master task list. While I don't use it as a daily to do, it's a good organizer and reference of all my tasks. This helps me plan tasks as far as 6-12 months. The ability to make lists and tag tasks helps me to run searches and find things easier. Thank you!

UPDATE 2: Many years ago, their support wasn't great. I am pleased to say that now it is. And the app is still updating and growing. It's great! Any.do has been around for a while and is constantly improving.. It started as a reminder type app with a great missed phone call applet. It has grown to be much, much more and now their support is great.

This app has redefined how I live my life. It has made me much more organized, and I get so much more done! I use it to remind me of daily activities, work projects, house projects, "do sometime" projects, phone calls, bills...everything! I love that you can snooze an activity or easily change the time when it pops up. Also love that you can color code different types of activities. Most used app on my phone!

Love it! After the last 1 1/2 months of trying both Any.do and Microsoft To Do, I have finally settled on my Wunderlist replacement. Any.do is the winner by a landslide. I love the clean look, the ease of use, and the interface with my calendar. But once the search feature was added, that secured Any.do as the clear choice.
replyContent: Glad to hear that you're enjoying the features and that Any.do is helping you stay organized! We hope you will share the app with your friends and family so they can try it out too ;)

content: Adding review comments to my 2016 rating. I have been using this app like forever and this is easily the best task manager! But now they moved recurring tasks to premium which is truly a deal breaker! Please get the recurring taks back to premium! And I am ready to pay a one time fee as well. But this monthly subscription is too much for a task manager!

This app is great but they recently started advertising themselves randomly with a loud video. I do not need any of the extra premium features. I would pay a smaller fee to remove this ad if it was an option, but $80 AUD a year is too much just to remove a single add. Would give 5 stars if not for this issue. It randomly playing a loud video can be extremely frustrating.. Edit. This has since been fixed so I am no longer being spammed by a video everytime I open the app.
replyContent: Thank you for updating your review we appreciate it!

content: I have been looking for this app for a long time! ☺️ I tried the web version first because I was looking for something I can see right away on my desktop that can help me improve my productivity. The features are amazing. It's so clean and easy to understand. Highly recommended! ☺️👀
replyContent: Thank you for 5 stars, we appreciate it! 🥰

content: Pretty versatile app. Plenty of ways to set up things the way you like. Developers seem keen to add useful stuff to it and hesitant to change things that work okay in order to appear like they are 'doing things'. In today's manic 'upgrade' environment, that's a breath of fresh air.👍
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback, we are happy that Any.do is a solution you were looking for! 🥰

content: [3/06/24] Still giving 5 star! The best feature of this app is it has WhatsApp sync! Gonna use it for my daily work! Hope I can be productive more [13/10/22] I'm using anydo since in collage, and this app makes me being productivty better as a worker! The feature is far better then the last time I used it several years ago.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback, we are happy that Any.do is a solution you were looking for! 🥰

content: fantastic task management app that simplifies organization. It combines to-do lists and calendars in a user-friendly interface, allowing me to see my tasks and appointments in one place. With features like recurring tasks and reminders, Any.do ensures I never forget an important thing.
replyContent: Thank you for the stellar review! 🥰

content: I've tried most todo apps on the Play Store and have been using Any.do mainly for a while now. It's very solid and easy to use and has a good app and web experience. Pros: + easy to use + generous free tier Cons: - might take some getting used to do learn all the features
replyContent: Thank you for the 5 stars, we appreciate it! 😊 feel free to check out our Help Center: Support.any.do. Or if you want tips or news about Any.do, take a look at our blog: blog.any.do. If you have any specific questions, you are welcome to contact us at- https://www.any.do/contact_form, and we’d love to help you out.

content: I literally looooove it 😍😍😍. Its very simple , well designed and organized in every tiny detail. It is the best App l have ever seen among all Apps.
replyContent: Glad to hear that Any.do is helping you stay organized 😍

content: I use it all the time to organize everything, from grocery shopping to potential gifts for friends and family. It's so convenient!
replyContent: We 💙 hearing that Any.do is the solution you were looking for to manage all of your to-dos in one app!

content: This app feels very intuitive to use and I love how the user flows are all well connected. I like that every next task that makes sense logically sort of shows up at the end of every completed user flow within the app. It's a smooth user experience. I just downloaded it so I still need to test it out more.
replyContent: We welcome you to learn more about the app and all the features at: https://support.any.do. If you have any questions, please let us know here- https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: UI easy to use, beautiful design, intuitive functioning. LOVE this app. For me, WELL worth the money.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback, we are happy that Any.do is a solution you were looking for! 🥰

content: the menu is odd at first. But not hard. The result was beyond my expectation. Eazy to create a widget (simple to choose size from 1 icon height to 4) The to do's are created with different mindset, let ur self be intuitive. Like posting 4twitter or facebook the prompt box suggests: "I would like to..." you type: "call deb " and boom you are shown choices of contcts to call or email addr. if texting...your widget will display a beatifully noise free legible agenda. Golden ;-]
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback, we are happy that Any.do is a solution you were looking for! 🥰

content: Love the app, one of the most useful apps I have. Had an issue with moments before but it is intuitive and still has the same functionality. Looking forward to testing out the family features as I feel that's the only thing that was missing.
replyContent: Thank you for updating your review we appreciate it.

content: Best task management app on the planet. This app is beating google and Microsoft when it comes to task management (have used their apps). Any other app is not even close to it. I want to see you win. Keep improving 💪, from those smooth animations to the thoughtful UI/UX. You guys are killing it 👏 🙌
replyContent: Thank you for your review, we appreciate it!

content: The app is pretty nice but with premium. It could be better, but when I searched up on Google, it said it was free, and I wasn't expecting any premium or something like that. It will keep on asking me if I want premium. I recommend this app on a phone. Totally recommend not buying the premium. I feel like it's a waste of money. It's gonna be the same, but some extra features. And if you're only looking for a to-do list, you don't need the Premium. Good luck with the ones using this app!
replyContent: You can dismiss the premium ad and use the app for free. To learn more about the paid features see:https://support.any.do/en/articles/8635977-any-do-subscription-plans

content: After last update, there is a glitch. If there are multiple reminders open, above other app or on home screen, snoozing one will close all of them. And then you have manually trace all others which closed without snoozing or any other action. Before update, it was working fine.
replyContent: We are aware of this and fixing it for the next version.

content: I use it for tracking appointments, setting up todo lists, and grocery lists. It's easy to use and integrates with Google calendar.
replyContent: Thank you for the 5 stars, we appreciate it! 😊

content: This is the nice and best way of self organising programme. you will love and enjoy it.
replyContent: Thank you for the 5 stars, we appreciate it! 😊

content: Eye candy to do list without bells and whistles. Workflow based on reminders, as for me, I wish to have a "my day" feature as in Microsoft to do. Best of all I love sync - it really takes seconds to syncronise 'done' tasks even with aliases. Also planning a day is a great feature, but it would be brilliant if it cover some tasks with no due date, or tasks that have been aded for a long time ago and not executed. And after all pricing is the most democratic among same apps.
replyContent: Thank you very much for your feedback and suggestions!  We've forwarded them to our product team for further consideration 🙂

content: I love this app, it looks stunning and clean which personally is important to me, and everything works smoothly as intended- setting reminders for tasks, repetition, notes, etc. One thing I'd like is for "subtasks" to be able to appear on the main task page under the main task, maybe a button to toggle this. If there already is, I'm not sure how to access it. Other than that, I'm excited to use the app to be more organized.
replyContent: Glad to hear that Any.do is helping you stay organized! As per displaying the Subtasks on the lists, we've forwarded this idea to our Product Team, and will be sure to look into adding them, should we see more demand from our users! Hope you will share the app with your friends and family so they can have their productivity boosted as well! ;)

content: I tried over 15 apps and this one is so far the best one I tried, even without the subscription. The design is good, it's super intuitive, not confusing. The options "All tasks" and "Next 7 days" are the "highlight" for me. I'd however improve few things, such as adding a second option for the calendar, which would be a timetable, an overview of the week. My biggest problem with the app is that there is no perpetual sub option, which I'd definitely choose and I'd stick with any. do for good.

I have tried numerous task apps. This one works the best for me. It's intuitive, and it has task and calendar widgets, that are adjustable to your phone's color schemes for your screen to remind you of your schedule and still be pretty. Only thing that could make it even better is if finished tasks would be moved to the bottom of tasks. Now they stay in their old spot, scattered all over the list.

I really like this app!! It does what it says it will do, important dates, appointments, ad-hoc shopping lists, last minute meetings, Any.do handles it!! If like me, your a tad disorganised, then this app will help develop good time management. It does take a little getting used to, but it's not long before you have it the way you want it!! Well, after a long absence Im back to Any.Do!! I dont have a PC, (desk or laptop) nor a Tablet. Just my phone. And Ive taken up the free 7 day trial offer.
replyContent:
Wow Raymond! Sounds you like you are on the track to becoming our number #1 user! Keep up the productivity :)
Thank you for your support!

content: A to do list where you can schedule each task in time with a reminder - or just keep it as a 'someday' - and easily switch in-between. Which is awesome! It has a super-low threshold to create a task, which makes you actually use it. Plus if you don't want to flip through menus to schedule you can just write date & time in plain language! Or speak it, using your Assistant. I know Any.do can do much more than this, but that's what I use it for. Oh, plus, also its intelligent grocery list!
replyContent:
We love hearing that! 😉Thank you for your feedback! We really appreciate the support!
Glad you're finding the Any.do app in use for your daily needs:)

content: Throughout my busy life, I've used a lot of task management apps. This one is absolutely the best: elegant design, intuitive interface and complete feature set even without premium membership. The premium plan is, however, very affordable, and eventhough I personally don't need it, I probably will subscribe to it as a gesture of appreciation to the developer team. Great work!
replyContent: We really appreciate the support! Thanks for the 5 stars! 😄😄😄

content: I am satisfied with the app and the service. I am a free user but I get excellent service from the team when I encountered a bug. I didn't expect to get a reply from the developer but they replied me. (The bug: Sometimes events disappear after saving. Need to remake events several times. After contacting customer support, they told me to clear cache and reinstall it, and it worked flawlessly.) The app works smoothly, the design is simple, easy to use, and light. I like it.
replyContent: We would be happy to help you resolve all of the issues you have encountered should you send us a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report).

content: Very good application. There is a widget that allows you to enter in a new task with natural date and time language and it will properly decode and set the reminder. This makes it very fast to quickly add new tasks. Also the web app that accompanies it is very well made. My only gripe is that long tasks get cut off and you need to select them to read.
replyContent: Thank you for the stellar review and for your feedback, I will make sure to pass it on to our Product team! 😊

content: Update: the issue was fixed. Thank you. Now I have another request. I need an ability to create a list that is reoccurring daily and that I don't want in my "all tasks" tab. So far so good. The only problem I have is that the items from my grocery list keep appearing in my tasks. It's very frasturating when you are planning your day and a task of "cabbage" comes up :) I wish the grocery list items were completely separated from the rest of the tasks.
replyContent: Working on a feature for this as we 'speak' 😉 In the meantime, how about moving those tasks to the Someday category to keep them out of sight? :)

content: Without a doubt the best task organizer among dozens I have tried. Have been using it for years and I can't function without it. Very smooth overall user experience, functional and intuitive. It can be used as a simple to-do-list as well as a more sophisticated organizer. The dev team behind the app seem to be working actively as I notice regular updates and new features. If Google calendar is not your cup of tea, then the next thing to try would be Any.do, before anything else.
replyContent: Thank you for the glowing review! 🥰 We 💙 hearing that Any.do is the solution you were looking for to manage all of your to-dos in one app! Feel free to spread the word to your friends and family so that they can have their productivity boosted as well! 😊

content: So far, really f'ing good. I've tried a whole bunch of different todo apps, I've usually ended up parting ways with them for one reason or another --- but Any.Do is seeming to work with me really well. I love its simplicity, the fact that there's an accompanying web-app, and that you get a fully usable app for free and that you can unlock bonus (really cool) features as the premium. Give it a shot. See if it's worth you. If not, don't settle. Find something that works for you.
replyContent: Thank you so much for the support and we are thrilled that we work so well for you in your life! We ❤️️ you too!

content: It's all good now. Handy dandy When trying to swipe a completed task, it is very difficult to not scroll/move the list. It appears that these 2 actions cause the deletion of the next task on the list instead of the intended one. In a panic I have to scramble to figure out what task I just prematurely deleted!! Arrrgh!! Otherwise it's a pretty darn good app.
replyContent: Thank you for updating your review! 😊

content: The best! I have downloaded tons of to-do-list apps and this is hands down the best in its class. Simple and intuitive UI, easy to use, flexible, powerful and highly customizable while staying simple to use and understand. I tried other apps and I keep going back to Any.do everytime. I still have to find a worthy competitor to this app.

I've been using the free version of this app for a few weeks now and really like it. The design is beautiful and intuitive. My favourite and most useful feature is the anydo moment. Once a day the app lists your to dos and allows you to decide when you will do them. This is great because it allows you to prioritize on the go. Also love how easy it is to see both the to do lists and the calendar. I like this app so much I'm considering using the paid version for extra features.

This app is great! So easy to enter information and at schedules. It links with my calendar and I can set reminders and move tasks around so easily. I love the front end which gives a clear overview of all tasks. Everything is so simple. There's no learning curve either - completely intuitive. Absolutely brilliant! They have thought of everything.
replyContent: Thank you for the review. We love hearing that you're enjoying the features! Please make sure to share the app with your family and friends so that they can get in on the fun as well 😉

content: The best to do app on the market The free version is just perfect, no annoying ads and no missing features. The paid version is just as amazing, super cheap, super fast to use, every action is optimized, and the whole experience is great. I have a really hard time with my daily task and this app is a blessing. Helped me like nothing else. Also it syncs with calendar and computer which is greatly appreciated.
replyContent: Glad to hear that you're enjoying the features and that Any.do is helping you stay organized! We hope you will share the app with your friends and family so they can try it out too ;)

content: Awesome! Long term user. The first feature I loved years ago was how it handled my calls and texts on the fly! Love the app evolution.

Great app. Have been using it for quite a while now. It works well across my Android phone and my browser on my Macbook. I use it for tracking personal and work actions. I find the grocery list really useful. Easy to use and has most grocery items in its database so its very easy to populate. Had an issue with it closing lists by itself. Reached out to Any.do for support and they replied very quickly with the solution which required data clearance and reinstallation. Was worried about loss of data but the reinstall went very smoothly and all data came back from the Any.do server. Great service. Thanks Tali

This app is my spare memory and I love it! It takes so much of my stress by reminding me, keeping track of my tasks...just perfect, easy and quick to use and setup all the things I need To Do. I use this app for her long time, tried few other, in the meantime but back to this one always. Just trying out the desktop version...will see and review that later. Only one little thing...I REALLY HATE when my tasks cut of my ongoing calls. That must change. Otherwise 9 out 10 stars.

IT'S A GREAT APP AND HELPS ME STAY ON COURSE. PLUS, HELP ME AT THE GROCERY STORE REMEMBER EVERYTHING THAT I WANTED. BUT, What I don't understand is it says that, Any.do, is a "FREE" to use app but yet, I'm getting charged $35 Plus for it 😞, WHY?
replyContent: You can use the app for free for as long as you wish if you have a premium or teams plan to unlock advanced features it is a paid plan. Please contact our team and they will be happy to assist you under settings-> support.

content: i've tried a lot of to-do list apps and this one is by far my favourite. The best part is that you can schedule a time for it to prompt you to plan your day and then it goes through all your tasks and allows you to triage and prioritize. Easy to use, and has a great free version. I only upgraded to the paid version because I wanted more flexibility with scheduling recurring tasks. All in all, an excellent app to get your life, business and brain organized.
replyContent: Cheers! We love hearing that you're finding the app useful and that it helps you get things organized 💙

content: I purchased premium almost immediately, as this is exactly what I've been looking for - simple to-do lists. Can repeat tasks, can set reminders, can add subtasks, can colour code, can sync with calendar, can have several lists - or can just ignore all that and use a simple dump-it-all perpetually ongoing to-do list. Love it. Can also use it from desktop on any OS (web interface), and it syncs quickly. There's a light mode with several colours available, and also night mode with a black background. Separately I would like to mention customer service. I was stuck in another country due to the pandemic, and my card got blocked. My bank took its blissful time to reissue and send a new card to me - meanwhile, all my subscriptions and bills bounced. I got a billing issue notification. I replied, explaining my situation, and any.do was very kind to provide a month of premium usage for free. Priority support replies are very prompt. The agent I was in contact with (Tali) is polite and quick. Overall, this app is a keeper. Finally a todo app that I use - because it doesn't annoy me.
replyContent: We 💙 hearing that Any.do is the solution you were looking for! Glad to hear that you're enjoying the features, and that Any.do is helping you stay organized! We hope you will share the app with your friends and family so they can get in on the fun as well 😎

content: This app keeps me productive! I have a tendency to try to tackle too much at once and end up with an overwhelming number of unfinished tasks. Any.do keeps me on task and helps me to prioritize what needs to come first. I love that it reminds me what needs to be done and I can snooze it nice that item to another day if needed. I live to add various lists so I know what my task pertains to. It's just an awesome resource for sure!

Best app for reminders. I have started using it before I started university to help remind me of important things and it has. There were times that if the app would not have reminded me I would have had problems like doctor appointments. I have been available to stay on top of things and stay organised. This reminder app is better than any other that I have tried. I can make lists and I can also put a specific time to remind me of the thing I need a reminder of. Highly recommended you try it!!!
replyContent: We are so happy to hear you are enjoying Any.do and it's reminders :)

content: I have been using this app for 2 years, still my favorite to-do list app from other apps. It has a clean widget I can see on my home screen, also allow me to add a new to-do item straight from the widget without going into the app. I also love that it sync up with my Google Calendar. Moreover, all of these features given are totally FREE! Thank you!

Really great "to do" app. Allows for adding subtasks, notes and files + tags to distinguish among projects / lists. Very easy. Excellent reminders with "one touch" snooze possibilities. Prompts to plan ahead your day a pleasant surprise feature. "Focus on an activity" in order to eliminate distractions, another great surprise feature. Excellent service response. Only annoying, you have to first save task & date and then go back to it to add tags, notes etc. But overall, superb.

Apart from managing my task, what makes this app stand out is the fact that you will never miss a call. It kept reminding you about a miss call and you can decide whether to dismiss or call at your convenient time. An excellent job. Keep it up. in my review,i appreciated the call follow up,but unfortunately this has been removed after the update. am left with only meeting follow up. this is not good enough.
replyContent: Due to changes in the Google Play policy, this feature was removed. If the option ever becomes a possibility again, we will definitely look into re-implementing it. We are sorry for any inconvenience. 😊

content: A great little basic organiser app, nice and simple to use, clear, user friendly and not over complicated, grabs calendar entries from pre-installed phone calendar, doesn't bombard you with notifications, well worth the money. I have just started using some of the more detailed features and am enjoying the simplicity. I've tried other organiser apps that are way too sophisticated for my needs, this app motivates me and I can use it even when I'm in a hurry or half asleep.

I love this app and I cannot think of any flaws it has. I particularly appreciate that I am able to create subtasks and to connect it to Google calendar, and that it is accessible on both my phone and my laptop. Regarding this, the synchronisation between my devices has also worked well until now. I don't use the premium version, but I think the price is quite acceptable.

The best To-do app out there. Good layout, organization system, reminders, intuitive, simple, customizable. Syncs between devices and with Google calendar smoothly. The daily planner and widgets are useful. The free version is more than enough to get going, and the premium features are definitely worth it. Recommended! Any.do has anthing you need in a To-do app, no need to try any other apps. The only thing I would add is a Pomodoro timer or similar time management tool.
Best to do list app, so organized yet pretty And with an AI feature for suggestions is the best
replyContent: We 💙 hearing that Any.do is the right solution for you! Thank you for your support! 😉

content: I've been on Premium plan since '14, have tried other apps for comparison along the way, and I still haven't found any reason to give up my current plan. Any.do provides a lot of useful features w/o overwhelming users. Other apps may have a lot more features, but they're designed in a way that overwhelms new users (making them unusable). Customer support is TOP NOTCH too! I had an accidental billing issue (that was mostly my fault) w/c they immediately reversed upon request... over the holidays!

I find the Any.do app to be a great way to capture any to do lists. I love that I xan run multiple lists, share them, and check them off as I get things done. Gone are the frustrations if lising my list, or my oen while grocery shopping or running errands. It's all conveniently on my phone. I add irems as I think about them. It's easy to repopulate the grocery list which saves typing. This app helps me stay organized and streamlines daily errands and tasks. Thank you for the excellent app.
replyContent: We love to hear that as that is exactly why we created this app! We are so happy that you find the to-do list and grocery list helpful in your daily life! Thank you for your support 😃

content: Downloaded the app to try it, which it wanted a subscription. I removed the app. I started receiving emails for the app that I don't even have anymore and didn't ask for. I unsubscribed in at least 2 or 3 of them. Just received another one about a week or so after the others, sent to junk and blocked the sender. I can't trust them with a simple Unsubscribe button, so why should I trust them with my money or information. Will actively tell people not to use this product now.

What is the point of a "To Do" list without reminders? Nope, you don't get a notification reminder unless you pay for premium, you can't even try it to see if it will work better than Microsoft To-Do (which can't stay running for anything). Without notifications/alarms I can make a "To Do" list using a notebook & pen or the paper calendar I have on my fridge! The whole point of searching for a useful app is to use modern features, like reminders/alarms & custom days, dates, & times.

To start, notifications shouldn't be a premium feature. The main reason I want a to-do list on my phone is so I can get more from it, including reminders. Second, even the free features didn't function as the guide said they would. I tried to add a recurring task for Monday, Wednesday and Friday, as per the instructions, but it wouldn't even do that. Edit2: sent image confirming smart recog is on, but you can't screenshot with the keyboard on and cannot turn keyboard off while setting time.
replyContent:
Hi Anna,
Just to check, is the smart date recognition feature enabled?
"Edit: I tried it numerous ways, incl. "Ev mon, wed, fri", I did not try adding the word "task" in front as that is not a format on YOUR guide."
Can you please send us a screenshot of this and send it to support@todoist.com? Thank you!

content: Latest update has made the app completely useless. Can't open the app, can't refresh the widget, can't access any of my lists. Tried restarting my phone, force stopping the app, reinstalling the app, nothing has worked. Until this, I was a big fan of this app. Everything was very intuitive and easy to create collaborative lists for shared tasks. Having a widget was very convenient as well. Very sad to have to find a new alternative since this no longer works.
replyContent: Hi Emily! We apologize for the inconvenience 🙏 This issue has been resolved. Please update your app from the Google Play Store or reinstall it. If you continue to experience the issue, please contact us at https://todoist.com/contact so we can assist you. Thank you 🙏

content: Why do developers keep changing things for the worse? I have been a paid pro user for close to a decade, and today the title bar popped back up onto my widget, which has not had one for as long as I can remember. So, I go to the settings to remove it (as I have in the past) and the setting is gone. Last week, the app stopped allowing me to say "P1", "P2", etc. for setting the priority on my to-do list items via voice-to-text as I have always done. So frustrating! Time to find a new to-do list...
replyContent: Hi, thanks for sharing your feedback. Our team is looking into the issue regarding the widget opacity, so we'll let you know once that has been resolved. Regarding the priority shortcuts, would you mind sharing some further info about this? Our team is available via https://todoist.com/contact.

content: One of the main sticking points for me is how well an app does recurring tasks. In particular, not just fixed date recurrences, but the ability to set the next date off the last completion date. So many apps fail to offer this. Alas, I could find NO way to do a recurring task at all, in spite of them saying it can be done. So, much less checking on this nuance, I see no way of doing them at all. Fail. Moving on.

do you know a location-based reminders, and the app is reminding me that location is turned off, I don't care I don't want to be reminded, make it stop!! Google rules using calendar appointment, the rules require permission may be denied until an event is requested., I'm not requesting events. I don't have any location based reminders, I don't think I've made any. I just applied today's update and I see no indication looking at the reminders that any one of them is location based.
replyContent:
Dan,

Please contact support@todoist.com and we'll look into it.

content: No easy way to view your completed tasks. Everything else about this app is great, but this one missing feature is a HUGE dealbreaker. For 90% of people, the benefit of a todo list is to see what you have done easily, and get a sense of achievement from it. If they added that feature I'd give it 5 stars, but I find this app unusable without this feature.
replyContent:
Hi Merrill! Thanks for the feedback! To ensure that your request is being properly processed by our team, we recommend submitting a feature request via our contact form here: https://todoist.com/contact?area=feature_request
Thank you 🤗

content: Didn't notice ive used this app before (memory problems) so I tried again... this time the app just kept crashing. The app looks like it might be cool otherwise though so it's sad they seem to have messed up What's the point if reminders is a paid option... I'm not gonna test that feature by paying you.

content: I really wanted to like this app but there is no way to order items on todo lists. I have at this point had to reorder all of my items over 10 times for each because when u use the drag and drop menu to change the order it doesn't save it permanently there is also no way to sort your todo lists by date because I figured if I input a deadline for each item it would show me what I had to do with the one due the soonest at the top but no. I wish there were more ways to sort or at least filter date
