Please submit a ticket here https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. As for sorting, please try this: https://todoist.com/help/articles/how-to-sort-your-tasks. Thank you 🙏

content: I set multiple test reminders to see what kind of notification I'd receive and I haven't gotten a single one. I checked permissions and settings to make sure nothing turned off by default. I set a few at different times for reminders and they all passed by with nothing. No push or emails or anything. I can't exactly recommend using a reminder app that doesn't actually give you reminders.
replyContent: Hi Garret, sorry to hear that! Can you please send us a message at todoist@support.com? We'd love to look into this further! Sorry for the inconvenience is caused.🙏

content: I agree with a previous user that recent updates are making the app worse. I've used this app for several years and loved that my to-do list syncs across devices, but recent changes (specifically, deleting completed tasks instead of leaving them visible/able to be restored, despite modifying settings) make this app basically useless for my purposes. I'm disappointed that I need to find a new app after so long using this one.
replyContent: Hi Amber, this is the new sub-tasks behavior with the Foundations release, sub-tasks will now be removed from the view instead of staying there like before. Apologies for any inconvenience caused to your workflow. Please note that this is quite a popular feedback and our team is currently reviewing/discussing this change.

content: Used to be simple well organized app. Latest update was a major step backwards and makes it unusable and completely unreliable. Do not trust them with your data.... Most of my prior history of completed tasks disappeared. For some reason timed ones seemed to stick around... Completed tasks are now automatically hidden and lose any order you had them in. If you ever care to reference completed tasks in any structure this app is not for you. It's a hot mess now for that. And their backups do not include completed tasks. They claim all your information is backed up securely but when I asked for my completed tasks they were not able to provide my attachments.

Just tried to use it. It showed some buttons during set up, including how to use Todoist. Turned it on, clicked on the sentence, finally continued on. I searched around, but never found help using the app. This might be a great app for people that know how to use it or are seasoned enough in apps to figure it out, but wherever the guidance is for those that don't know, it's buried too deeply to be any help. I was unable to do anything useful and, instead, a big waste of a chunk of my morning!
replyContent:
Hi Davis! Sorry to hear that you're having trouble getting started with Todoist. Here are some steps to help you get started: https://todoist.com/help/articles/get-started-with-todoist-OgNNJR
If you have any questions, please feel free to get in touch with us via https://todoist.com/contact. 🤗

content: Downloaded the app so I could have a widget with my list on my home screen. shortly thereafter, tney added checkboxes, which can't be turned off, making it easy to accidentally "complete" a task on the widget. And unlike when you have the app open, this can't be undone. It was good when I downloaded it, but is now completely useless.
replyContent: Hello, thanks for the feedback and sorry to hear that. We are planning to add the "Undo" option to the widget in the future updates.

content: Was really good, but after the last update, it's auto fill makes weird duplicates of whatever I'm typing. November 4th auto fills to November 44th. A cost reminder in the description goes from 80.90 to 80.908090. It is annoying to unuseable depending on task. I am guessing this happens because their auto correct is fighting with my phones(Samsung) built in auto correct but no idea.
replyContent: Hi Adam! Please disregard the previous response, as it was sent by mistake. Regarding the auto-fill issue, we suggest a temporary workaround while we develop a solution: you can either install Gboard or turn off predictive text. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. 🙏

content: I'm doing what I decry - leaving a bad review even though I didn't try the product. I just want to say I don't mind paying for an app if it's worth it. Developers should get paid for good work. This one, however, requires a subscription. I had to install it and create an account before I could find out the upgrade cost. The cost isn't terrible for a good app, but I'm not buying another subscription for for another thing. I'm really getting tired of everything requiring subscriptions.

I used the app for about 3 days before realizing it wasn't a good fit for me. I wanted to use the widget more than the app itself, but I was frustrated with the way recurring events and subtasks work. I even checked reddit and online for a solution, but without success. Instead of listing subtasks as same priority as the parent task during scheduling, I wanted things to remain nested and recurring. After attempting to make things work, I gave up and tried TickTick instead, which has been better!

Worthless app. Have been using the premium version for 6 months now, and much preferred the previous free version from over a year ago that had the auto reschedule function in case you actually try to intentionally write down more than you can accomplish in a day to make sure things don't fall through the crack. Wish I had known thay feature was removed before purchasing, but without it, it's actually more work than just writing it as a simple checklist.
replyContent: Hello, thank you for the feedback. Just to check, is this about the "Reschedule" option for your overdue tasks? Could you contact our support team so we can clarify this issue?

content: I didn't even get to use this app because "reminders are a premium feature". Anything to exploit money out of people. Basic functions of a planner shouldn't be a "premium paid feature". You want fancy backgrounds or other personalization? Charge for it. Special notification sounds? Charge for it. But a simple reminder (the whole point of a freaking planner) should be free.

The app is too complicated and has too many features that are not intuitive or user-friendly,too expensive and requires a premium subscription to access most features1too buggy and has sync issues, data loss, crashes, and glitches,The app is too restrictive and does not allow users to customize their tasks, projects, or labelsThe app is too slow and consumes a lot of battery and memory
replyContent: Hi Yusuf! We are sorry to hear this 😞 We would like to have a deeper look into those issues. If you have a minute, [please send us a message at https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Sorry for the inconvenience caused 🙏

content: I've tried a dozen+ task list apps in the last few days (and many before that), looking for certain features. I don't know if this has them because it requires an account just to try it (no "skip login" option). Nowhere did I see the creators/reviews say an account is required even for starting/basic use. One star: non-web, non-collab, non-premium features should be accessible without account. Then I finally read 1- star reviews, now glad I didn't sign up: apparently the spam emails never cease.

Poor theming and dynamic color implementation spoils an otherwise promising task management app. Biggest offender is the widgets, which use colors differently than other dynamic color widgets and most frustratingly of all don't sync their dark and light mode automatically with the system setting, despite the main app doing so. Frustrating to have a single widget be blindly white at night when everything else on my home screen has changed to dark mode theme.
replyContent: Hello Brad! We are sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: Needed a good list for Wear OS use only (no phone), and this was almost perfect --- except there's no confirmation when marking a list item complete, so it's really easy to accidentally remove an item unintentionally, and it's impossible to undo a completion from the watch interface. So close, and yet so far.
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback!

content: Tried to give this app a chance several times over the years, paid for subscription. Never ended up staying with it. Latest attempt to use (Sep 2023) is also unsuccessful. Was adding tasks for an hour to find out it lost labels for one part of the tasks, duration for another part of the tasks, time for 3rd part of the tasks. Everything is screwed up just with a couple of dozens of tasks. Don't see how to trust it further. Cancelling subscription now.
replyContent: Hi Elena! We are sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: NOT SAFE FOR BUSINESS: Hits maximum of 20 sections per project, even if some are deleted. When hit, nothing stops you from wasting hours of work that will ultimately disappear when you close the app because it's attached to an unsaved heading. This cost me money using it as a tool for brainstorming with a client. Todoist responded to this review before responding to my ticket (#680407). It's been over 2 weeks and there's been no news. Technical & customer support nightmare. There are better apps
replyContent: Thanks, Nathan! This ticket is closed but we have created a new ticket to follow up on this issue with you. We sincerely appreciate your patience and are sorry for the inconvenience 🙏

content: DO NOT BUY the premium if you need Alexa and/or Outlook to integrate like they falsely claim this ap does or you need any support from Todoist. Outlook integration has never been a synced integration, it only forwards tasks one-way & only works with limited Outlook paid platforms. They have Alexa issue notice seen only when you try to set it up, no warning before buying believing you can integrate both. No Support response yet. I want my money back. Such waste of hours. I feel scammed
replyContent: Pamela, sorry to hear that :( Our Outlook plugin works on Windows, but we're planning to develop a new one which will also work on macOS. We're also working with Amazon on a new Alexa integration based on their new API. You will definitely receive a response from support to every question.

content: If you sign up for this app, understand you will received excessive emails, without the ability to actually unsubscribe. I have tried REPEATEDLY, yet still receive emails weekly or more. I just tried again, marked no to everything, only to receive a "tips and tricks" email literally one minute later. I will never reconsider using this app after this bs.
replyContent: Hi Marion! We are sorry to hear that. You should be able to unsubscribe the emails from the Reminders and Notifications tab in Settings. If the issue persists, please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can look into it. Thank you 🙏

content: Tried it again. "Reminders are only available with a Pro subscription." Yeah, I don't think so. Someone is giving this developer some really bad advice. Software is not a service. I'm not paying a SUBSCRIPTION FEE for basic functionality that should be included in the base software. If you feel the need to make money from your app (and you should), then a ONE TIME fee of reasonable amount is fine. I'm not subscribing to something you can stop developing at any time while still billing me.

I've heard such good things and I was so excited to try this app... but it just keeps crashing. My phone tells me it has a bug. Now I'm just disappointed. Original review in Feb 2023 Update Oct 2023: Still can't use it. Anytime I try to add a task it just closes. It gives me a warning that the app is buggy and to update and try again once the developer fixes the bugs. Clearly the bugs the developer supposedly worked out are still there. I did get a little farther, at least I got the app to open
replyContent: Hello Lisa! We are very sorry to hear this. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: AVOID! Constant email spam and the developers made sure deleting your account is nigh impossible. I was trying to create a password for my account on their site and it said my password may have been exposed to a security breach... my password that doesn't exist. The app keeps giving me errors when I try to set up a password... still working on it. AVOID THIS PLAUGE!
replyContent: Franz, thanks for your review. The error that you're running into sounds like an additional security check we do via HIBP (https://haveibeenpwned.com/) - if your password or email address is listed on this site, it cannot be used to log into Todoist. Please contact us: todoist.com/contact.

content: I am extremeky disappointed with this app.  I lost a lot of information with the last upgrade.  Now, i am wasting time constantly updating this app.  I am currently looking at other applications.  If your improvements risk functionality,  it is not worth it.  It makes me believe that your designers and programmers do not actually use the app. I use the app for health issues like medicine times.  Could have been very detrimental.
replyContent:
We are sorry to hear this :( Were you able to restore your backup files?
Please also contact our team to further investigate this issue - https://todoist.com/contact

content: It's been three months and the app still stops syncing periodically. It just hangs, as does the widget. The only way to recover is to delete the app's local data. And their support email address listed in the Play Store is still the same one that they don't actually support. I think it's time to finally give up :(
replyContent: Hello Sean! We are sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: The last update won't let me sync to my Alexa lists. So this app is now useless for me and my spouse. Also, after I complete a task, the completed notification pops up on the bottom of the list covering up the next task. And is there a way to stop the share pop up. Nobody cares that I completed five tasks.
replyContent:
Unfortunately, Amazon Alexa for Todoist is no longer supported. This decision was made by Amazon and is beyond our control. More information can be found here: https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/custom-skills/access-the-alexa-shopping-and-to-do-lists.html
To dismiss the pop-up, you can swipe left or right.

content: I used this app for many years and it worked for my purposes at the time. However, sometime at the beginning of this year it began dropping the due dates on the tasks that were overdue And this was a huge problem for me. I tried to work with the developers to recover this data for months and they couldn't do it and in fact, to add insult to injury, they dropped the due dates on another month of my past due tasks without warning or explanation. This app is definitely not built for record keeping.
replyContent: Hi Pat, we're truly sorry to hear about this! One of our colleagues is still in touch with you to help resolve the issue. We kindly ask if you could provide more details at your earliest convenience, so we can better understand and address the problem. Thank you for your patience and cooperation.

content: Used to use this app religiously, but I'm moving onto another option. The developers have continued to gut the free version while hiking the price of the paid, and now they think a to-do app should cost more than streaming subscriptions. If it wasn't so insulting as a long time user I'd laugh, but the app won't remind me to do that anymore.
reordering is completely broken in project section when set to board view. I've set the order to be manual (default) yet it randomly keeps moving tasks up and down without any pattern or order.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear about the inconvenience you're experiencing. We'd love to help resolve this issue! Could you please reach out to us via https://todoist.com/contact so we can investigate further?

content: interrupted me while I was concentrating on something . I've blocked pop-ups, so why is this intrusion blocking the middle of my screen. moreover the narrative e that came with the popup was completely ambiguous and meaningless. in fact, I don't know if I'm rating Google Playstore of ToDoist, but both are guilty of intrusion.
replyContent: Hi Jane! We are sorry to hear that the rating pop-up is interrupting you. Do you continue to receive the pop-up even after dismissing it? If so, we will investigate this issue further. Please contact us via https://todoist.com/contact. Thank you 🙏

content: STAY WELL AWAY if you want a reliable and safe system! I'm a Pro user for many years, more than 25 thousand completed tasks. The developers keep re-introducing bugs to the core system that were fixed before. They clearly do not automate testing. I constantly supply support tickets for bugs. Items jump around, or are mystically linked where completing one completes another too! Getting tired of being a paying beta tester. It used to be good but has gone down hill fast!
replyContent: Hi Tomas! We are very sorry to hear about your experience. Could you please let us know the support ticket number so we coulc look into it? We apologize for the inconvenience caused 🙏

content: "Todoist is beautifully designed, simple to get started and intuitive to use" Err, am I using the same app? I sign in using Google and the phone app has a large refresh icon in the middle of the screen that does absolutely nothing. Top right says "open on smartwatch" so I do that. On the watch I try and add some tasks and nothing seems to stick or they get dumped into the ether. Nothing I add stays. I reset phone and smartwatch and more of the same. Uninstalling. Utter rubbish.
replyContent: Hi Pete! We are sorry to hear that. Could you check if you're using the latest version of the app? Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can investigate further. Sorry for the inconvenience 🙏

content: Very glitchy, practically useless. The app will automatically duplicate tasks and then I can't add subtasks. Looking for an alternative.
replyContent: Hi John. We're truly sorry to hear that! Please contact us (todoist.com/contact) so we can look into this for you 🤗

content: Today I have installed the app and facing the issue when trying to save project as template. I am receiving the error "add a task or section before saving it as a template" even though project contains multiple sections and tasks 🤨🧐
replyContent: We're sorry to hear about the inconvenience you're experiencing. We'd love to help resolve this issue! Could you please reach out to us via https://todoist.com/contact so we can investigate further?

content: You guys put reminders behind a pay wall. I can get more value out of a spread sheet. The visual changes make the app more difficult to navigate. I definitely liked the old Todoist from a couple years ago much better than what it's become. This app has changed for the worst.
There every day or every second day an update for the Pixel Watch version. This is getting too much. Less is sometimes more.
replyContent: Thanks for taking the time to share your feedback! To help us shape the future of Todoist, we'd love to invite you to fill out our feedback survey over at https://doist.typeform.com/to/MXJ7DaK 🙌

content: I've not figured this app out. I don't understand how it works. I just wish I could enter in somewhere a list of goals that I want to obtain and a list of things I need to do then just have them shown in a schedule for the week so I could go over them and approve it and then move on. Maybe a bit more complex than that, but definitely simpler than what is in this app. I have yet to be able to schedule anything! I even paid the extra $5 for premium to see if that would help. but no.
replyContent: Hi Shannon! We are sorry to hear this. We can guide you through the features you're interested in, please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact. You can also try our getting started guide: https://todoist.com/help/articles/get-started-with-todoist-OgNNJR

content: When scheduling repeat events and task is a headache. I really liked it, but I find myself using the help menu more frequently to schedule re occurring events. This has been time-consuming for me. Also, when I am initially inputting a new event or task I don't want to note it in the description section and I don't have the option to put all of the details in the notes section unless I close it out and reopen the task. Sadly, I'll be converting to another task manager
replyContent: Hello! Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us. We'd appreciate it if you could submit it through https://todoist.com/contact under the "Product Feedback" category. This will ensure that our product team can properly process your suggestions. We truly value your time and insights in helping us improve our product!

content: Forces you to set a password to delete your account lmao gtf off my phone. Edit: Nonsense, it adds no security at all, it is just a roadblock to discourage people from deleting accounts.
replyContent: Hi Maks, requiring a password to delete an account is a security measure to confirm that the person attempting to delete the account is the legitimate owner. This also helps protect against accidental deletions and unauthorized access. Thank you for using Todoist.

content: This used to be my favorite todo app but it was butchered to death with one pointless feature or redesign after another, making it totally unreliable as a tool for high productivity people.
replyContent: Hello! We are sorry to hear this. If you have a minute, please share more details with us. Your use case and feedback can help us improve in the future: https://todoist.com/contact. Thank you 🙏

content: I used this app once. It was not the best but quite normal. I installed it again now. The interface is absolutely unintuitive and inconvenient. It is impossible to use the app.
replyContent: Hello! We are sorry to hear this. If you have a minute, please share your use case with us so we can review it for future improvements: https://todoist.com/contact. Thank you 🙏

content: Not modern enough. year 2024 and yet todoist developers can't figure out how to sync widget theme with device dark theme. what a lazy approach for basic interface reference design requirements. some developers do need Google start punishing for lack of care the same Apple does. Apps not compliant with basic guidelines shall be taken off the store. I have been paid user for years. Yet the app feels even more cheap now wirh such a lack of touch. and yes, Microsoft ToDo is a free alternative now
replyContent: Hi Dmitriy, have you tried the "Dark Dynamic Color" theme which adjusts with the device theme? If this feature is not what you're looking for, please send us your request via https://todoist.com/contact → Product feedback. Thank you 🙏

content: The interface is so difficult to get used to, the notifications are overbearing, and they automatically subscribe you to emails constantly bombarding you without your consent first.
replyContent: Hello Frank! We are sorry to hear that. You can unsubscribe all notifications from the settings. How's how: https://todoist.com/help/articles/introduction-to-reminders-9PezfU

content: I deleted the app and disconnected the app from my Google account. why am I still getting daily email from this company?
replyContent: Hey Mark! Deleting the app alone will not delete your Todoist account. Kindly contact us and we'll be happy to advise 👍🏽

content: At first it looks good, nice UI, great UX. But when you start syncing between devices...everything falls apart. (It is not individual problem, check other 1-2* reviews.) Adding tasks on one device works no more: after adding, it disappears in a second. On the other device it appears somehow but also starts multiplying at the same time. Totally confusing and unreliable. Since it is a core feature for multi device usage, now it is unusable at all. Please revise the sync feature, it could be 5*.
replyContent: Hi Greg! We are sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Sorry for the inconvenience 🙏

content: The popups you've started to do when X amount of tasks are completed just get in the way. Especially on the app, it takes up most of the screen and has to be navigated away from. It may work in some scenarios but not all, give me an option to turn it off please. I don't want to be congratulated for achieving my 5th task of the day, especially when all I've done is tick off "bananas" from a shopping list, I just want to see what's next.
replyContent: Hi Chris! Thanks for your feedback! Our team is considering adding a toggle for this feature in the future. In the meantime, as a workaround, you can change the daily goal to 0 zero. Sorry for the inconvenience 🙏

content: Disappointing experience. I used Todoist from July 2016 until a few days ago. I supported the developer with a paid subscription even if I've hardly used its extra features. On the 3rd of August, during a routine update, all the keyboard shortcuts were broken. I logged an incident to make sure they were aware of the issue (#385170). Asked a couple of times an ETA for the resolution of the issue; instead, they used me as a beta tester. After 3 weeks, not only was the problem unresolved but they also didn't give me an ETA for its resolution. At this point in time, I have had enough so I decided to withdraw my support by cancelling my paid subscription. They cancelled my subscription but rejected my request of partial refund. It's about 3 months so ... less than 8 USD. I consider this very bad customer service ... but there is more: I'm still waiting for a reply after 10 days. You can make up your own mind.
replyContent: Dante, sorry to hear that :( We will definitely fix any reported bug, some issues can be fixed very easily and quickly, others may unfortunately require more time to reproduce, identify and address, but they won't remain unfixed.

content: Not intuitive! Am usually fine without a "How to" but this app is just to complicated for me. I prefer To Do from microsoft as it's simple enough but does the job. There are no ways to make recurring tasks with reminders (Birthdays?!) and only 5 folders are allowed in standard which is useless. I refuse to pay monthly for a simple app like this. Maybe 20.- for lifetime. When you first start out there are a million notification mails and tasks set up by the app that you have to delete manually.
replyContent: Hello! We are sorry to hear that. Thanks for sharing your feedback with us. To set a recurring task, you can simply type the recurring due date along with your task name. For example, "Lunch ev 12pm". Here's more information: https://todoist.com/help/articles/set-a-recurring-due-date

content: Just downloaded the app because I wanted to have a checkbox for a daily task that I do (and perhaps add more going forwards). But that was not an option and I had to Google my way to it, because the app I packed with pseudo-smart features, distracting suggestions (such as answering quizzes och look through some inspiration) etc. injected directly into your daily schedule. It's way too bloated with functions that I believe no one really asked for, which drowns its most basic functions.
replyContent: Hello! Thank you so much for sharing your honest feedback with us. It has been noted 🙏 If you would like to share more feedback, we can be reached via https://todoist.com/contact. Thank you so much!

content: TD;DR You have to register. You get blasted with emails. Free version is as good as free native app. It's not clear what features you get if you spend money. It's disappointing. Most features are behind a pay wall (which is fine) - I'd be more than happy to pay if I understood what those features are and having used the app, I still don't know. Also you HAVE to register with them and as soon as you do you get blasted with emails, which is by far the most annoying thing this app does.
replyContent:
Hi Dale, sorry to hear this :( Please check your email settings in the Settings > General > Emails.
You can also try the free trial (30 days) at www.todoist.com/premium :)

content: I had given this app a 5 star before, but this new update has ruined the experience for me. The most important thing is my tasks are literally disappearing! New subtasks refuse to stay put and I just lost a whole task with a bunch of subtasks that was an important thing I was working on 😡 Just disappeared after I rescheduled unrelated tasks. I am also not a huge fan of the visual changes, but one can learn to deal with that. Been using the app for years, and this is quite a mess.
replyContent: Hello! We are sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: The app can't do what it's supposed to do. I have multiple projects and this should be the right app for it. However, when I have shared projects the people I share them with don't see the projects. If this could be resolved I would change my rating.
replyContent: Hi Jeffrey! We are sorry to hear about your experience. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: Horrible experince. Glitchy and slow with no user friendly interface. Waste of time to download check it out and uninstall after 10 minutes. On top of that the most important features are paid. But wait... its a subscription to pay £4 monthly!! For a todo app which can't do something better than the hundreds free or those with one time payments. Cannot recommend to anyone.
There's a bug in the quick add UI (from the android notification panel shortcut) which makes it so that I can add a task. Super annoying.
replyContent: Hi David, unfortunately, we could not reproduce this issue. Which version are you using? Does this happen when adding a task to a specific project? Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can investigate. Thank you!

content: Logs me out randomly, and password input doesn't work with my password manager. Pretty useless when you want to jot down a quick to do item.
replyContent: Hi Ben! We are sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: Lazy tech support. Just can't be bothered. Took down my initial adverse review to give tech support a chance to sort things out. They just couldn't be bothered. I'm using Nine email and having a problem sharing with Todoist when I want to create a task using an email. Sometimes it works, more often it doesn't. However sharing with Wunderlist works every time! Todoist tech support answer: sort it out yourself with Nine! UPDATE. After numerous emails to tech support they still haven't bothered.
replyContent: Pete, sorry to hear that, we will try to look into this issue again to double-check if it's an issue on Nine's end.

content: Subscription based. £50 a year. For a todo list app. No. Imagine you put 10 or 20 similarly priced apps on your phone, you're losing £500 to £1000 per year, the price of a flagship phone! Every year! I'd have paid between £5 and £10 max for this app for the pro features. I'll look elsewhere, I'm not going to encourage this greed.

Update ruined it It was great before , it's one of those apps you use but forget exist because it's just so good at what it does ( like the clock app) . But the most recent update has made it glichy and unusable. Every interaction I make with the app , may it be adding a task or postponing it , it makes the app get stuck in a refreshing loop till you close it. I'm keeping the app on my phone because I genuinely just love the app ,my issue is with the bug I'm experiencing.
replyContent: Hi Ethan, we'd love to help you out with this. Please contact our Support team for dedicated assistance: https://todoist.com/contact

content: I got Todoist as I was hoping I would be able to get reminders and mark task completion on my Galaxy Watch 4. Unfortunately it did not work and I only received notifications on phone (I did checked battery omtimization settings on watch). As Todoist has no free trial, I had to purchase a monthly subscription just to try it out. It is non-refundable, a complete waste of money.
replyContent: Hello! We are sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: Really unimpressed that I cannot get notifications unless I subscribe to premium. I can set up memos on my Google calendar & be reminded for free. Why would I pay for that with an app? Without notifications I'll have to remember to check what needs done, where I'm at, etc. I also found it difficult to figure out how to navigate & use what little was included in the free version. Gave up in frustration when I realized that to be actually useful I'd have to pay extra.

"Unfortunately, something went wrong"... Can't setup any INTEGRATION. Todoist team, when you are developing anything please do not forget the TESTING PHASE!!! Don't send things to production without testing!!!
replyContent: Hello! We are sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Which integration are you trying to set up? Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: Subscription is to expensive for supported features. It is not easy to oversee all the things gooing on. I could not create "subsections" in my personal routines section to keep things stuffed. Also it is not possible to mark something as "not done". Especially for reoccuring routines this would make perfectly sence. Another rather bad thing is, that it is not easy to analyze progress or precission. Especially for routines a statistical analysis would be good. Also a visualization for due dates.
replyContent: Hello Marci! Thanks for your feedback. We would like to know more about your workflow and how we can improve the visualization for due dates. Please submit this via https://todoist.com/contact > Product feedback, so our product team can process them. We really appreciate your time and thoughts on improving our product!

content: Is setting reminders and labels really worth being a premium feature? In my opinion the app is literally useless without them. If it was a $5 one time purchase then maybe it would be fair, but $48 per year is ridiculous. All of the premium features are easy to emulate with apps that came with my phone. I hate how even the simple apps have to be subscription based nowadays, even for something as simple as a bloody to do list.

I am writing to express my concern regarding a recent issue with my appointment scheduling. All of my past appointments have been rescheduled to future dates, resulting in a significant number of appointments scheduled for tomorrow. This has caused a major disruption to my schedule and has the potential to result in financial losses, as I may not be able to locate the necessary information to complete my estimates.
replyContent: Hi John! We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. We apologize for the inconvenience 🙏

content: I just installed the app and ran it to see how I liked it. For my taste, way too crowded UI. Then, I started receiving email notifications at least once a day about a task it automatically creates for the user, which is to add a task. I was annoyed so I uninstalled it. The email notifications continued. I had to manually unsubscribe from receiving email notifications about a task I never created from an app I am not using. Unjustifiable behavior!
replyContent: Hi Jelena, we are sorry for the trouble :( If you need further assistance, please contact us at support@todoist.com.

content: Too greedy on the premium features. I'm not going to pay monthly for the ability to add a description/comment to my task. Without this, you have a one liner for the task. There are tons of alternatives that do the same things as this app. I tried this one, the premium features don't interest me and the rest isn't worth a subscription.
I can understand supporting the development of the app with paywalled features, but basic features like time based reminders behind a paywall is renders the app useless even for trial.

Via Google assistant, not good. I get the feeling from the current reviews that people are using the app and not Google Assistant. My first experience via Google Assistant has been horrible to say the least. The voice assistant in this app he's badly programmed and kept on misunderstanding what I was trying to do as simple as create a task, complete a task, read task list. It was very difficult to know when to talk as the voice just kept continuing so one had to wait until it completes.
replyContent: Hi Leon, sorry to hear this! Could you please submit more details at support@todoist.com? We are currently working on improving the feature :)

content: Looking at the features and lots of accolades I tried uninstalled after just a trial. Reason: In the free version notification feature is missing. If the task misses the set time, there is no notification. We will come to know only if we open the app. Insanely Ridiculous. Not sure what have the product team thought while excluding such a basic feature.

I am colour blind and dyslexic. Not able to read anything. I can't zoom in and I need to pay in order to see the colours better. [update] As I said, I would have to pay the app in order to have the right fonts and colour so I can actually read and make use with it. I've tried WeNote, and it's the app I need, without having to pay premium.
replyContent: Hi Jess, this has been noted. Thank you for sharing!

content: Desktop version is not native software. I think it runs on electron. No desktop widget features. So no chance to see if reminders works perfectly before subscription. Anyways since it lacks so many feature I uninstalled it.

Started using this app and loved it. I was thinking about buying the full version but... All of sudden it won't add tasks, they just don't appear and can't do anything, delete, move, nothing! The only way to fix it is to restart my phone. I'm trying to put together a new to-do list and have already restarted my phone 5 times, I give up!

content: Money-grubbing app that charges "premium price" for features that other apps offer for free. I don't see a single feature that would justify spending 4 bucks a month on it. Hello, 

Sorry to hear that. Please send us a message at support@todoist.com so we can assist you with your account deactivation. Regarding the refund, it's not automatically made upon account's deactivation, please reach out to us with your Todoist email address and the refund request so we can take a look into it for you.

content: Was pleasantly surprised with nice UI and ability to add and organize tasks. Got everything moved over from G Tasks and set to use Todoist. That was until I was waiting for a reminder to notify me a task is due. A notification of a task due is an integral part of task management. Unfortunately you must purchase the premium version for this to work, which in my opinion makes this app completely unusable.

Here is the promised review. Hello developer. This very day, I subscribed to this app in order to receive notifications about to do items. I received an email reminder but was lead to believe I would receive notifications, which I did not. Owing to this, I have cancelled my subscription this same day. I am disgusted, and I suggest that other users of this app refrain from making a subscription, instead utilising the free option. That is £48 I will not see again.
replyContent: Hello Iblim! We apologize for the inconvenience. You should be able to receive reminder notifications via email, mobile, or desktop. If you cancel your subscription within the same day and request a refund, we can process the payment return. Please reach out to us through https://todoist.com/contact so that we can assist you further. Thank you 🙏.

content: Very annoying app. Frequently pops annoying notices about made-up goals and badges while I'm trying to get actual work done. I'm not joking. I was trying to get things done and it pops up an award or badge for getting 5 things done and then tells me that it was 5 more than yesterday. In what world do I care about their stupid goals for me??? I have to waste my time reading the messages in case they are actually important.
replyContent: Hi, thanks for sharing your feedback! The setting you're referring to is actually customizable. Just head to Settings >> Productivity and toggle off the "Goal celebrations" 😉 You can read more about Productivity settings in this guide https://todoist.com/help/articles/introduction-to-karma-OgWkWy.

content: I once rated this app and company a five star. However long, with their recent updates they have utterly failed to test the user experience. All the alerts.settings are changed so you get texts, notifications and emails when you had turn them off. The suggested time zone change so their app "will.function correctly" breaks the assigned due date times. I like to see companies trying to improve, but if they are this lazy with the user experience who lazy are they with customer data. Lost of all trust here.
replyContent: Rob, sorry to hear that. You can enable or disable all alerts anytime, we've improved it recently so you no longer have to manually remove/change every reminder in every task, but can select your preferred reminder method in the settings and it'll apply to all tasks. Reg. time zone, please make sure all your devices also use the same zone.

content: Since the latest update, the widget I use to check Today's tasks does not update the tasks from one day to another. content: Way too complicated! I am uninstalling it. I will continue to send myself WhatsApp messages with a list of what I need to do on the following day: that is so much easier! Minimal features to force premium purchase. This app advertises itself as a an alternative to Microsoft for people forced to migrate from Wunderlists. Wunderlists was an excellent, fully featured list app with reminders, repeatable tasks, folders to group similar lists, and the ability to share any list with anyone via email or the Wunderlist app. Todoist allowed import from Wunderlist and mostly supported these features until summer 2020 update made every useful feature ONLY be in premium.

Not a good first impression. Too easy to press a wrong fuction (e.g. check boxes) thinking it initiates a section when it clears the section instead (confetti streams down and section dissapears). No way to undelete. Also, when selecting any "help" or "contact" info, screen clears and shows, "Application error: a client-side exception has occurred (see the browser console for more information)."

Unfortunately, Amazon Alexa for Todoist is no longer supported. This decision was made by Amazon and is beyond our control. More information can be found here: https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/custom-skills/access-the-alexa-shopping-and-to-do-lists.html
To dismiss the pop-up, you can swipe left or right.
