content: Edit-2023. Not sure why the devs decided to remove the ability to arrange the project list with a press and hold, then drag and replace it with a several step process of scrolling and pressing buttons, but I will not be using the app any more because of this. It's been this way for many months now. 2017 -Great app with premium subscription. There are some inconsistencies between app and web interfaces that are bogus but can be overcome with filters. I think filters are what make this app for me.
replyContent: Hi Casey, sorry to hear that this change affected your workflow significantly. I will share your request with our team, so we can take it into consideration for future improvements 😊

content: I would rate this app 5 stars except I hate the way it scrambles all your tasks every time you change time zones. It's absolutely maddening if you have a lot of tasks because you'll be forced to re-priotitize every time. Going coast to coast with a layover and you'll be doing it three times. Ugh. [Update] Constantly crashing on my Galaxy Note 9 now. Like 20+ times a day.
replyContent: James, please contact support@todoist.com with more details about these issues. In general, whenever you change the time zone, the app should ask you if you want to adjust it and you should select "Yes". If your device is also set to the correct new zone, all your tasks' dates and times should remain correct.

content: I downloaded this app because it's one that syncs with our smart speaker. However, I have recurring tasks, some of which are daily and that option does not work at all. It works are far as setting them up goes. Once I mark a task as done it skips the next due date. So my daily tasks are only showing up every other day. Not happy with that at all. I am in the process of finding another app ASAP!
replyContent: Hello, could you please tell us more about this specific recurring task at support@todoist.com?

content: I used this app for years and loved it. But recently they seem to have removed a feature that has eliminated a great deal of its function: the ability to set customized recurring reminders. This is a huge problem and has made it only half-usable. After years of being in the top percent of their users (something they also got rid of, their annual tracking), I am going to have to find a new app. It's a real shame, because I've been a premium user for so long and always really liked Todoist.
replyContent: Hi Shewow! We are sorry to hear this. If you’d like to add a recurring reminder, you can try the new reminder shortcuts. For example: Type "!ev tue 8pm" for recurring reminders. You can find all supported formats in this article: https://todoist.com/help/articles/introduction-to-reminders#use-shortcuts-to-create-reminders

content: Functions fine in general, easy drag to subtasks. Can't adjust the Notifications to not go through "Do not disturb" mode (bad if you work off shifts), can't set timing of notifications. In a productivity app, scheduling is important. Reminders require premium, seriously? I'll just install one of the tons of free apps that include it for free rather than pay $3 month. Overall: Average functioning app that requires paid premium for some basic functions.

This used to be the best app; I basically ran my life off it. Over the last couple of months, it has been crashing and saying there is a bug. I reached out to support, and after 3 weeks, they have yet to respond. Without being able to open the app, it is (obviously) unusable. Dear Todoist: Please respond to my 2 support emails. That would be dope. UPDATE: To whomever responded to this review, I have yet to be issued a support ticket number. I have sent a third email this morning. Cheers!
replyContent: Hello Anthony, thank you for your response. You should receive an email with a ticket number immediately after submitting a ticket. We suspect that the email address you are using might be incorrect. Could you please try submitting a ticket through https://todoist.com/contact?

content: Todoist has some useful features, one of the most useful is task reminders (although this is only fully available in "pro"). However, a simple feature would be to check off tasks completed yesterday, but every day, daily tasks reset at midnight and there is no going back. Simple feature, I know other apps that have it, and I've seen comments online of people begging for this feature for years. So the most useful thing I get out of the app is paid for, and the rest leaves much to be desired. 🙃
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback, Case! We appreciate it :)

content: Seems like a good tool, but almost nothing that I actually need to do with it is possible without a subscription. I'd happily puchase the app, or do a free trial period, but honestly, it annoys me when companies offer a free download only to put everything useful behind a paywall, especially when they try to give a discount for a year's sub before you even really get to try the features. Nope.

Cannot use because of the 299 entry limit. My most important list was split into 7 lists. The first list segment is full, so I cannot add a new entry to the top of it. I copied my lists from Wunderlist, and several lists got split like that. If it had copied starting at the bottom of the list so the first segment was the one not full, I might have been able to make it work.
replyContent: Sorry to hear that. Please note that you can have 300 projects each with 300 tasks for a total of 90 000 tasks - a limit you'll most likely never reach. Therefore, if you're only reaching the "tasks per project" limit, you can split those big projects into sub-projects, as described here: https://get.todoist.help/hc/en-us/articles/115001862065

content: It seems like the developer is paying attention to customers, which is a good thing. Hopefully they'll respond to the overwhelmingly critical reviews of the most recent update. The checkboxes simply make it too easy to accidentally mark a task as complete. This is a bad, bad deal. I use Todoist to help me more efficiently run my businesses. If I errantly check off a task, it could cost me a lot of money, and possibly lose me a client. Hopefully you'll fix this right away.
replyContent: Nathan, sorry to hear that. We'll consider adding an option to disable them in future updates.

content: The repeat option is nonexist. The only time its allowed me to repeat a task is "every month". At first I thought "every two weeks" might be too confusing for it but I tried "every week" and "every day" and it doesn't pop up except for that first day. Also the fact that it often lists the scheduled date as "today" despite me not yet picking a date is stupid, and it resets to "today" automatically when I try to edit the task in any way (like change the name). It doesn't make any sense!
replyContent: Hello, you should be able to add recurring tasks such as "ev day" or 'ev week". Here is more information about it - https://get.todoist.help/hc/en-us/articles/360000636289 For more questions, please contact our support team :)

content: It looks nice, but a couple issues making it not great for repeated tasks. 1. When a task is overdue (either missed or forgot to check off), there's no way to check off that iteration or mark as missed, checking off the overdue one checks off the next iteration. 2. The widget has no way to apply both "Today" and a project filter. 3. No way to change what to consider start of day to be. A lot of my tasks personally I do around midnight, so it's impossible to setup for that.
replyContent: Hello! Thank you so much for sharing the feedback with us! Please submit this via https://todoist.com/contact → Product feedback, so our product team can process them😀 We really appreciate your time and thoughts on improving our product!

content: had this app for about a year. it was perfect for what i needed it for at first, but now it's practically unuseable. sections and tasks randomly duplicate and can't be deleted without also deleting unrelated items. i tried updating my app, which didn't help at all. sad to see it go, but i use my calendar every day, and the frustration of dealing with these glitches is simply not worth it!
replyContent: Hello! We are sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: Would be better if the Inbox was not treated as a project, but rather a scheduling location, and that items could be created in the inbox and EASILY (bulk) moved to other projects (but stay in the inbox) to then be scheduled to daily or next week or whatever Tracking would be easier. and the app would get a higher rating and I may actually subscribe.. Its a deal breaker for me.
replyContent: Thomas, sorry to hear that. Please note that all that can already be done with filters. You can even pin filters to the top area so instead of using the Inbox project, you could use the custom filter that will show you tasks for the next days or weeks in any projects. More info on filters: https://get.todoist.help/hc/en-us/articles/205248842

content: New lay out is awful and takes extra steps to do everything that was once easy. App no longer syncs to my computer app, which has syncing problems of own. Since the last update it's slow on either set up and honestly no longer as good which is upsetting as I paid for the full year right before the update that screwed it all up. I really hope you guys are working to fix the lag, the lay out and the syncing problem. This last update was a terrible idea
replyContent: Hello, could you please contact us at support@todoist.com with more details about the syncing issue you are experiencing?

content: Beautiful interface and design. Unfortunately most features are locked behind a subscription, including some important features such as viewing completed daily tasks. As is, other top rated To Do apps offer more features for absolutely no cost. Would consider paying a one time fee for it but the subscription is a deal breaker.

Despite an intuitive interface, and positive initial impression, I was unable to get recurring events to show up properly on my "upcoming" calendar. Frustrating to schedule a routine item for "every weekday at 7am", see it reflected correctly in the task view, then look at your "upcoming" tab to have it only show it on the next day. I could not find any cases of others having this issue online, so maybe I'm just a moron. And morons leave 2-star reviews for things that are their own fault.
replyContent: Hi Juliet, in Todoist, recurring tasks are based on completions. This means that a task will only appear on its due date once the previous instance has been completed. If you create a task that repeats daily, it will only show up in the "Upcoming" view on the current day. Once you complete the task, it will then appear on the following day.

content: I tried out this app but decided not to go with it because it wasn't as intuitive as I like and might be missing some features. Imagine my annoyance to receive a reminder email this morning when I specifically turned off all notification settings. This app is probably great for people who like to be nagged. I don't. I like to be organized.
replyContent: Sorry to hear that. Please note that you can disable all notifications not just in the app, but on your account at todoist.com. Also, if you're no longer using our service, you can delete your account which will remove your email address from our database and stop any emails/reminders.

content: Worthless. Contacted "support" through the app over a week ago, and still no reply. I paid for the year, but I will be cancelling it, as paying to have basic features on this app is a ripoff for the customer. Crazy to think I paid and still get no support. Go with another app and save yourself the money an the hassle of Todoist. THANKS. UPDATE: THEY HAVE FINALLY REPLIED, SO UP TO 4 STARS, AS AT LEAST THEY GOT BANK TO ME.
replyContent: Danny, we're very sorry for the delay in our support. Normally we respond within an hour, but we've recently had a huge increase in support tickets. We are now hiring several new supporters to address this issue.

content: App generally works, but it's impossible to include any time or date information in a task name, which is incredibly frustrating. For example, if you want a task that says 'tell family I need the car tomorrow', you're out of luck because 'tomorrow' is not allowed. You can't 'prepare for meeting at 12' either, or any such thing. Very annoying system.
replyContent: Hi Ryan! You can turn off smart date recognition on a case-by-case basis by pressing delete or backspace on the desktop or by tapping on the highlighted word on mobile to unrecognize it. Here's more information: https://todoist.com/help/articles/enabledisable-smart-date-recognition

content: I'm changing my review from 5 to 2. I'm a pro subscriber and love this app, but latest widget changes for Android are truly terrible. I can't click the todoist icon to get the app open anymore because that's gone, I can't click the reschedule shortcut button anymore because that's also gone, and I can't select multiple tasks to mark done at once via the widget anymore. But hey it's transparent now! Horrible update and I hope the team behind this update sees this review.
replyContent: Hi Peter, thank you for the feedback! For now, the Todoist icon to open the app is available :)

content: The interface is very nice and simple, however, once I got down to using it and setting some tasks(five tasks total), about an hour later I went back to the app to make edits, but instead saw the list of tasks that I have set were deleted. If the app has an issue saving the tasks, it needs to be fixed. I will change the rating once that bug is resolved.
replyContent: Thank you for your report. Please contact support@todoist.com and we'll look into this issue.

content: I am trying to find a decent replacement for Wunderlist. Todoist is merely okay. I'm vacillating between 2 and 3 stars, because the most common thing I need to do (ALWAYS add a task TO THE TOP of a list) is apparently not possible. The most frustrating thing so far is that adding a new task adds it to the BOTTOM of the list, NOT at the top. I NEVER want this behavior. Adding a task at the bottom of the list means the new thing is lost from view and I have to manually rearrange the list. On the web app, you can control where to add a new item by using Shift+A, but there is no preference to ALWAYS do this! There is also no way to do "Shift+A" (that I've found) on the Android app. You have to create a task, then manually move it to the top. Also, sorting by date either doesn't work, or sorts the wrong way, because the newest tasks are still at the bottom. I cannot believe that this is the default, behavior, and that it cannot be set in a USER PREFERENCE. I sooooo miss Wunderlist.
replyContent: Hi Tracey, thank you for the feedback! On the Android app, you can drag the add task button "+" anywhere you want to add a new task.

content: It was already very irritating to see your latest added tasks being pushed at the bottom and you have to everytime open the app to rearrange. And with new update you can't even open the app from the widget, you have to create a seperate icon which is super super annoying. Probably gonna uninstall the app if this is not fixed soon.
replyContent: Hi Ashwani, thank you for the feedback! We will add the shortcut icon to open the app once again :)

content: This is a great to do app. Probably the best around. But gd, there's this tiny bug, where I drag items to reorganize their order, only for the app to send that item back to where i just dragged it from. U end up having to drag things multiple times to see things in the order you want. Annoying.
replyContent: Hi Louis. We're truly sorry to hear that you're running into this issue while reorganizing your tasks! Please contact us directly (https://todoist.com/contact) so that we can look into this for you 🤗

content: Absolutely love this app, giving it two stars because we need a PERSONAL VERSION for purchase, I would love to buy the app outright and not get into a subscription that doesn't fit my needs. I'm self employed and manage my tasks with the app, we need a buyable version for 1 user only, I would buy it immediately. Include all the notification features, without all the collaboration features. Please!

I was hoping after not using this for a long time there would be an easier way to reuse a list that you would routinely use. I would have liked to be able to check and uncheck items that I recognize I need to get. Such as from a grocery list. Instead the most efficient way to use this app is to create an entire grocery list and copy that grocery list at times. Which doesn't help when you don't always need all the items on the list. But the app forces you to have every item on the list to view.
replyContent: Hi there! You can always export your grocery list and then import it when you want to use it. If you would like the list to reset after completing it, you can try the "reset sub-task" feature. If none of these work for you, please write to us so we can gain a better understanding of your situation and recommend other options. :)

content: Been using Todoist for several years. All was good until just recently. App has recently started changing the due dates of random tasks. Happens completely randomly. Very annoying bug is got me looking for an alternative.
replyContent: Hi Eric. We're truly sorry to hear that! Please contact us through todoist.com/contact so we can investigate this further for you 🤗

content: Free version is useless. I understand that not all functionality will be free on apps, but what's the point of the free version if you have to pay for the app to remind you of tasks that need to be completed? That's the critical part of a task app. Uninstalled 👋🏻
replyContent: Your feedback has been noted. Thanks for sharing 🙏

content: I liked the app and have been using it for months now. I decided to upgrade to premium because I needed the reminder feature. Unfortunately, the one feature I upgraded for isn't working. I created several test tasks to check what the problem is to no avail. Battery optimisation disabled, app reinstalled, notifications enabled. The reminder only comes through if I have the app open. What's the point? Glad I only subscribed for a month. I loved the app experience but sadly I'll have to switch.
replyContent: Hi Atif! Unfortunately, the app needs to be running in the background for you to receive reminder notifications without any issues. We apologize for the inconvenience 🙏

content: As a new user the app doesn't provide any kind of walk through. I would expect it to be easy to use but it's not so. I've added a template project for a fitness tracker and now 'my day' is full of over due tasks from may 2023. it's easier just to write out a plan on another notepad and follow that. I feel you need to provide some demo/walk through. The tutorials on your website don't help either.
replyContent:
Hi Steven! Thanks for your feedback. Have you tried our Getting Started Guide (https://todoist.com/help/articles/get-started-with-todoist-OgNNJR)? We also recommend the tutorial videos by Carl Pullein: https://www.youtube.com/@Carl_Pullein/search?query=todoist
If you need more help, please feel free to contact us via https://todoist.com/contact 🤗

content: Counterintuive design, repeating tasks dont show in the future until you completed the current and no monthly view. It's still an ok app, but I give it 2 stars because of the stupid amount of spam mail you get for just creating an account.
replyContent:
Hi Sebastian! We recently released the monthly calendar view which you can also turn on future occurrences. Here's more information: https://todoist.com/help/articles/use-the-calendar-layout-in-todoist-lPHRQTu0o
If you're referring to the reminder email, you can disable it in Settings → Reminders.

content: Was great, a bit slow on the sync every now and then, which made us end up with more toast then needed. However, they crippled the app to a point that I is simply not usable anymore
replyContent: Hello Jan! We are sorry to hear this. If you have a minute, please share more details with us, we would like to know what is not working for you so we can improve in the future: https://todoist.com/contact. Thank you 🙏

content: It's fine for a simple to-do list No longer links with their Alexa skill via Google. This means you can't add to your to-do list by voice commands.
replyContent: Hi Chris! Are you referring to this feature - Use Amazon Alexa with Todoist (https://todoist.com/help/articles/use-amazon-alexa-with-todoist-OKO3lHwv)? If so, it should work. If it doesn't, please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: There's now an option to set a time when scheduling tasks, which I thought was great. Unfortunately the app also scheduled a duration by default, even though that's a feature for paying users only. As an unpaid subscriber, I couldn't adjust or remove task durations that have been automatically applied. I had to subscribe in order to access the button to turn them off. Very irritating, but I suppose it forces people to subscribe which might be the point.
replyContent: Hello! I'm sorry to hear about this. Could you please contact us through todoist.com/contact so we can investigate further?

content: Had to go back and update my review, as some things really have changed since 2020, and the biggest issue is needing to pay £50 a year for reminders. Reminders! Their natural language processing has gone down as well which is a shame, and I understand that having more things as part of the premium model makes 100% (devs gotta eat), but not having a “view all” as a free or standard “filter” is awful, and I can live with setting one up myself but now I can only have 2 more filters

Used to be 4/5. I found it useful for a while, but they recently redesigned the apps and made it difficult to find anything. They may as well get rid of all of the other buttons and just leave a search box because that's the only way I can find a specific task now. Will unfortunately need to find another task app that doesn't feel the need to redesign a perfectly functional UI into one that neither works better, nor matches their web UI.

The app is simple and easy to use, so I decided to go ahead with premium because I need reminders. Sadly, such simple feature like getting reminded about a task does not work consistently at all! - If you set up a reminder from the web, you may not get it at all and if you get it - the push notification on mobile is missing. - If you setup a reminder on your mobile you get only push notification and some times web, too. - There is no option for alarm or just playing some sound on web

Awful UX/UI - I don't like how you have to use a rigid syntax to set recurrence for tasks. I like old fashioned controls, but Todoist is just trying to be different for no reason. Was on Premium for several months and gave it a fair shot - needless to say, I cancelled my subscription and switched to TickTick instead. I don't normally downvote apps, but this just didn't do it for me, and I spent money on it. I should have ignored the hype, so the fault is mine.
replyContent: Sorry to hear that. Every date format we support is documented at https://support.todoist.com/hc/en-us/articles/205325931 please let us know what dates exactly did you try to enter that didn't work and we'll definitely look into this.

content: Very good app. I have recommended this to so many of my friends. However, I have paid for an annual subscription for the pro version, but then a month later, I'm unable to use the original pro settings like having multiple projects and setting reminders. Due to new packages introduced to the app, it appears I don't have the access that I've originally paid for, and I've been prompting me to upgrade again. I've tried multiple times to make contact with them to no avail. Please help me understand
replyContent: Hi Koby! We are sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: Every update have been a step backwards. All the small changes only made everything less convenient and looks like will only continue to do so. The last straw for me is now you can't add things quickly (to default "inbox" project) anymore, now you have to spend several more clicks to designate a project, even though I just want to add quickly to the default inbox. Making the quick add widget useless now. Also premium pricing has always been terrible and greedy (monthly cost instead of one time).
replyContent: Sorry to hear that :( We're planning to improve the app in future updates.

content: I was initially excited, got it all set up with various projects used it for about w week or so , but now it will only open for a second before "stopping" I close it multiple times,but no change . I have sent feedback. I don't want to lose what I've already put in there , but wonder if uninstalling and installing would make a difference. Hope some maybe able to help
replyContent: Hello! We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused. We are fully aware of this issue and a solution is currently being implemented. The fix is being released gradually, so we kindly ask you to check for updates in the Play Store. Thank you for your understanding 🙏

content: Some pretty basic standard features in other apps are missing. The options menu is very limited with no option to default a tasks due date, project, category etc. These have to be entered every single time a task is created which makes adding quick tasks on the fly very annoyingly slower than other apps. There is no sorting options or filters on views (ability to create custom views does not exempt this feature from being useful). Too many clicks to edit tasks, eg notes/comments, rescheduling.
replyContent: Daniel, thanks a lot for your feedback, we'll consider adding such options and improvements in the future.

content: Please add start view that has many favorite projects easily accessible. Would be better if it was possible to add top of the list. It is not easy to use with one hand since everything is in the top left corner (please add material design button for favorite projects to bottom). Lists do not automatically sort and sort needs to be done again if anything is changed.
replyContent: Hi Anssi, thank you so much for your detailed feedback!

content: Not worth trying this for the reminders as they removed them from the free version. Sure maybe this is worth paying for for all the project management stuff, but for us who just want a very basic Todo list with reminders, this will not work without paying a subscription. I would have paid a once off for this for a basic Todo notifications version, but alas, they want to go too far into the "as a service" model.

I've been using Todoist for a while, but I've backed off because it's frustrating to work with. It's very difficult to get a good view of to-dos since my day regularly ends after midnight. Other apps have a "choose your day start/end time" feature, albeit with less functionality than Todoist. It just strikes me as classist and ableist that this is one of the most requested features & they refuse to add it in.
replyContent: Hello! Thank you so much for your review and feedback! We have now added your vote toward this request and hope it will be available in the near future. Sorry for the inconvenience 🙏

content: The splash screen says the account is free forever. But to have reminder of events / tasks a fairly fundemental aspect to a task reminder app its £3 per month. That's quite misleading. #response to the developer. Thank you for responding. The main point is that a reminder function is a key aspect of a to do list rather than a premium feature.... best wishes with the app.
replyContent: Scopio, the app is indeed free forever, you'll never have to pay to use it. Only the additional Premium service is paid and we never claim that it's free as well.

content: Please stop loading screen from scratch each time I switch tabs from nav bar. It looks especially bad when switching from "Inbox" tab to "Today" tab and back. Preserve screen from destroying when you switch tabs. It wasn't noticeable in the previous design but now it is and it looks just terrible. Look at the same IOS navbar behaviour. You don't see tasks being loaded from scratch each time you change a tab on IOS. You can provide the same behaviour on Android.
replyContent: Hello! I'm sorry to hear about your experience with switching views in the app. Could you please contact us through todoist.com/contact so we can investigate further? Thank you :)

content: It was so good and then the PC version became extremely annoying overnight. I'll add tasks in a project, the app will sync and move the task to an entirely unrelated project on its own. And sure, I can reassign it, but I didn't have to before and that's just an annoying waste of time. I don't mind waiting for it to get fixed, but I might just start looking for a new app, which sucks because I really liked this one.
replyContent: Catherine, sorry for the inconvenience, we will of course fix this issue in the Windows app. We'd love to hear if you like the Android app, though :)

content: I'm currently using todoist premium, and unfortunately it ain't worth it. There are lot of restrictions in free version i.e., a simple thing as reminder option (really? Any free app allows that function). Also, it doesn't have any proper calendar view like Google Calendar. The Date parsing and natural language works fine. Other than that, I didn't find anything worth buying premium and free version doesn't provide much functions. There are other apps like TickTick that's same but better. 👍🏼

Devs pls give us an option to set custom font (ttf file) for the widget and add shadow to the widget font. The current widget lacks basic customisability which makes it look very clunky in custom launcher setups. PLEASE add these options. 🙏🏽
replyContent: Hi Anmol! Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us. We'd appreciate it if you could submit it through https://todoist.com/contact under the "Product Feedback" category. This will ensure that our product team can properly process your suggestions. We truly value your time and insights in helping us improve our product!

content: Not a good app for implementing the "Getting Things Done" methodology. Microsoft Todo is better.
replyContent:
We're sorry to hear that. In case you're not aware, we have an article on setting up a GTD workflow with Todoist: https://todoist.com/help/articles/getting-things-done-gtd-with-todoist-e5j2h3
If there's anything we can do to improve your experience, please get in touch via https://todoist.com/contact 🙏

content: Nice look and feel but integrations are random and hopeless. Syncing with Google calendar either doesn't work at all or creates endless duplicates. Which have to be deleted individually. The lack of integrated time recording is annoying. There are other alternatives with fewer issues. After a couple of pandemic years perseverance, I've moved on
replyContent: Hi Ken! We are sorry to hear that. If you decided to try again please let us know and we will look into those issues together with you. Just drop us a message here: https://todoist.com/contact. Sorry for the inconvenience caused 🙏

content: Why did you change the font color from white to red in the dark theme of the widget? It was so much better in white. Please change it back, or at least put an option to choose font color
replyContent: Hello! I will share your request for changing the font color with our team, so we can take it into consideration for future improvements 😊 For future feature requests, we recommend using the Product Feedback button on our contact form: todoist.com/contact

content: OK but not as good as it once was. I have now switched to Google tasks, considerably more stable, greater functionality and zero cost.
replyContent: Hello Glyn! We regret to hear about your experience. Could you please specify which feature has been degraded or what exactly is malfunctioning? Please send us a message at https://todoist.com/contact so that we can investigate the issue more thoroughly. Thank you 🙏.

content: Has become very glitchy. Completed notifications take weeks to appear now despite system Updated and Cache emptied. Not great 😔
replyContent: Hi Jane! Our developers are currently working on this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can inform you when the fix is ready. We apologize for the inconvenience 🙏

content: Constant bugs - breaks functionality or UX that worked previously. For example, reordering tasks flickers for a second while it's updated to and from the server. Last update for disabling reordering of tasks while they're ordered by priority made the app unusable for me. Almost every time everyone adds the tasks of urgent priority (don't we? ;)) And it's very hard to order it to be in the top in case you have like 50 tasks in the list...
replyContent: Hello Marius, thank you for reporting! Is it possible for you to send us more details at support@todoist.com?

content: I had been happily using Todoist for over a year until it started sending me junk notifications (an attempt to get you to open the app) on days I didn't have any tasks scheduled, it wasn't possible to disable these without disabling the notifications for my actual tasks as they had them under the same notification category. This rendered the app useless to me so I've uninstalled it, nice work team.
replyContent: Hello Andrew! We're so sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message at https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: 1. I wish this had better localisation. Colour instead of color. 2. When you delete a project it still shows in the projects list until you trigger a reload of the page by reopening the app. 3. Everything is very menu focused, I wish I could move a task into a different priority group but instead I have to click on it then change the priority.
replyContent: Hello! Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us. We'd appreciate it if you could submit it through https://todoist.com/contact under the "Product Feedback" category. This will ensure that our product team can properly process your suggestions. We truly value your time and insights in helping us improve our product!

content: I was very much enjoying this app, then a new update came in that has made it almost useless to me. I thought it was a visual change but now I cannot even save my reminders or anything and putting in a date is so difficult because if it doesn't like the way you put it in it just does not register as a date. I may change my opinion if they fix these issues but I may have to find something else if they don't.
replyContent: Hello Hassan, could you please report this issue at https://todoist.com/contact?

content: I wish Tasks with far due dates or task with non still shows up in "Today" I often forget what the task is because of it, If there's a way to do it please tell me, Thank You!
replyContent: Hello! Thank you for your review! If you wish to view tasks that are due in the future, you can utilize the Upcoming view. This view displays tasks that are due today, along with those scheduled for future dates. Hope this helps. :)

content: Giving Todoist a 2-star review because the sync issues are so frequent that it makes the app a pain to use. Real shame because the interface is really sleek and there are some great features. Sync issues I've encountered: - I try to add a task and it doesn't actually add because it didn't sync for some reason - I try to add a task using the laptop app and it doesn't add because sync issue - I try to move a task up in the list and it doesn't work, goes back to initial position
replyContent: Hi Olivia, thank you for your valuable feedback! Can you please send us a message at support@todoist.com? We would love to look into this further.🙏

content: "THE VERGE", Says this is the best to-do list app right now! WELL...I guess it is best to settle for less than best voted app. This app is missing essential bells and whistles unless upgrading to premium. One particular major example is the Archived Projects. This is a premium only feature, however as folks may miss-click and not undo, they will never see what tasks were needed to complete unless they have a great memory, but then if they had a great memory why would they need a task list....
replyContent:
Hi Michael, are you trying to view completed tasks? If so, here is how to do it: https://get.todoist.help/hc/en-us/articles/205847912
Free users can also do this.

content: It seems like a good app with good features but it's not intuitive at all. I spent fifteen minutes trying to find a way to skip a repeating task this week and I could mark it done. I try deleting to see if it would delete just that occurrences but it deleted the whole thing. The icons are also not intuitive at all.
replyContent: Camila, sorry to hear that. To skip a recurring task, you can use the "Postpone" option in the scheduler - this will move it to the next occurrence without marking the previous one as done or deleting the whole task.

content: Kept getting "an unknown error has occurred, please try again later" .... Tried on several devices on my T3 connection, had no problem with other apps immediately after leaving this one. Uninstalled. Sad cuz it looked great. In re: dev's reply, yes I did that. I made sure it was plugged in and turned on too. I did take a look at the .apk and I've found an alternative for me for right now. Thanks.
replyContent: Sorry to hear that. Could you please try to delete and reinstall the app, and see if this helps? If not, please contact support@todoist.com and we'll look into it.

content: I used to love love love this app. I have it both on mobile and PC. BUT....recently it became a nuisance to use it on mobile. When I enter a task, and then proceed to insert another one, the second task contains the first task auto populated!!! So I need to delete the prepopulated words from my first task, and continue writing my second task. Do you guys test your apps before running an update!?! I'm sorry that after years of using this, I'm moving to another app.
replyContent: Hello! Sorry for the inconvenience 🙏 This issue has been fixed in the latest version. If you have updated to the newest version from the Play Store and still experience this issue, please let us know via https://todoist.com/contact

content: Great experience so far. Only wish that the subtasks remain in the main task and does not show up in all task list with no due date. And a calander view would be nice. Shifted fr Ticktick to this one, and working out fine so far. However my really important notes (comments) suddenly disappeared. This I'm quitting the app. This is really critical and disappointing
replyContent: Hello, we are sorry to hear this! "my really important notes (comments) suddenly disappeared." Do you see your comments on the web version? Can you contact our support team so we can assist you?

content: On limited trial, it was not intuitive to use and the paid version is required to set a reminder. The app should just be a paid app only then. What's the use of this app without the ability to set a simple reminder? With so many task list apps out there, I've been going through trying them out and this one was a quick uninstall.

Non-usable Don't bother I tried this app as a replacement to my current tasks app that I've used for years. I was looking for a task list that was always up to date on all devices. However it has not stopped crashing since I installed it. Both my phone and tablet experience the same problem. Seems to be when I am trying to drag and drop. Anyhoo, I'm still using my current app which is heads and shoulders above Todoist, both in usability and features.
replyContent:
Sorry to hear this, Bryan :( Please feel free to submit a ticket so we can investigate this issue!
https://todoist.com/contact

content: Used to be a great app though the most recent update has made the widget unusable. Too small to see and there is no way to change the size, you also can no longer select multiple tasks, or pop out the widget to see multiple days. I requested to go back to the previous version, but didn't get much response so now I'm looking for a replacement.
replyContent: Hi Lisa, thank you for the feedback! We will look into this with the team :)

content: The app is not intuitive. Subtask feature is great. Very hard to edit a task once entered. It is easier to just delete the task and re-enter it than waste the time searching for the place to edit the task. It took me 15 minutes to figure out how to move a task from the inbox to the project it needed to be in.
replyContent: Hi Harley! To edit a task on Android, you just have to tap on the task and tap the task name to start editing. You can move a task one at a time by selecting the "Move to" button, or bulk move multiple tasks by selecting multiple tasks: https://todoist.com/help/articles/how-to-create-and-manage-multiple-tasks

content: Everything WAS alright but then an update happened. I thought it would only affect the visual aspect but no. It causes lots of bugs. I cannot open projects, no tasks are showing in them. Turned on the completed tasks but they don't show. Problems with scheduling. Basically all the main features of the app are completely broken
replyContent:
Sorry to hear this :(
If these issues persist in v8562, could you please contact our support team? https://todoist.com/contact

content: I've been using the Pro version for a number of years. I was never very happy with the subscription based model but the app was useful. Now I am told that the Pro subscription will renew at $48/year instead of the $29/year that I have been paying. For me, that large of a price increase just priced me out of their app.
replyContent: Hi David, sorry to hear that! There is a chance you might be eligible to keep this legacy pricing, we would recommend contacting us: https://todoist.com/contact

content: The latest update adds an extra step to switching to a filter. Normally clicking deeper into more menus is only mildly inconvenient, but after 2 years, there is still no real kanban view. I need a todo app that saves time, not becomes a time consuming activity in itself.
replyContent:
Hi Floyd,

We will share this with our team so we can review your suggestion!

content: The Mac desktop application is extremely annoying with the amount of updates. Every time i open it, it wants to restart because of the update. The android app didn't work - the login screen showed an error after facebook login.
replyContent: Hello! We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. We apologize for the inconvenience 🙏

content: Your reminder system could use some improvements please. If we could just click the clock and a watch would pop up where we just input the time or you suggest intervals of 30 min or 1 hour. At the moment we have to type out the time and it's not efficient. I use the app for my sales team 8 hours a day. Please do something about this.
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback! We will share this with the team :)

content: I bet it would work for someone who mainly needs a list, but personally I need alarms and reminders to keep me on track. I was looking for one when I found todoist that was advertised as having a reminder setting. I was disappointed to find out that the reminder function was a paid function, so I uninstalled the app. I bet it would work for someone else, but not for me

I'm really disappointed with the Wear OS app: * The reminders doesn't works as expected: I hear the notification sound but there is no notification popup, and if I scroll down on the main screen I see "No notifications". How am I supposed to know what task I was reminded about? * I can't add a new task with a due date, e.g: "test 20:10" because as soon as I type 20 the ":" button dissapears from the top suggested keys and is not available from the special keys / second keyboard page either (I use the default/google keyboard so that can't be the issue). * The sync is slow, after I added a new todo on the web I had to open the Wear OS app a few times so my new todo also appeared there. Could you maybe add a pull to refresh feature to manully trigger the sync?
replyContent: Hi Barnabás, we are really sorry to hear this :( Could you please submit a ticket at support@todoist.com so we can look into this?

content: You have to pay for reminders, and I think that's stupid. Every single other app in the world sends me push notifications I DON'T want, and now, in the context of an app that keeps track of tasks you have to get done, notifications telling you to do those tasks are a premium service? Seriously, give me a break... I'll just use Google Keep Notes after all...

I like the app. It works, it's functional, and it's great. However, one thing still strikes me down. Why the hell are reminders a paid feature? Seriously, what's a To-Do app without reminders? I could use even my calendar, or almost any other app, and that would too have reminders, for free. So why should I pay for such a basic feature on a fully fledged app?

Way to easy to lose your task as they disapear when checked. Example, I got distracted for 10 seconds with my phone in my hand and ToDoIst app open and when I looked back at my phone 4 task had disappeared and I'm left trying to remember wish task it was! Really bad for an app that suppose to help you organize. I'm uninstalling because of this.
replyContent: Sorry to hear this! Please check your activity logs so you can see what happened to those 4 tasks.

content: Poorly designed, unstable app. Constantly struggling with functions that don't work well. Constantly struggling because of necessary functions don't exist. Example - touching any item can see it deleted. You're just attempting to edit it & it's deleted. Virtually every other app & program has a warning before something is deleted. Baffling that the app is so bad, given the number of users & the revenue that the app must generate. Much better to do apps exist. Shop around before committing.
replyContent: Hi Davo! It sounds like you may have encountered a bug, there should be a dialog asking you to confirm before a task is deleted. If you don't see this dialog, please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can investigate. Thank you 🙏

content: It might be good. It wasn't what I needed. Deleted the app. Still getting emails. Have to reinstall the app to turn off the notifications or delete your account. Reinstalled. Tried to delete account. Now I need to set up a password because I signed in with Google. Go to account settings to set password. I go to account settings. Can I see anywhere to set a password? Nope. FML.
replyContent: Hi Ben! Sorry to hear that. In the Account tab, there should be a button to add a password. If you don't see that, it could be a bug. As an alternative, you can reset your password by using the Forgot My Password link: https://todoist.com/Users/forgotPassword

content: It's a great productivity tool but with reminders behind an expensive per month paywall, it lacks probably the most important function. I'd try something else, despite the great UI It's a good app, I'd pay for it if it was a one off payment but €30 a year? That's too much.

Latest(2021) I have never used it on my newer phones, I bought ACalendar+ and aCalTasks+. Old review (2016) Just seems that it's not really intuitive, to me. Also the notifications come as an email, it's set for 9am London time, but the damn things have been turning up at 06:20.
replyContent: Hi Neil, as for the notifications arriving at 6:20, is it for tasks, or is it the daily digest email?

content: Constant emails from you guys. I've not used the app enough to give an honest review about the app itself as I've been too busy at the minute to properly check it out. But you're constantly emailing me, everyday with tips and tricks. To the point where you're just coming across needy and forceful. Deleting your app. Please, stop emailing me.
replyContent: Hi Dan! We are sorry to hear that. You can unsubscribe to all our emails from the Settings → Reminders/Notifications. Please send us a message if you need more help https://todoist.com/contact. Sorry for the inconvenience 🙏

content: Keeps Crashing. I just got it today and thought that I would give one month of premium a try. But it keeps crashing and I've restarted my phone already once.. I don't want to have to keep doing that. I don't even think that I'll play with it until my month is up. Plus I thought that I could link up my Google calendar to it, but I can't.
replyContent:
Hello! We are very sorry for the inconvenience 🙏 We just released v11064, could you please update your app and let us know if the issue persists? We can be reached via https://todoist.com/contact.
You can set up Google Calendar integration only via the web app: https://todoist.com/help/articles/use-todoist-with-your-calendar

content: Goodside: It's very simple and handy that i appreciate it. Also good sync with Google calendar. Downside: But unfortunately there isn't multiple select for tasks or sub task to delete or move all selected at once. It's so overwhelming to delete multiple tasks in very long and hard way
replyContent: Hi Amir! Thank you for your review! You can learn how to multi-select tasks in this article: https://todoist.com/help/articles/how-to-create-and-manage-multiple-tasks#how-to-manage-multiple-tasks

content: 'It's free, forever' but 'reminders are a premium feature.' Hmm. I'm dyspraxic, without much money to waste, and I'm looking for a to-do list app to help with this. Without reminders, this app is functionally useless to me. Disappointed that you've opted to content-carve to this extent, and I'd argue your claim of being free is misleading. Please reconsider which features to gatekeep, because locking basic functions behind a paywall makes me *less* likely to support you financially.
amazing app but the only thing i needed was the reminders which is only available if you upgrade to pro unfortunately.

This app has been great for synchronising our chores and lists in the family, but wince several updates ago the process of completing checklists is completely unusable. The app re-renders several times every time you mark an item as completed. We have been unable to use it since, as it's way too slow.
replyContent: Hello! We are sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into the issue. Please submit a ticket here https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: Usually this is a great tool. The widget is very well designed and helps me stay organized. Unfortunately, the software has been crashing since the most recent update. This makes rearranging and organizing my day very difficult. I use a Motorola, so it may just be an issue with my type of phone.
replyContent: Hello! The app crashing issue has been fixed in v10748. We are very sorry for the inconvenience caused 🙏

content: Conatant sync problems. Throwing errors when trying to view activity log. Not all actions of collaborators are logged. For example collaborator completed a task and it doesn't show in notifications. But sometimes it does. All in all very unpredictable app.
replyContent: Hello Robertas! We are sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message at https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: Confusing and difficult to use, plus some very basic features require payment.

... hampered by the fact that too much of the functional tweaks are paid ones, COMPARED to dozens other to-do app I've tried and used. =( Seriously, the UI/UX is informative, the paid one is very multifunctional yet still as simple as possible, and the categorization/tagging feature is a hoot. I WOULD SOOO USE IT if not for that fact.
replyContent: We’re sorry to see that our pricing alone has such a significant influence your rating. Our service includes cloud-based multi-platform access to your tasks, great support, constant development and improvements. Unfortunately, there is only one way we can finance all that, and that is by charging less than $2.5 per month for all features. :)

content: Great app. Alas, I'm constantly reminded that "Hey btw there's a paid version which has the functionality you're looking for : ) ". This is tiresome and the subscription based model just doesn't make any sense. Plus hey! Its expensive.
too complex for a plain grocery list. If I were mega OCD I'd probably love it.
replyContent: Thanks for your review & feedback 🙏

content: I reviewed the software to provide 80 projects in free version and collaborators. On installing the product today, it has reduced the projects and collaborators all of a sudden. I was so confused looking at the pricing page show different things all of a sudden to understand there has been an update. Though the app is good, but it's targeted towards premium users more than the basic users. Wouldn't serve the purpose. I guess I would have to program my own to get pretty basic features in an app!
replyContent:
Hello, you may be on the new free plan as described here - https://todoist.com/help/articles/how-to-switch-to-the-new-free-plan
Please contact our support team about this!

content: Lots of emails notifications that you can not stop! Most of the features you need - including seeing a completed task - are all in the pro version (needs payment!) Edit after "Doist" reply: I mean the email notifications for the due jobs on the lists. They keep filling my email every day and I could not stop them!
replyContent: Mohamed, you can go to the Settings - Reminders menu and disable automatic default reminders for tasks with time. Once you do that, you can also remove all existing reminders in each task and you won't get those notifications anymore.

content: Paying a monthly fee is not acceptable IMO. I would gladly pay a one time fee for it. I still use apps from years ago that are still used from one phone to the next. If I had to pay a monthly fee to keep those this whole time would be way too much for what they're worth. This is a good app, with plenty of features, but not worth $36 a year.

After few days of I not open the app and skipping the notification then the app is not send further notification. Again I needs to open and clear all over due or past todos. So uninstalling and try to find another app.
replyContent: We're very sorry to hear about your negative experience. If there's anything we can do to improve your experience, please get in touch via https://todoist.com/contact 🙏 Thanks so much!

content: This is a great to do app. Probably the best around. If none of these work for you, please write to us so we can gain a better understanding of your situation and recommend other options. :)

We're sorry for the issue. We have reported this to the developers to look into as a priority. Please create a support ticket via https://todoist.com/contact, and we can look into your case in more detail.

content: Dear support. Im using todoist for almost a decade years, its quite a lot. But recently your app is not working at all. It shows that app crashed everytime Samsung Galaxy Note 9, Android Thank you.
replyContent:
Hi Anton,
Thanks for your review.
We're sorry for the issue. We have reported this to the developers to look into as a priority. Please create a support ticket via https://todoist.com/contact, and we can look into your case in more detail.

content: Had this app for years. Tonight it started randomly crashing repeatedly, even though I hadn't opened it up since my last restart, and I did a forced stop. Something very fishy is going on. I'm uninstalling it
replyContent: Hello! We are aware of this issue and our developer will release a fix very soon in the next version. Sorry for the inconvenience caused 🙏

content: App keeps crashing. It can't even last 10 seconds opened without crashing
replyContent: Hello! We are aware of this issue and our developer will release a fix very soon in the next version. Sorry for the inconvenience caused 🙏

content: the app on my phone does not recognize that i am paying for the pro version...how to i update that?
replyContent: Hello Jamey! We are sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: Constant emails from you guys. I've not used the app enough to give an honest review about the app itself as I've been too busy at the minute to properly check it out. But you're constantly emailing me, everyday with tips and tricks. To the point where you're just coming across needy and forceful. Deleting your app. Please, stop emailing me.
replyContent: Hi Dan! We are sorry to hear that. You can unsubscribe to all our emails from the Settings → Reminders/Notifications. Please send us a message if you need more help https://todoist.com/contact. Sorry for the inconvenience 🙏

content: I used this app for years and loved it. But recently they seem to have removed a feature that has eliminated a great deal of its function: the ability to set customized recurring reminders. This is a huge problem and has made it only half-usable. After years of being in the top percent of their users (something they also got rid of, their annual tracking), I am going to have to find a new app. It's a real shame, because I've been a premium user for so long and always really liked Todoist.
replyContent: Hi Shewow! We are sorry to hear this. If you’d like to add a recurring reminder, you can try the new reminder shortcuts. For example: Type "!ev tue 8pm" for recurring reminders. You can find all supported formats in this article: https://todoist.com/help/articles/introduction-to-reminders#use-shortcuts-to-create-reminders

content: Best app for task lists, but have a biggest problem: it doesn't allow to the tasks to be reordered according to the user's preference, unfortunately they are limited by the priority and time, the tasks sort should be free to be reordered.
replyContent: Hello! Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us. We'd appreciate it if you could submit it through https://todoist.com/contact under the "Product Feedback" category. This will ensure that our product team can properly process your suggestions. We truly value your time and insights in helping us improve our product!

content: Very very difficult to understand and use this app
honestly, it's not intuitive and it's way over-engineered. if you want to just have a task list, you have to battle the "intelligence" the whole time
replyContent: Hello! Thank you so much for your review and feedback. We would appreciate it if you can share more details with us via https://todoist.com/contact → Product feedback. Thank you 🙏

content: Newest update - items I reschedule for another day keep popping up for today
replyContent: Hello! We are sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: ‎Useful but it needs a tile otherwise it is pretty useless on a watch, the complications are pretty useless and for me a time would change how much i look at my tasks
replyContent: Hello! Thank you so much for sharing the feedback with us! Please submit this via https://todoist.com/contact → Product feedback, so our product team can process them😀 We really appreciate your time and thoughts on improving our product!

content: Despite an intuitive interface, and positive initial impression, I was unable to get recurring events to show up properly on my "upcoming" calendar. Frustrating to schedule a routine item for "every weekday at 7am", see it reflected correctly in the task view, then look at your "upcoming" tab to have it only show it on the next day. I could not find any cases of others having this issue online, so maybe I'm just a moron. And morons leave 2-star reviews for things that are their own fault.
replyContent: Hi Juliet, in Todoist, recurring tasks are based on completions. This means that a task will only appear on its due date once the previous instance has been completed. If you create a task that repeats daily, it will only show up in the "Upcoming" view on the current day. Once you complete the task, it will then appear on the following day.

content: Difficult to add items and navigate
Why on earth would a to do list app need you to make an account?? There is no reason for that.
replyContent: Hello! The requirement for an email address is crucial for enabling seamless data synchronization across multiple platforms. This functionality allows you to access and manage your tasks from various devices. For instance, you can add a task on your Android device and later mark it as completed on your PC.

content: It's very very costly for individual use .Can you roll out premium for Individual and family plan, instead of only team of upto 25people support? This would make it worth for user like me who uses this app for individual use and not for team level tracking
replyContent:
Hi Uday! Thanks for your review! We do have the Pro plan for individual use. You can find more information about our pricing and compare our plans here: https://todoist.com/pricing
If you need more help, please don't hesitate to contact us via https://todoist.com/contact 😊

content: DO NOT SIGN UP FOR THIS! I used it for one month, and now that I have gone through the cancelation procedure 3 times, I am still being charged. No humans to reach to, try to put in a ticket for contact, and all it is is a circle of ignorance an frustration. Again, DO NOT USE THIS PRODUCT.
replyContent: Hi Brendan, we're sorry to hear that! You can contact us here and we'll be more than happy to help: todoist.com/contact

content: Without a doubt the best to-do list in the market. The main differentiator compared to other products is the support of natural language processing. EDIT: Removing a star because of a super slow support when it comes to resolving issues. I have had a problem reported for a couple of months and it is still not resolved even though I have been begging the support team several times. EDIT2: Another star down for even more issues (broken login, broken MacOS app upgrades). Shame.
replyContent: Hi Honza! We apologize for the inconvenience these issues have caused you. Our development team is aware of them and is actively working on a solution. Should there be any updates, we will be sure to inform you.

content: This app has everything I was looking for, but a bit confusing. At 9 tasks on the free version, it wouldn't let me add anymore. There was no indication why, it just wouldn't add anything. It's not enough tasks to use this as a daily planner. Plus, there wasn't anything that said about a limit or if buying pro would boost that limit. I'm too poor to take that chance. Bummer
replyContent: Hi Cassidy, the task limit for each project is 300. From what you've described, it sounds like a bug. Could you please send us a message through https://todoist.com/contact so that we can take a closer look and find a solution? Sorry for the inconvenience 🙏

content: Mostly works well, as the daily checklist app I needed. Has one extremely annoying lack of a feature: You can't change the reset time for daily tasks. Not everyone works on a schedule where a 12 am reset works. It's utterly ridiculous to not have this as a feature. App would be perfect for me if this was fixed.
replyContent: Hi Matthew! Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us. We'd appreciate it if you could submit it through https://todoist.com/contact under the "Product Feedback" category. This will ensure that our product team can properly process your suggestions. We truly value your time and insights in helping us improve our product!

content: It's good, but the layout requires an extra click to get to the calendar week view, and that's my favorite view because I want todoist to be my weekly planner. If I have to click into the app, click the side bar, and then click into the calendar view, it's too much work. Those three views (today, calendar view, etc) I would like clickable like at the bottom always, or the ability to swipe between the views.

This is wonderfully simple and functional app UPDATE 4/30: Lately I've been running into some limitations of this app. For example for some reason could not sort tasks when looking at the label, or on start screen. What is more troublesome are latest updates. For some reason they removed ability to customize start page. That's the feature I relied on day to day. They have also made mobile app LESS convenient to use. I am now afraid to complete tasks by accident due to change in app layout.
replyContent: Oleg, we'll add an option to reorder task in different views in the future. We didn't remove the option to customize your start page, we only removed the "custom query" option, but you can still use such query in a filter and then set this filter as your start page :)

content: The app looked very promising, but there were too many "Upgrade to premium" notifications when initially clicking through the app. From what I saw, I probably would have paid for a year if I was able to try out the fill app first. Instead, I got what felt like being kicked in the face by upgrade notifications. For these reasons, 3 stars and lost buisness.
replyContent: Justin, sorry to hear that. After completing 5 tasks, the app gives you an option to start a free 30-day trial of the Premium version. We also offer a 30-day money-back guarantee if you'd like to evaluate it for another 30 days after the free trial.

content: User friendly but very glitchy. Drag and drop new task feature won't work if too close to bottom of screen. Selecting multiple tasks only highlights the first one. When collapsing groups of tasks, app sometimes freezes. When re-ordering tasks, the app will sometimes (15% of the time) move the task back to where it originally was. "Reordered" msg doesn't auto-disappear. I frequently restart the app to get past glitches. Using on Samsung Galaxy S8 Android 9 Pie.
replyContent: Hi Zachary, thanks for letting us know. Some of those are knowns issues which our developers are working on it. If you can send us an email here https://todoist.com/contact we will be able to inform you when the bug is fixed. Sorry for the inconvenience 🙏

content: So I'm moving over to this app from TickTick because I like how it looks. I believe ticktick is more condusive to time management, but Todoist seems like the better overall to-do list app. The big problem I am having is stability. When trying to create a label within a to-do, it crashes. I've also experienced crashes when switching projects. I subscribed thinking the $8 extra would be a better experience, but so far I'm a bit concerned. I'll give the app a few weeks before giving up.
replyContent:
Hi Andy, thank you for sharing your feedback!
Just to let you know, the crash issue related to labels is fixed and the new version will be released tomorrow most likely.
The other crash issue is not known so we will see if we can also reproduce it. If there is a specific way to replicate the problem, please let us know!

content: I use this app everyday at work--it's a great app with lots of options for keeping tasks organized. However, the latest update seems to have introduced a bug. Sometimes, while adding sub-tasks to a task, the app will auto-complete everything. All sub-tasks will simultaneously mark themselves as completed, and the only way to undo it is to go back and uncheck them one by one. Sometimes the cursor will also skip to the "Comments" box while in the middle of writing a sub-task.
replyContent: Hi Elise! We are sorry to hear that you experiencing this bug. Please, can you try to uninstall and reinstall the app? If it doesn't help, please reach out to our support team so they can help you out directly https://todoist.com/contact

content: Seems like a pretty cool app, I like how quick it is to set up tasks. Would be great for some people's situations, but since I'm looking for something for personal use and have no need for additional projects, larger files (or files in general), or filters it is a waste of money to pay a monthly subscription just to be able to set up any reminders at all. Guess I'm back to my search for a good todo list app...

The app is missing some very simple features. For example, once I sort by priority, I cannot sort anymore. I can't drag one P1 priority over another. The app is missing the ability to add new tasks to the top of your list. For example, if my list contains 30 tasks and a new task comes in that I need to do next, it gets thrown to the bottom of the list. The cost is also a bit weird considering it's lacking features that cheaper apps include.
replyContent: Hello! Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us. We'd appreciate it if you could submit it through https://todoist.com/contact under the "Product Feedback" category. This will ensure that our product team can properly process your suggestions. We truly value your time and insights in helping us improve our product!

content: It would be great if you could add Todoist as a lock screen that shows today's tasks every time I open the phone. And even better if there could be an option to lock the phone for a selected time so that only the lock screen shows and there is no way to open distracting apps during that time. Also the reminding features are not very helpful, it would be great if Todoist could ring or do something to remind me when to start tasks.
replyContent: Josef, we had the option to set Todoist as a lock screen widget until Android 5.0 removed support for such feature. As for notification, they do come with a sound. If you don't hear a sound when they arrive, please contact support@todoist.com and we'll look into it.

content: Former version of the app: I tried several task manager services before settling on this one. Lots of good features without unnecessary frills. **** Update **** as of April, 2020... SO disappointed :( Unfortunately Todoist didn't know how to leave something alone that wasn't broken - and added unnecessary frills. The functionality has become too layered and cumbersome. What used to be done in any easy couple of taps now takes many steps. My time is too valuable to jump through the hoops they have created to add and reschedule tasks. After years of paying for the Premium and being one of their top users, I am in the market for a replacement. There has to be something that is more efficient out there.
replyContent: Hi Polly, sorry to hear this. Would you be able to clarify the details at support@todoist.com?

content: Newest update completely renders filters and upcoming useless. Just a white screen. Testing before launching changes obviously didn't happen. Edit: the newest update renders the app functional. However, it is still very glitchy. Upon selecting filters, the view is not updated until you scroll the screen. And filter names are truncated to 2 or 3 letters.
replyContent:
Hi David, could you please submit a ticket regarding this issue?
"However, it is still very glitchy. Upon selecting filters, the view is not updated until you scroll the screen. And filter names are truncated to 2 or 3 letters."

content: I love the app. I just wish there was an option for a one time payment for premium. I have too many subscriptions, and I always cancel new subscriptions in a short amount of time because I find that I don't use the app enough to pay monthly or yearly. The apps that I can pay once for premium are the apps I usually stick with. I use this a lot for tracking my spending and budget, so a subscription is kind of counter intuitive.

Pros: Can add two levels of subtasks to tasks. Four priority levels. Can drag tasks up and down to prioritize them further. Any number of color coded custom labels can be added to each task. Dark theme available. Cons: NO reminders without paying every month which is pretty bad. I understand charging for premium features but reminders on a task manager is one of the most basic features possible. Can't find a way to backup. *Also: stop deleting my reviews...

Clunky for my purposes. Seemed like a good reminder app, I needed a list app. I wanted something I could use to save a grocery list, not something that tells me "Hey it's Tuesday time to go to the grocery." There's not a way to do that here without navigating too many menus. I'm coming from Wunderlist, so I am used to having direct and clean access to a group of to-do lists. Todoist hides your lists in favor of showing you upcoming tasks and reminders. I already have a calendar for that.

Being a "free version" user, regularly. I can boast about Todoist's opening yield of tools you receive. Although they are not much different or more varied than most other task apps. What makes Todoist stand out is the easy-to-operate platform. The simplicity mixed with the intuitive functionality makes this a hair more effective, enjoyable, & my recommendation for anyone needing some help being more structured. It helped me greatly.

So-so app. The way to move a task to a different Project from the search results is obscure — as described in the developer's response here, it requires scrolling a list that shows no visible indication it can be scrolled. In other contexts, swiping the task right provides a Move option; but, as is common with Microsoft, the way to move a task in the search results doesn't match how it works in other contexts, and isn't obvious at all.
replyContent: Hi Steve! Thank you so much for your feedback! We will review this process with our team. In the meantime, the best way to move a task from the search result is to open the task view, and then select the "Move to" chip (scroll through the option next to Reminders). Here's more information: https://todoist.com/help/articles/manage-a-task-with-tas...

content: Not very impressed with the app. The repeating task function in not intuitive like other scheduling apps which will have a "repeat every" field. The Watch part of the app (which I got it for) is wonky. Every time I open the app it spams asking for location permission (which I have no intention of using). It says I have 8 tasks to do today, but there is only 1 when I click on it. Also it adds a bunch of junk tasks when you first start it.
replyContent: Hello! We are sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message at https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: Great for organizing tasks, assigning to others, creating subtasks and categories. However, my problem keeping me from coming back is my inability to check off a task once it's complete. if I don't check off the subtask, I don't move on to the next subtask, and that task can get forgotten (or worse yet, burdens my mind with the anxiety of all I have yet to accomplish). Home pages don't highlight what I need to do well, reminders pile on, and it get as cluttered as my mind once again.
replyContent:
Hello! Thanks for the review and thanks for sharing your experience 🤗 We recommend getting some inspiration from our blog: https://blog.doist.com/category/productivity. You can also customize your home page. For example, use a filtered view.
If you need more helpful ideas, please drop us a message here: https://todoist.com/contact

content: Great app, BUT the update has ruined the functionality of the widget. I can no longer figure out how to select multiple tasks, and it is no longer possible to go straight to the app from the widget. These are to important features for quickly making more complex changes to your schedule. The widget could be improved, otherwise the app is great.
replyContent: Hello, thank you for the suggestions! As for the shortcut icon to open the app, we will soon implement it back!

content: It has the ability to add sub-tasks to sub-tasks, making the actual lists I create more helpful, y'all HAD a leg-up on Google, unfortunately there is no option to keep tasks/sub-tasks in a specific order, so the entirety of my list crumples because my list relies on being chronological, and Keep Notes (my phones default) DOES have an option for that, so it's 1-1 now. Hopefully that gets fixed, so I never have to look for a checklist app again. Also cannot see completed tasks AND have sorting on.
replyContent: Hello! Thank you so much for sharing the feedback with us! Please submit this via https://todoist.com/contact → Product feedback, so our product team can process them 😀 We really appreciate your time and thoughts on improving our product!

content: I have used Todoist on my phone for years and typically praise it, but in the last month it has been so inconsistent with it either freezing or not opening/just loading a black screen or using up all my power in the background. There are no updates available and I have uninstalled and reinstalled 4 times already. I don't want to lose this app since I pay for it every year but it is basically unusable at this point. Update 10/25/23: the team reached out after an update and it is working now.
replyContent: Hello! Thanks for your review! We really appreciate it 🤗

content: I have the premium version, but the app doesn't show the (added future) repeating tasks. I've tried typing in, "every 25th", "every 25th of the month", etc. and I only end up with the one reminder displayed. However, Google Calendar DOES work--consistently and easily--with setting and SHOWING repeating reminders. Please tell me how to have all the future reminders appear in the upcoming months. Once this issue is fixed, I will consider 5-stars because it's an otherwise nice organizational tool.
replyContent: Hello Lyn, thank you for asking! Just to clarify, you will only see the next occurrence of your recurring tasks. Once you complete it, then it will be scheduled for the next due date.

content: I'm editing my review due to the new update. Dear todoist, the new update made it nontrivial to change the project of a task on the app. I have to click on the three dots then on move project. This should be as simple as changing the label. Please, be so kind to the users and fix this. .... Great app, does exactly what I need it to do. Extremely simplistic and elegant, yet functional design. I would tweak one little thing or too, but overall todoist is almost a perfect product.
replyContent: George, thank you for your feedback, we'll look into changing this in future updates.

content: Update - added a star for the responsiveness of the developer. Awaiting solution rollout. I have used (& loved) Todoist for years; however, the latest update has broken something. Now the widgets constantly get stuck syncing & opening the app results in forced close. Every time.
