It would be exactly what I need... if not for the fact that whenever I add new item or try to change order of tasks on a list, some other tasks also randomly change their place on a list. It is a dealbreaker for me, as I sort things in specific order to do them in that exact order. edit: I am talking about a bug in project view. others have the same problem from what I've gathered.
replyContent: Hi Krzysztof! Please contact support so we can help you http://todoist.com/contact

content: Some functions are frustrating. I was trying to enter tasks as theyre described in an assignment with things like part a, b, or c, but it always changed anything with a part "a" to a time. If I manually changed it so there was no time, it deleted the rest of the text.
replyContent:
Hi there, sorry to hear about this. 
Please write to us at support@todoist.com with further details about your Todoist version and exactly what is the text that is being recognized incorrectly by our Smart Date Recognition so we can look into this.

content: Add habit track and focus mode just like in tick tick app (your competitors). Over all I like tick tick more because of these features but because that company is based in China really concerned about data protection laws. That is the only reason I will stick with todoist. Pls add gamified habit track and focus mode
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback, Ananthu! It has been noted 👍

content: I had a 5 star on this but recent updates have made it far less simple to edit tasks, 3x more taps first to open and then change then get out of the added window that opens. Also it is now impossible to select amd edit in bulk. Poor consideration of basic use cases on part of developers and testers.
replyContent: Vicki, sorry to hear that, we'll look into improving this in the future. As for multi-selecting task, it's still possible, but now you have to swipe the task to the left to select it. You can also configure the left- and right-swipe gestures in the settings.

content: Good functionally but slow app. The widget almost never updates, and the app itself lags heavily on ticking off items. This didn't used to be the case but is also true for the Windows app to now. Unless this is improved I doubt I'll be resubbing.
replyContent:
Hello, would you be able to submit a ticket at https://todoist.com/contact with more details?
Thank you!

content: App is good esp. the language detection for date and time but the reminder / snooze function does not work properly. Needs to be persistent and not just move tasks to incomplete. I used a paid version. Now gone back to MS To Do.
replyContent:
Hello! Thank you so much for your review and feedback 🤗
If there's anything else you would like us to know, we recommend sending us a message via our contact form here: https://todoist.com/contact > and then click Product feedback. Thank you😀

content: been using todoist for some months now great app but need to make the google home experience better. it would be great if it would ask to set a time and date and would i like to change the title of the context when it asked if you would like to change the context, add a label and move to a different project.

There is an issue in this app where comments dont show up on mobile app but you can see it on desktop or web. I have to logout from the app for the comments to appear. This happens every now and then. When it happens, I just need to logout and login but I find that inconvenient. Pls fix.
replyContent: Sorry for the inconvenience, we are looking into this issue right now.

content: Doesn't allow multiple calendars to be synced, making it useless if you're someone that wants to use this for work and personal. Also no proper calendar view. Anydo does both of these things.
replyContent: Hello! Thank you so much for the feedback! This has been noted 👍

content: What I'm looking for is scheduling calls. Not just typing call so and so but click on call button and my contacts would pop up to choose from. When you have this I'll gladly pay a fee and will be strong proponent of the app.
replyContent: Paul, while we don't have an integration with the contacts list, if you include a phone number in a comment, you'll be able to tap it to dial this number.

content: Please reduce the font size in widget so that more items can be shown in a smaller window. There are not so many options so it shouldn't be any issues with click target size etc. Check how Google Calendar widget shows information in agenda mode.

The app itself is totally fine. I've been using it extensively both for my personal and work GTD-management, the app has a lot of my personal data, activity and thoughts. I'm becoming more and more aware and worried about my digital privacy. Can't be overly careful with these things today. I don't use external authentication in Todoist because I don't want to randomly lose my account after some random ban in Google/FB. But I desperately need 2FA protection in Todoist! We're waiting for too long!
replyContent: Hi Nismo! Thank you so much for your feedback! Our team is currently working on 2FA but we don't have an ETA yet 👍

content: Accidentally tick a task off and don't react fast enough to undo completing it? Screw you, buddy, you won't be able to uncomplete it! (Or, at least, their UI isn't intuitive enough to find the way to do it)
replyContent:
To uncomplete a task: 1. Open the project and tap the three dots icon. 2. Tap "View". 3. Turn on Completed Tasks. 4. Tap the checkmark icon to uncomplete the task.
Here's more information: https://todoist.com/help/articles/introduction-to-tasks-080OAXric#h_01HC1F2KPW91FKVKX23KYQ21RT

content: Notification is not properly working
replyContent: We're sorry to hear about the inconvenience you're experiencing. We'd love to help resolve this issue! Could you please reach out to us via https://todoist.com/contact so we can investigate further?

content: There's no way to export or share my lists/sections!! It's one of the most famous to-do apps, and it has no way of copying a list...?? (You can create a backup file in CSV format, but it can only be used in Todoist, and it will only copy the whole project). It also has no way of viewing all the lists in a project, so you have to scroll through your project to find the one you want 🤦‍♂️ Even Microsoft to-do is better than this app...
replyContent: Unfortunately, the export feature is only for the whole project and can't be done only for the section. You can also share your project with another Todoist user. To help us better understand your use case, we'd love to invite you to fill out our feedback survey over at https://tally.so/r/3jB98J 🙌 Thanks so much!

content: I like the app, though would like to see the addition of being able to add colour to the fonts and with the option of having them bold as well.
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback about adding color to the font! We'd love for you to fill out our feedback survey at https://tally.so/r/3jB98J 🙌 You can highlight text and select bold from the formatting options in the editor menu. More info here: https://todoist.com/help/articles/format-text-in-a-todoist-task-e5dHw9

content: It's kinda okay. Looking to purchase it but decided to delete it because there is no one time purchase. Else I will continue using it.

replyContent: That's odd! You should be able to see your overdue tasks in the Today and Upcoming view. We'd love to help resolve this problem! Could you please reach out to us via https://todoist.com/contact so we can investigate further?

content: The app itself works well but the widget(the reason I got it) doesn't. It won't load tasks or is frozen on already completed tasks with no way to refresh the widget. I will keep looking for an app that fits my needs but if your only interested in using the app itself then definitely try it out.
replyContent: Hi Nicole. Thank you for your review. We're truly sorry to hear that! This is not an expected behaviour. Please contact us (https://todoist.com/contact) so we can look into this for you 🤗

content: it's a paid service still working out weather is worth it

Alternatively, you can sign up for an annual subscription and, if you decide to cancel within 30 days, you are eligible for a refund. If you require further assistance, please let us know. We can be reached at https://todoist.com/contact :)

apps that bug me for reviews get lower reviews than those that don't

content: I haven't even had the app installed for an hour yet and you're already spamming my email. If i need help, i can google. content: Mostly works well, as the daily checklist app I needed. Has one extremely annoying lack of a feature: You can't change the reset time for daily tasks. replyContent: Hi Matthew! Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us. We'd appreciate it if you could submit it through https://todoist.com/contact under the "Product Feedback" category. This will ensure that our product team can properly process your suggestions. We truly value your time and insights in helping us improve our product!

content: Projects cap out at 300 tasks, this was my biggest annoyance so far. They say it's performance related but 300 is a small number for, essentially a list. There's a small learning curve. UI could be set up better. Otherwise it's can be useful. It's a one-time-payment of 5 bucks app at best. You'd be silly, and an enabler of the scourge of modern capitalistic auto-overevaluations, subscription models, if you subscribe to this.
replyContent: Hello, thanks for your feedback! We maintain a limit of 300 active tasks per project because greater limits could cause performance issues. As a workaround, you can split your tasks into multiple sub-projects. If you have any suggestions, please share them with us via https://todoist.com/contact. Thank you 🙏

content: Subtasks functionality is very limited. For example: there's no way to turn a task into a subtask of another task, unless they happen to be close together in a specific view that allows that (in practice, it never happens, so I always end up copying everything - title, description etc.).

It's constantly reviewed by our Product team and it's the best way to make sure your ideas are promptly and properly recorded. Thanks for sharing your thoughts with us!

content: The widget doesn't work seemlessly. I would have to open todoist once daily and wait for a few seconds to sync the same in my widget
replyContent:
Heo Kiran! This can be affected by an automatic battery saver that some devices have. Here's how you can fix this:

1. Open your device Settings.
2. Open Apps.
3. Scroll down and find Todoist.
4. Click on Battery, and select Optimized battery usage.
5. Tap back to save the change.

A fix for this issue has been released in v10748. which should be available in all regions very soon. Please check for updates and let us know if the issue persists.

content: How do I take off all the auto generated things todoist adds to my list? It makes me feel more stressed when you add things like "vacuum clean all rooms" or "check work emails". How can I have a simple list that only I add to? It stops me from even opening the app, anymore. I hate seeing a list of tasks someone else created for me.
replyContent: Hello! We are sorry to hear that. Those tasks are for tutorial purposes, you can select multiple tasks and delete all of them at the same time. Here's more information: https://todoist.com/help/articles/how-to-create-and-manage-multiple-tasks

content: Ive been using this for a long time and it has been a joy. However, after a recent update, the widgets stopped working. Able to help?
replyContent: Hello, we are sorry for the inconvenience. The fix for this issue will be released in v10748 which is gradually rolling out at the moment, it may take a couple of days to reach all users. We sincerely appreciate your patience and are sorry for the inconvenience 🙏

content: I liked the markdown support. Links editing in WYSIWYG mode is a total disaster.
replyContent: Hi Evgeny, we still support Markdown, typing Markdown syntax will convert the content to rich text. If you want to paste Markdown content as plain text, you can now use `Ctrl / Cmd + Shift + V`. The content will then be converted to rich text. Sadly, it’s not possible to change the current behaviour and have Markdown as default.

https://todoist.com/help/articles/use-todoist-with-your-calendar

However, my problem keeping me from coming back is my inability to check off a task once it's complete. if I don't check off the subtask, I don't move on to the next subtask, and that task can get forgotten (or worse yet, burdens my mind with the anxiety of all I have yet to accomplish). Home pages don't highlight what I need to do well, reminders pile on, and it get as cluttered as my mind once again.

Then no matter how hard I tried I couldn't save

Hi David! We apologize for the inconvenience 🙏 This issue has been fixed in v11444.

content: Easy to use. I like that it is available as a Windows/Browser/App. I can use it with whatever device I'm using. I will probably be upgrading to the paid version but I want to spend a little more time with the free features to ensure I understand all of them. I also think the supporting informatin they have on task and project management on their site is very helpful. Fours stars for me means it does what it is supposed to and does a few things better than most.
replyContent: Hello Alan! Thank you so much! We appreciate your review 🤗

content: UPDATE: I got tired of waiting on support so I uninstalled. When I reinstalled, it finally worked. But still... That's twice in 2 months you've pushed a broken update, and twice you've crashed my business productivity. Todoist is great. But it has to work, and new updates need tested before they're pushed out to avoid this problem in the future.
replyContent: Hi Allen! Your feedback has been shared with the team. We apologize for the inconvenience caused 🙏

content: I love so many features of this app. I use it for business and personal and I find it to be very intuitive and it has really helped me stay focused on my tasks. My only issue is with the widget on my home screen. It doesn't sync well between the widget and my computer, so items I mark complete on the computer will show overdue on my home screen.
replyContent: Hi Jennifer. Thank you for your review. We're truly sorry to hear about the issue you're experiencing with the widget! Please contact us (todoist.com/contact) so we can look into this for you 🤗

content: Even as a free user this is still a pretty powerful tool. It has almost everything I need in a to do list. My only complaint is default predictive features designed to help, but instead complicating simple tasks, i.e. a task with a holiday in the title sets a due date of the holiday. Thankfully a nice developer quickly responded to a previous review with a work around, but it would be nice if this were a bit more intuitive. Edited to change rating and add thanks to the developer.
replyContent: Hi Brett! We appreciate your review, thank you 🤗 If you would like to share more feedback or suggestions, please feel free to submit it through https://todoist.com/contact under the "Product Feedback" category. This will ensure that our product team can properly process your suggestions.

content: Great app. I pay for the subscription because I find the app invaluable for creating structure in my life. However, there was a recent update that changed how reminders are set, and while I do like the new feature, I wish they didn't remove the old one that allowed you to type a specific reminder with your keyboard. For example, I used to be able to type in something like, "every other Sunday at 8am", but now I can only select a specific date and time unless I use Todoist on my PC.
replyContent:
Hello! Thanks for your review 🤗 If you’d like to add a recurring reminder, you can try our new feature - reminder shortcuts. For example, type"!ev tue 8pm" for recurring reminders.
You can find all supported formats in this article: https://todoist.com/help/articles/introduction-to-reminders#use-shortcuts-to-create-reminders

content: I'm not 100% happy with how it's set up, but it's working well enough to help keep me organized. Since it's a web based app, I can still access my info when my phone acts up, and I won't lose all my data again the next time my phone craps out and I have to do a factory reset. My main complaint is that it doesn't work exactly the same as the other app that I'm already used to, but that one didn't reliably back up and I lost my data one too many times. I'll get used to this one.

It is an effective todo app with some unique and useful features. Paying $3/month for the premium subscription might be worth it...I'm still deciding on this app vs Wunderlist, the one I've used previously. Predictive typing for things like "by today at 5pm" is great but the free version has limited capabilities with reminders. Happily, no ads. It works nice between multiple platforms which is essential, especially since you can key things in on the PC VERY quickly. Karma points help motivate.

Overall it is the best product I've found to organize and track projects. The last few years I have been trying to get them to incorporate dependant and independent task feature. Someone wrote a script (which doesn't work anymore) to do this. It is very handy since it will automatically add the next action on a project to your list of next actions without having to review that project to add that task to your next action list.

I really like this app... It's unique in that the commands are very simple and it can recognize plain-text times and dates, and organizing each entry into sections, or "projects" is easy. I would recommend setting up the app online or on a computer because managing projects and sub-projects is difficult within the app. My one regret is that the app is broken up into calendar days. I, and a few others don't necessarily consider it "tomorrow" until I've gone to sleep and woken up the next day. I'll have a daily task, like reading, that can float through my day... often times I'll get it done in the might before I go to bed, other times it'll happen in the afternoon when I have free time. I can schedule my reading task daily, but if I complete the task at 12 AM on the night of November 1st, it counts as "tomorrow" and won't automatically reappear until November 3rd. I propose that Todoist have a night-owl setting, in which we late-nighters can define when our days end. I don't want my reading to count for November 2 if I'm completing the task for November 1 before I've gone to sleep. I don't want Todoist to skip that task to November 3 even if it is the next calendar day because I won't have done my reading for November 2. I wish that we would be able to define our 24 hour period as one day instead of solely relying on Calendar dates.

The app is excellent; simple, streamlined, functional to-do list. However, the newly redesigned widget gives me a heck of a lot _less_ control. How do I select and reschedule a group of tasks? The old widget could do things the app couldn't, and can't. Give it back! Matters have improved, though - it's now easy to open the app from the new widget.
replyContent: Hi Jennifer, thank you for the feedback! We are looking into those features now :)

content: Great todo app with minimalistic UI, however there is a bit of missing potential. The app is fairly full of features, however for key things like notifications you aren't given many settings to customize them. Another example is you can't have tasks auto-scheduled based on the project it is in or the labels it has. I paid for a subscription (only $4) to test out labels and everything this app and the desktop version offered and I was a bit underwhelmed by the lack of automation features.

Powerful and simple. The only thing missing is integration with Google calendar, which I used for years, and I do not see any option to migrate either. So, no backward search for the events, calendar sharing and other integrations. Well, task and project-wise, this is a powerhouse! Much more simple and well designed than Google Keep I've been using for years.

I've been using Todoist Premium for just over one year now. I think I've tried nearly every todo app out there. There has been some quirky behavior introduced over the last few months, especially around rescheduled occurrences of recurring tasks, and it's been a bit frustrating there. But overall, it's the best app for me and the team behind it seem like great people based on my interactions. Give it a shot!

After trying *so* many different time management apps (even the $200/yr ones), this one the best. I love that the date you type in the add task bar automatically assigns it to the date. You can set events, tasks, and reminders all with voice to text while driving! The only thing I'd *love* is a more conventional "calendar" view where I can easily see what's in store for the month with one glance. Keep up the good work!

I rely on this app daily for all my personal to do lists. But recent changes to functionality have made it less friendly to use than when I first got it.  For example it's much harder to add a time. Whenever I add a time to a task, it assumes I want to do it today, and I have to go back in and change it back to the original day.   Another annoyance is I can never use the word "march" in a task (like the March for Science) because the app thinks I mean the month. There are other words that happens with too, I can't recall them all right now.  Also like another use I don't like the circles on the left to check off the tasks, I keep deleting them accidentally.
replyContent: Denise, sorry to hear that. Could you please let us know which changes exactly are you referring to, so we could improve them based on your feedback?

content: It is a great to do app that takes a little while to find all the customization possibilities for, but when you do it works wonderfully, and even the free version is clean with no ads as I'm writing this. The biggest change I'd like to see is the ability to visualize progress through goals, daily tasks and overall projects in a more helpful way that shows the percent progress made in each priority level.
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback!

content: It's a fine task manager app, a little bit hard to get at first with the weird natural language based task creation, but if you're willing to put in the effort it's pretty intuitive. The one big deal breaker for me is that if you have a daily recurring task it becomes overdue at midnight. If you tap it complete after midnight, it completes it for the next day which ends up with you missing a day unless you remember to do it on your own or manually set the next recurrence to today.
replyContent: Hi Brandon! Thanks for your review and we appreciate your feedback 🙏 It has been noted 👍

content: I've been using todoist for years now and it's nice being able to access my list from my phone or computer. Bad news is that with the latest update, the "add task" widget won't work. It said the app doesn't exist, so I tried to remove the widget and place it again, but it makes the Home UI crash every time. It did the same thing on my husband's phone.
replyContent: Hi Laura, thank you for letting us know. This issue has been fixed in the upcoming version. The upcoming version will be available to download on Wednesday/Thursday. Sorry for the inconvenience it caused 🙏

content: Mostly pros but one big con.. Absolutely love this app. It is really is user friendly and has helped me so much with organizing my life. One big con though is I had a big issue with the Google calendar integration. I had to disconnect it as it messed up my calendar and I lost a bunch of data that I needed to reenter. Luckily, it was uploaded to todoist so I didn't have to hunt for it. I really hope they fix that issue.
replyContent: Hi Rosemary, thanks for the kind feedback! We're sorry to hear about what happened with your Google Calendar, please do not hesitate to reach out when you have an issue with the integration and we'll do our best to help :)

content: Best to do list I've found. I used to use Trello but it didn't work for me. This does everything Trello didn't. Love the Inbox and how i can access it from a widget on my phone with one press. Also i have the other widget that shows my list of choice. I love how you can schedule items just by typing when you want them, even if it repeats. It's a very smooth interface. A few of the premium features would be really nice to have. It's tempting but i don't like recurring fees. I'd rather pay once.

A few days in and so far so good. Definitely has a few non-intuitive functions. Setting custom reminders is weird...a pop-up should just appear to select a date and time, but instead you type it in then it tries to interpret what you type, then you select it if it is right. Very convoluted. Finally found the task completion statistics. Its next to your profile icon/picture when clicking on the three horizontal lines top left. Small circle with squiggly arrow with some numbers next to it.

Updated review to 4 stars from 1. The usability was very poor, but I looked online, and on youtube and eventually solved main problem. It was that when I made subtasks in Today view, they remained as original, but also in the new list as well (subtasked only there)! So I had a lot of duplicates. I stand by my earlier assertion that this is very poor usability from a new user's point of view. Also, I upgraded to premium and it is annoying that they charge 30 dollars up front (annual), instead of a reasonable monthly charge. However it is proving helpful and I look forward to future changes as well. Original review: Poorly designed, subtasks listed in a nonsensical manner. Doing basic things such as un-checking items a hassle.
replyContent: Christopher, sorry to hear that :( Could you please let us know what exactly do you consider to be poorly designed and what exactly is wrong with sub-tasks? Once we know what the issues are, we'll be able to fix them based on your feedback.

content: I love this app and I count on it to keep me organized but am not crazy about the latest update. I love that my list appears larger and easier to read but I don't like how it automatically deletes it when an item is hit. I've accidently lost items on my grocery list several times. It has left me feeling less secure that I've crossed everything off my list.

Reliable, flexible, easy to use. I have more flexibility in organizing my to-do list the way I want to see it, and still use GTD. Only minor drawback: wish there was another way to set repeating tasks other than putting it into words. Putting it into words might seem easier than the menus seen om most other To Do apps, but you have to put the words in a precise way and even then it might still take a few tries before Todoist picks up the repeat request.

Taking off a star because I'm not sure where else to give feedback about the update. I'm not a fan of having to click the drop-down box in the corner in order to select multiple tasks at once. Especially because the task selection mode expires each time I make a single change to the selected tasks, requiring me to then go into the drop-down menu again to and then re-select all of the tasks I just selected. I really liked before how I could just select multiple tasks and make multiple changes to them at once in a few clicks. I know this change was made to allow easy re-ordering of tasks, although I don't find this particularly helpful because I don't typically re-order my tasks. I would prefer that this is changed back or some kind of compromise is made so that it isn't so cumbersome to edit multiple tasks at once.
replyContent: Bradley, thank you for your feedback, we'll look into addressing those issues in future updates. Reg. multi-selecting tasks, please note that you can configure the "swipe to left" gesture in the settings so that it multi-selects tasks when you use it.

content: The app and the web app are really good. They have definitely improved. Wish there was a Scrum or overall progress reports area for individual and teams. A natice kanban view os coming soon. The natural language for setting due dates as well as tags, and overall user interface are nice and clean. They really need progress (% complete) or portfolio overviews especially for the business plan.
replyContent: Hi Corvin, thanks for the feedback! Sub-tasks are not a Premium feature :) https://get.todoist.help/hc/en-us/articles/206432369. Kanban view is something we are planning to have in the future.

content: I've been using Todoist for 5+ years now and absolutely love it. However I now feel that there are slight improvements that could be made in redering Todoist widget UI. Something which can show me a month calendar on top of a stack of my events(from gmail/Google Calendar), would be super convenient to get the snapshot of my week and daily tasks, all at once. I'm happy to provide some sample sketches/wireframes if required
replyContent:
Hi Abhishek! Thanks for the love and your feedback 🤗 To ensure your suggestion is being properly processed by our team, we recommend submitting this feature request via our contact form here: https://todoist.com/contact?area=feature_request
Thank you 🤗

content: Mostly a good app, helps me keep on top of things. Morning notifications are a bloody lifesaver. My only criticisms are that the free version is rather lacking in basic features, at least for people like me coming from other apps. Also the top bar and the system status bar when in the app are different colors, slightly, and that's always bugged me.

Truly my favorite to-do list app I've ever tried. My one small quibble is that it always has trouble accepting multiple keywords, for example if it's Monday and I need to set up an items that is weekly on Tuesdays, I can't just type "Tuesday weekly" but have to go tinker around in the settings. I'd also like more customization over the look, with fonts and colors.
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback, Karl! It has been noted! In the meantime, you can type "ev Tuesday" to create a recurring task for weekly on Tuesday. If you have more questions, feel free to reach us via https://todoist.com/contact 😊

content: It does what it needs to. I just wish instead of email notifications when things were over due that I would get push notifications instead. I think it is hard to balance having a free tool and a paid version for something like this and the free version gives you the bare minimum. I dont know how the paid version would provide me with any better service as an individual than the free version aside from push notifications.
replyContent: Trevor, thank you for your feedback :) You can choose push notifications as the default reminder method in the Premium version. If you contact us at support@todoist.com we can activate Premium on your account for a month so you can test all the features.

content: Very positive so far. Installed the app about a week ago and it took a couple of days before I felt entirely comfortable with it. The learning curve is very modest overall, it's one the few to-do list applications that's truly multiplatform. It have it installed on my iPad, Windows PC and Android phone (OK already! I kno6, and so far it has performed brilliantly. I'll update this eval if I run into any issues. but so far so good. Highly recommended...

Would love an easy access pure calendar view, especially if also available in widget form. I know this is more of a tasks app than a calendar app but theres really no reason why it cant have a simple dedicated calendar as well. Also, the Android widget still doesnt sync with the system light/dark mode. Otherwise, its perfect. I've been using Todoist for years and I can't imagine ever going back to life without it. It's the smoothest and most consistent tasks app out there.
replyContent: Hi Rafael! Thank you for your review and feedback! It has been noted :)

content: I occasionally check out other list tools, buy come back to this one. The full UI works great, but the widget doesn't work that well on Android 12 - it behaves far better on my tablet stuck on Android 10. On my phone it often double/triple reloads, and some reloads just spin until opening the app. Plus, either due to that or having a smaller phone, I mostly fail trying to mark the completion bubble. bubble.
replyContent: Hi Kate! We are sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into the issue. Can you please submit a ticket here https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch? Thank you 🙏

content: This is a great system! I'm pretty disorganized so I'm of the opinion that if it works for me and the mess of my life that exists it must work for everybody. The only thing it needs is an inbuilt monthly calendar. PARTICULARLY for events/appointments. Also while I am aware that reminders are for premium only (and as such are not a factor for losing a star) i am slightly unsure whether or not the reminder works like an alarm system where it will buzz at the time that you have set for the event.

I really like this app and use it everyday. However, these new Pop Ups that come out of nowhere congratulating me on checking off tasks are incredibly annoying. I don't need a digital pat on the back. Maybe some people like that and that's great. Personally, I just want to keep checking off tasks or looking at what's next to do and these pop ups just get in the way of that and irritate me. Can you please make it so I can turn them off? I've searched the settings and I can't find it anywhere.
replyContent: Hello Sara! We are sorry to hear that the pop-up is annoying. Please, can submit this via https://todoist.com/contact → Product feedback, so our product team can review this feature? We really appreciate your time and thoughts on improving our product!

content: Awesome App overall. I like how you can create separate lists for different categories. However I'd appreciate if the subtasks could be reworked to allow for the main tasks and the subtasks to be marked as completed separately. The reason I use subtasks in the first place is because they're related to my main task, yet I need to complete them at different times than the main task. Right now if I mark one as complete, the whole thing is marked as complete, which defeats the purpose.
replyContent: Hi Sharan! Thanks for your feedback. You can complete only the parent task if you turn off the Reset Sub-tasks feature in Settings → General. Here's more information: https://todoist.com/help/articles/can-i-reset-sub-tasks

content: i love this app very much! its organization is so efficient and i love how you can automate recurring tasks and the projects are so amazing! will be looking into possibly getting premium. my only thing is i wish there was more graphics/fonts/theme options. I understand simplicity is the premise, but I like having a pretty schedule or at least a personal looking one. even if not, a pink theme for premium please 😭 but other than that it is a fantastic app!!

I bought a new planner around the same time I started using Todoist. I used the planner for about a week. I find with Todoist, the planner is no longer useful to me. The use of tags helps me organize my work and plan my day. It's also very easy to move a task from one day to the next. In my planner, it seemed I was constantly re-writing tasks to the next day and would often lose sight of them. I also like that I can keep notes within a task. This helps me remember any progress or delays.
replyContent: Hello Amy! Thank you so much for sharing your experience! We really appreciate it 🤗

content: decent app for phone use although there are better options that offer more features for free if you strictly want to use only one phone. what makes this stand out is the integration with other devices such as android wear which allows you to add and complete tasks from your watch and easily see the next task you need to complete.
replyContent: Kevin, sorry for the inconvenience, this bug will be fixed soon in version 2.2.2.

content: This is an amazing app for my ADHD, I love it. But some updates make it weird to use. With the latest update, if I make "laundry" a task, then make a new task "Sweep floors" it will put "laundry" as soon as I start typing. If I use a label, sometimes there is no label unless I tap on the task to enlarge the view. Some tasks show the entire label "Medical" on regular view, other tasks show "Me..." and it gets annoying. Overall amazing otherwise. Also would love to see more colors for labels.
replyContent: Hello! We are sorry to hear that. We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. Thank you 🙏

content: I love this app and use it mainly for a to-do list/remember this list. The only problem that I have experienced is, it's quite sensitive. When I mistakenly touch something and it deletes, it is gone. Sometimes it happened so quickly I don't even know what I just deleted. I wish there was a "deleted files box" that it went to so that I could restore that which I mistakenly deleted, which could be emptied later at my decision. Other than that, it is a wonderful program and I do recommend it.
replyContent: Darwin, thank you for your feedback, we'll look into improving this. In the meantime, please note that you can always use the "Undo" option that shows up at the bottom right after you complete or delete a task, and you can also check the activity log: https://get.todoist.help/hc/en-us/articles/209430045 to see the last actions.

content: Very handy app. They are tons of tips and tutorials about how to get it to practically sit up and roll over. Really does help with productivity. Works with Alexa for the most part too. Updated now that I've used it for a while. I have the Pro version now, and it's very handy, especially for looking back at completed tasks. I know there are lots of tricks I don't know yet, but I do recommend this product.

Great software. Excellent as a widget but your newest update needs keyboard focus immediately activated on clicking the search button like it always has. If it goes away which it seems to do more often than before as well...arbitrarily just turned 40 task searches a day into 80-120 unnecessary clicks. It's not even clear where the form is looking around the screen (there at the top) Repeatedly pressing search button again waiting for the keyboard to open up so I can actually begin searching
replyContent: Hello! Thank you so much for your review. Your feedback has been noted 👍

content: Its good. WAY better than when I first tried it. The features are excellent. Esp because I use it mainlie for life stuff and to get the functionality it offers most productivity apps make you pay a per user fee. I've tried about 9 in the past year and a half so im prettie confident in the quality of Todoist. Runner up Asana as a for instance doesn't automatically remove completed tasks on their free version... bananas.
replyContent: Hello Sara! Thank you so much for sharing your experience! We really appreciate it 🤗

content: I love todoist.... I have stuck with this software longer than its competitors. I gave it 4 stars because I want more themes( nature, full dark mode themes, more colors like even soft pinks, lavender, powder blue) I would love an alarm on my tasks because reminders just dont catch my attention. I would love to be able to make list with checkboxes or numbers in comments on a task. I wish this app had a timer on each task as well. I love this app.

Useful, efficient, and simple! While some people find the simplistic nature of the app as a downfall, I believe this is one of it's best features. I can make tasks with deadlines and make the subtasks have subtasks, meaning big projects are a lot more step by step and manageable. I've recommended this app to a few friends and would do the same thing for others, especially students!

I have a notes app built into my phone that I use. I researched and found an article where someone tried 4 different to do list options. This one sounded best to me, as most people, like me, usually have their phone right there. But my notes app also has where I can put things in the order I'd like to do them. If you can add that feature, I'll try again.
replyContent: Hi Brittany! Thanks for your review! If you don't have a sorting option enabled in your project, you should be able to manually reorder them but dragging and dropping. Here's more information on how tasks are sorted in different views: https://todoist.com/help/articles/how-are-tasks-sorted

content: Prepare to pay. It looks like a very useful app if you pay for it. The basic features I have access to for free are good; easy to use & had a nice front end user experience. I can't give 5 stars because I'm not going to pay to access the extra features when I can use Samsung Notes for free for the same basic abilities. I don't need it bad enough to pay.

Great simple app ! I have free version now. I probably need to get the premium version to duplicate and move tasks. Some questions : Does it allow the moving or duplicating of subtasks to another task ... or the elevating of a subtask to be a task or vice versa. Also, are reminders sent as notifications or sound or both.? Also, does it keep a log of completed tasks and/or subtasks. and if so, can you view or export it in some way? With these features it's a 5 ⭐ app❗
replyContent:
Hi David,

1. You can drag and drop sub-tasks.
2. You can check the reminder setting to choose this. 
3. Here is how to view completed tasks: https://get.todoist.help/hc/en-us/articles/205847912 You can also use some of the 3rd party apps like IFTTT to export your completed tasks into Google spreadsheet.

content: A little difficult to get the hang of. But all in all a great app. Only issue I'm having is that my recurring subtasks show up twice on my daily checklist which clutters up the list. The duplicates also appear outside the main task so I can't unexpand them to clear up the clutter. Other than that everything works well so far.

I tried a bunch of the other top todo apps and like this the best. The simplicity of creating tasks and tagging tasks in natural language is great, as well as the ability to deeply customize your taxonomy with labels and sub projects. I'd probably rate it 5 if the note taking experience was better. "notes" are just "comments", and look terrible outside of mobile. They're given tiny real estate on web UI. Feel like it be better if projects/tasks had a dedicated "summary" field.

Its a to do list that can go everywhere with you and no writing! Can prioritize list as well great little app 10/23 edit update. Giving another star back cause it's 4 years later and I still use this app everyday so obviously useful. Recently have had an issue with it not opening up occasionally but for some reason opens if I go to Google play store and open from there. Odd/annoying but still useful and will likely be fixed like the previous issue was which caused me to rate it lower.
replyContent: Hello! We would like to let you know that the issue you reported has been fixed in v11070, updating your app in the Play Store should resolve the issue. We sincerely appreciate your patience and are sorry for the inconvenience 🙏

content: Please get rid of the check mark boxes or give us an option to opt back to swiping. Other than that, I've been using and loving this app for years! It is exactly what I need as a college student, worker, mom, and just someone who likes keeping household tasks in order. I could only love this app and widget more if you got rid of those check mark boxes, please! I accidentally hit like 5 items in one day alone. thanks!
replyContent: Sorry to hear that, we'll consider adding an option to disable the checkboxes. Please note that you can still use the swipe to complete option if you configure the swipe gesture to "Complete" in the Settings.

content: Having one place for all my lists and projects has been really enjoyable. I would probably like the premium better for more accurate and times reminders but otherwise the basic todoist app is really nice. Being able to share a project with my hubby is helpful so we can split up during shopping while checking off the same list.

I really enjoy this app! The design is very simple and well put together. The cute designs of people enjoying their day when I finish tasks is almost rewarding, and it's nice when the app tells me to enjoy my day off when I have no tasks. I like that I can color-code things and add subtasks, as well as create different priority levels for tasks. The only thing I wish it had was a monthly view. Then I would give it 5 stars.

Im in love with this app! However, being forced to pay for the premium service on my device my husband's device for just notification feels a little bit wrong. I think for something like a to-do list notification should not be a premium feature. There is an amazing amount of functionality in this app and I have been through dozens of different to do it apps over the years and by far this is my favorite. It is so clean, simple, easy to use, and it does recurring todos

Task sections with a "/” in their name get converted to "_". Almost perfect. A feature I'd love is if using share could predict the project you're adding to based on the app you're sharing from. When I share from Spotify, YouTube or SoundCloud, it always goes to my "Music" project. I wish after doing that a dozen times todoist would know that I like to add these links to my "Music" protect and preselect it for me.
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback, Kyle!

content: The app itself is good but the voice integration on Android is not intuitive nor powerful. I have to jump through several hoops to get my task logged and it often ends up wrong. This might be an issue with Google as well. But I am looking for a quick way to get tasks logged when I can't type. Instead I find my self fumbling to press buttons again...
replyContent:
Glad to hear you enjoy the app!
Please check Assistant language is English and turn on Web & App activity: https://myactivity.google.com/activitycontrols?settings=search
If this persists please raise a support ticket here (https://todoist.com/contact). It would be great if you could include a video of the issue. Thank you!

content: its kind of odd, imo, that a todo app doesnt automatically include notifications unless you pay for premium. however they do offer integration into my calendar app, which DOES notify me, after a fashion. the widget allows you to switch between all sorts of views. love the natural language for setting thibgs up, general ease of adding a task and categorizing it, the "postpone" feature i just discovered, ease of editing, reoccurring subtasks can have different intervals than the overarching task..

This app is the best todo list app. I have used this for almost 5 years I think, and it's been great for me and my husband. A todo list cannot get better than this one. However, my life circumstances have changed. This only works when I can do things, not when I want to give jobs to others. I have a kid now, and there are the family schedule, individual member's schedules, plus important things to always have in hand (notes), etc. Thank you todoist and good bye. [Edit below] We've moved to Twist
replyContent: That's wonderful to hear! We hope you enjoy Twist ✨

content: Finally!!! Over 15 years of searching & countless requests of developers! Todoist is structured (RELIABLE SYNCING, LINKING, WIDGETS, SUBTASKS, PERFORMANCE, "PLATFORMS" & FUNCTIONS) the way people THINK and WORK!!! Progressive, intuitive and responsive developers! 4.00 Stars? 1. No Home screen "shortcuts" ( to individual tasks/projects) (too many clicks) 2. Inability to create task links in mobile app. No task/Project shortcuts & no mobile link creation is very inefficient & counter productive.

Can't share in typical fashion. Can't easily flip through attachments. 1. No share menu option on item-level. Android design pattern users expect "Share" item. Share to Google Photos' Share button great example. App MixNote's great Share example: popup "Share by text" or "Share by picture". Your "Add reaction, Copy, Edit, Delete" isn't cutting it. 2. Attachments, ugh. Can't just swipe through item attachments. Have to back out of view, select next photo to view. Yuck. MixNote does right, IMO.
replyContent:
Thank you for the clarification, Bob! This is noted.
As for the sharing option, you should be able to add a Google photo image, for example as a Todoist task. This is not the feature you are looking for? For more details, please contact us at https://todoist.com/contact

content: Easy way to sync google calendar with Thunderbird calendar. I was looking for a way to carry Thunderbird task list with me. Todoist allows me to sync tasks between devices. The only thing is that the Todoist tasks end up syncing with Thunderbird "all day" appointments, rather than showing up on the task list. The good thing is, when you log into Todoist on phone and mark tast as completed, it comes off the Thunderbird calendar.

This handled tasks exactly as expected. Due dates sort into categories, with overdue tasks exposed as well (a simple thing that Microsoft To Do continues to botch). The best replacement for Wunderlist, even if you have to pay for access to simple things like comments and reminders (worth $5/yr at most, but I'll pay the extra to avoid the UX issues in other apps... for now)

Im a notorious list jumper (always trying to find the best app for managing my to dos) and ive been using todoist for over 2 years. The only downside for me is a lack of dependent tasks and id really like to see it incorporated in the future, along with "hide until" or " start dates" both available in other apps and would increase the clean interface for those that care to use them. despite that, still the best app out there. Kudos as well for keeping accessibility in mind during development

It is the only app I have found that integrates 2way with Google calendar. With this, tasks can show up as events in my calendar and I can edit them in both apps. Apart from that, it has many great useful features that I regularly use, such as: categorizing tasks (project level as well as section level), prioritizing tasks, sub tasks, comments within tasks. A minor complain would be that you can't move around multiple tasks at once and that there is no native Linux app.

I love thus App! We use it as a team at work and it helps us get things done! We dont forget projects plus we can see who has completed what and it does 85% of everthing I want it to do and it does it well. The two things I hope they add is the ability to wtite notes and have monthy views with out the need of your calander. If they do that it would do everthing that I want 100% of the ways I wouf like to use it. That would bring my rating up to 5 stars
replyContent: Wayne, both options are already there :) In the premium version (or in shared projects for free) you can add notes/comments to both tasks and projects, and if you search for "30 days" or "365 days", for example, or create a filter with such query, you'll see all your future tasks.

content: Has almost all of the functionality I wanted out of a to-do list. The sentence interpretation towards repeated tasks is intuitive and well implemented. More nebulous tasks such as "first weekend of the month" don't seem to work, but that's a minor issue given the robust nature of the rest of the app.

I don't write reviews. However, when Todoist, my most used App prompted me for the first time to rate them, how could I say no? This app has basically changed my life, giving me an outlet to bettet manage my schedule and my time in a simple, yet effective manner. Personally, I do not use the more complex tools like "Projects" but, even for the free users (I'm one) this is a wondeful tool. My favorite feature is the ability to flag different priority levels for different assignments.

The best app for to-do lists. It does have a couple of minor issues: * The widget can become unusable once in a while (stuck forever on the loading screen). * It can also take a couple of seconds for an item to be removed after you check it off on the widget.
replyContent: Martin, thank you for your feedback, we will soon release a new, improved and more reliable widget :)

content: I'll always miss Wunderlist, but I'm very grateful that I found Todoist! 👌 My only problem is that I keep exiting the app when I try to go "back" a page after entering a task. Am I missing something, or do I have to get used to it? 🥴 Reply to developer:Thanks for responding! I usually hit the home button to leave, but when I want to truly kill/exit other apps, I go "back" from the *main* page. I see the page that lists all projects as main. It's the top of the tree & has the settings gear.
replyContent: Hi Kaylee, thanks for the clarification! This is noted.

content: Good app, could be truly great if one more thing was baked in. Imagine if there was a difference between true due dates for tasks and planned dates for finishing them by. I'm envisioning features similar to Trello where you can drag and drop tasks with due dates onto a planning board calendar. This would be excellent for any college students with hectic assignment and exam schedules, or those simply trying to get ahead in their work.

This is the best organization app I've ever tried and Pro is worth the cost. The only thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars is the Inbox. It annoys me that you can't delete it or change its name. Inbox is not what I want to call it so I had to create what I want. I can't do a quick add because I refuse to use Inbox. Please allow us to change this.
replyContent: Hello Kathy. Thank you for your review. Your feedback has been noted! 🤗

content: I just started using Todoist and so far it's great. it's simple and intuitive, and I love that I can just do a brain dump of all the things I need to get done , and then organize them afterwards into priority groups, categories with labels, due dates, recurring due dates, etc.
replyContent: Hello Linor! Thank you so much for sharing your experience! We appreciate it 🤗

content: I would have give it 5 stars but I have one issue with the application. The morning and evening digest notification is not working. I have tired everything to make it work by allowing the application background access, autostart but it still doesn't work
replyContent: Hi Mukul. Thank you for your review. We're truly sorry to hear that! This is not an expected behaviour. Please contact us (https://todoist.com/contact) so we can look into this for you 🤗

content: I've been using Todoist for years. It's a good task tracking app, and I really like the "smart" ability for creating recurring tasks (can get weird with it lol). My biggest/only complaint is that it is impossible to undo an accidental completion of a recurring task. It's simple enough to "reset" the next due date of the task, but it still counts toward my daily and weekly goals 😮‍💨
replyContent: Hello! Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us. We'd appreciate it if you could submit it through https://todoist.com/contact under the "Product Feedback" category. This will ensure that our product team can properly process your suggestions. We truly value your time and insights in helping us improve our product!

content: If you're looking for an app that allows you to set a rigid schedule, with lots of easily accessible settings, this is not for you. I'll still give 4 stars because it's a well-made app, but I was very disappointed that it seems centered on quickly writing down short tasks, which is not what I'm looking for in a planner at all. Also, locking reminders behind a paywall is a bit much for a planner imo.

This is a nice free app. It helps me keep track of my daily/reoccuring tasks as well as misc stuff and less frequent stuff like birthdays. It's handy to have the large widget to see my list when I open my phone, without having to take the extra step to open the app because I'm deterred by even the most minor inconveniences. It did stop working like 2-3 times over the past few years and I had to uninstall/reinstall, but all my items were still saved and there.

The main bug is once you've added a task, it is impossible to amend it as the 'Save' button greys out and any changes you make will not be saved. A test case is to try to change a one-off task due today into a repeating daily task, it recognises the modification by changing the font to a repetitive taak, but then you click save and nothing happens. If you exit out, you see the 'discard / cancel' options only. UPDATE I've sent you all the info previously with screenshots and nothing was fixed.
replyContent: Hi Steven! Sorry to hear that 😞 Could you please share the support ticket number?

content: Simple. To the point. Tasks. Recurring tasks., no calendar, no day to day planning, and gimmicks. Feels lacking something. Though great app for minimalists.
replyContent:
Hi Altheus! We have recently released Calendar Layout, Here's more information: https://todoist.com/help/articles/use-the-calendar-layout-in-todoist-lPHRQTu0o

Please let us know what is lacking so we can find a solution for you. We can be reached via https://todoist.com/contact 🤗

content: Very good, would be even nicer if it had a timer, maybe that starts counting when you put the phone down, that way it gets less distracting.
replyContent: Hmm... Unfortunately, we don't have this feature but we do have time tracking integrations. Here's more information: https://todoist.com/help/categories/integrations/time-tracking

content: great app to organise tasks for high school however there are a lot of paid features which limit productivity. great alternative for Microsoft ToDo
replyContent: Thanks! We appreciate your feedback! 🙌

content: The app is really good if you are going to organize tasks by using priority flags. the best part is that I can use it on nearly any device. I recommend using this app for anyone who wants a more organized tasklist to focus. the only thing that I would like to come for free is the notification reminder. It would be cool as I'm a broke kid
replyContent: Hi Ethan! Thanks so much for sharing your experience! Your feedback has been noted 🙏

content: Love the app and find it very useful. But I have issues with the laptop version. I keep getting popups that a new version is loaded and will be installed on restart. But that apparently doesn't happen because I get the same popup every single day. It's annoying.
replyContent: Hi Carolyn! Thanks for your review. Could you try closing the app by clicking the Todoist icon in the top left menu and then selecting "Quit"? And then open the app after 5 minutes. The new version should installed when the app is closed. If the issue persists, please contact us via https://todoist.com/contact 🙏

content: It is quite an useful app for me. However it could be better with little upgradation in terms of quick gestures to schedule the tasks, speedy way to rearrange today's chores instead of press and hold and drag slowly.
replyContent: Hi Simran! Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us. We'd appreciate it if you could share more information with us via https://todoist.com/contact under the "Product Feedback" category. This will ensure that our product team can properly process your suggestions. We truly value your time and insights in helping us improve our product!

content: Hello, the problem is that, in the project section, when a person completes one of the options, that option is completed for everyone, while there should be the ability for each person to select that option individually. to finish or create a sign that shows how many people finish the action
replyContent: Hi Alireza! Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us. We'd appreciate it if you could submit it through https://todoist.com/contact under the "Product Feedback" category. This will ensure that our product team can properly process your suggestions. We truly value your time and insights in helping us improve our product!

content: All over by far one my favorite apps, and definitely my favorite 'to do' app. However, one odd thing: the dynamic themes don't work. Light stays light and dark stays dark, regardless of the phone setting.
replyContent: Hello Marc! We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. We apologize for the inconvenience 🙏

content: Todoist works great for keeping a couple on track together. The ability to group tasks, have automatic recurring items with natural language entry, and quickly move an over due task to a renewed due date straight from the widget are great.
replyContent: Hello! Thank you so much for sharing your experience! We really appreciate it 🤗

content: Great app. I'd like to be able to do more to rext though than just bold & italicize; I'd like to be able to underline text and strike-through text in my notes/tasks as well!!
replyContent: Hi Lisa! Thanks for your review. Unfortunately, underline text is not supported but you can strike-through text. Here's more information: https://todoist.com/help/articles/format-text-in-a-todoist-task-e5dHw9

content: The context menu of the widget does not work anymore. Using Nova launcher with Android11.
replyContent: Hello! We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. We apologize for the inconvenience 🙏

content: While in filter list, rescheduling overdue tasks is having defect. When rescheduling overdue tasks in filtered list, it reschules all others tasks also to same date. This is not required and was working fine before.
replyContent: Hello! We would like to have a deeper look into this issue. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can get in touch. We apologize for the inconvenience 🙏

content: Balanced todo app.neither less.ndither more. Due to high price and notification absent i can not use it.but like it. Suggestion: please add subscription lifetime plan only for mobile notification that too just simple pop up
replyContent: Thanks for your review! Your feedback has been noted 🙏

content: Great for keeping track of your to-do list and reminding you throughout the day.
replyContent: Thanks! We appreciate your feedback! 🙌

content: They had the best UX, really paid attention to detail. But the downfall began. Not one single issue but multiple small frustrating UX details. Still a good app though!
replyContent: Hello André! We would like to know more about these UX issues. Please send us a message via https://todoist.com/contact so we can have a deeper look. We apologize for the inconvenience 🙏

content: I personally have quite enjoyed the new update. The new task edit view makes much more sense than the old one (which looked like the default material calendar entry view). I haven't experienced most of the issues others have talked about: adding tasks quickly to Inbox is faster than ever, labels are not truncated and are much easier to assign and subtasks are now much more intuitive. Although reassigning projects is definitely cumbersome, overall it's a step in the right direction for me.

Honestly, I dont know where I would be without this app. I talk about Todoist all the time! It's easy to use, but rich in features (assigning priorities, nesting tasks, etc) -- plus the Karma feature is great for keeping me motivated. My one and only complaint is that when I'm trying to reschedule tasks, I often run into a bug that either insistently changes the due date to some random time and date, or outright refuses to change the date at all. Fix this and I'll be happy to rate 5 stars!!
replyContent: Please contact support@todoist.com with more details about this bug. Preferably - what's the old and new date of the task and to what other date did you reschedule it. This will help us find a pattern to this issue and fix it.

content: EDIT2: I have talked with support and it seemed I had the wrong Windows version (some legacy win app). Now I have the correct version and I don't feel any lag. BUT!! The new version has a downside. When you open a task, it covers almost all the tasks in your list, so you can't check info between tasks. You need to close it and then look at the list... VERY unproductive move. I hope they will consider to move the task details to the right pane as it was before on Windows. EDIT: The app's gone bad. I've been using it for over a year and it has become MEGA sluggish. Keeps syncing longer and longer after every tiny edit, I'm just waiting a lot. I will be cancelling my sub when I find a proper replacement. OLD: The best task system I have encountered. I have been searching for a system, that I would consistently use everyday and this is it. One refrain - to use this properly as everyday task system, you need the paid version. The free one is just a tease.
replyContent: Hello, sorry to hear this :( Could you please report this sync issue so we can look into it?

content: The app is really great for anyone who wants to track their tasks and goals. The menu is very pleasent looking and it's very easy to organize everything you need in their specific place. However, there some problems: The first thing being that reminders are a paid option. A to do list need to have reminders to be helpful. The second thing is that it doesn't support events, a feature that I would really like to have. Still, a great app, very easy to use and very helpful!

One of the most customizable to do apps with many features. It has a lot of alternatives and will work well for most people. However, it needs more time-efficient functions and shortcuts to deserve 5/5. It's also relatively expensive compared to its counterparts. Lastly, I'm against apps that require to create an account just to try it out (that does not affect my overall score though).
replyContent: Thank you for your review, David! We will share your feedback with the team.
